original: sgrib pa dang ni mi brtson pa //

original: bsags pa la ni ma bsags pa bar du gcod do //
analyzed: bsags pa la ni ma bsags pa bar du gcod do //

original: mos pa'i phan yon la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i phan yon la tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /

analyzed: bsod nams che dang 'gyod pa med // yid bde ba dang bde ba che ;

analyzed: bdag nyid mos pa'i ni brtan pa'o //

analyzed: ma nor ba dang // mngon du ba dang / thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa nas 'bring gi bar gyi ni khyad par du 'gro ba'o //

analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i ni bdag gi don thob pa'o //

analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs dag gis rtag @163b tu khyad par shes par bya //

analyzed: yang 'dod pa can rnams kyi mos ba ni khyi dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: rang gi don dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni bran dang 'dra //

analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang ldan pa rnams kyi ni rgyal po bzhin no //

analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis zhum par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Discouragement is not reasonable for three reasons.🔽Enlightenment is attained by humans, it is attained by countless

analyzed: bstan las mdo las gsungs pa yi // bsod nams cher 'byung thob par ltar //

translated: The basis of faith is the wise one. The object of faith is the extensive teaching of the universal vehicle. The manner of faith is the nondegeneration of faith, and the increase of faith. The result that is obtained is threefold: the increase of great merit, the increase of that faith, and the attainment of the great self of buddhahood, which is the cause of immeasurable good qualities.

analyzed: chos mngon pa bas ni lhag pa'i shes rab sgrub pa yin te /

original: 'dul bas ni chos dang don sgrub pa ste /

analyzed: des ni bag chags rtogs dang zhi ba dang // rab tu rtogs pas rnams par grol par byed //

analyzed: mdo dang chos mngon pa dang / mdor na don ni rnam bzhir 'dod //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa thob //

original: mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba de dag ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa dang / 'dul ba de dag ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The sutras, the Abhidharma, and the Vinaya, in brief,

original: so so re re zhing don rnam pa bzhi bzhi ste /
analyzed: so so re re zhing don rnam pa bzhi bzhi ste /
translated: each have four topics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams shes nas thams cad mkhyen ba nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams shes nas thams cad mkhyen ba nyid 'thob bo //
translated: The bodhisattva, having understood them, attains omniscience.

original: nyan thos kyis ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi don shes pas kyang zag pa zad pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi don shes pas kyang zag pa zad pa 'thob bo //
translated: The sravaka attains the exhaustion of defilements by understanding the meaning of a single verse.🔽It is a sutra because it mentions the bases, characteristics,

original: gnas rnams dang ni mtshan nyid dang / chos don smos phyir mdo yin no //
analyzed: gnas rnams dang ni mtshan nyid dang / chos don smos phyir mdo yin no //
translated: dharmas, and meanings.

original: mngon du'i phyir dang yang yang dang / zil gnon rtogs phyi mngon pa'i chos //
analyzed: mngon du'i phyir dang yang yang dang / zil gnon rtogs phyi mngon pa'i chos //
translated: Because of manifestation, because of repetition, because of mastery, and because of realization, there is the Abhidharma.

original: ji ltar na so so re re zhig don rnam par bzhi yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar na so so re re zhig don rnam par bzhi yin zhe na //
translated: How is it that each of them has four meanings?

original: gnas dang / mtshan nyid dang / chos dang don smos pa'i phyir mdo sde ste /
analyzed: gnas dang / mtshan nyid dang / chos dang don smos pa'i phyir mdo sde ste /
translated: The Sutra is so called because it teaches the basis, the characteristics, the doctrine, and the meaning.

original: de la gnas ni yul gang du //
analyzed: de la gnas ni yul gang du //
translated: The basis is the place where the Buddha was when he taught the Sutra.

original: gang gis gang gi phyir bshang pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang gi phyir bshang pa'o //
translated: It is the person by whom the Sutra was taught, and the reason why it was taught.

original: mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics are the characteristics of the conventional truth and the characteristics of the ultimate truth.

original: chos ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mche dang / zas dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mche dang / zas dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The doctrine is the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, foods, dependent origination, etc.

original: don ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the intention.

original: mgon du ba'i phyir dang / yang dang yang gi phyir dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir dang / rtogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mgon du ba'i phyir dang / yang dang yang gi phyir dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir dang / rtogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is so called because it manifests, because it is repeated, because it is mastered, and because it is realized.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos ni chos mngon pa ste /🔽bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / rnam par pa'i sgo la sogs pa @165a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos ni chos mngon pa ste / bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dang / rnam par pa'i sgo la sogs pa @165a * //
translated: The Abhidharma is the teaching that is directed toward nirvana.

original: ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It teaches the truths, the elements leading to enlightenment, the powers, the factors of enlightenment, the branches of the path, etc.

original: yang dang yang du ston pa'i chos ni chos mngon pa ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang du ston pa'i chos ni chos mngon pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is the teaching that is repeatedly taught,

original: chos re re la gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis mang du ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽zil gyis gnon pa'i chos ni /
analyzed: chos re re la gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis mang du ston pa'i phyir ro // zil gyis gnon pa'i chos ni /
translated: because it teaches each topic in many ways, by distinguishing material form, the immaterial, the visible, etc.

original: chos mngon pa ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is the teaching that is victorious,

original: brtsad pa dang brtsad pa'i gzhi la sogs pas phas kyi rgol ba zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsad pa dang brtsad pa'i gzhi la sogs pas phas kyi rgol ba zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is victorious over adversaries through debate and the basis of debate.

original: 'dis ni mdo sde'i don rtogs par 'gyur bas na chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mdo sde'i don rtogs par 'gyur bas na chos mngon pa'o //
translated: The Abhidharma is that by which one understands the meaning of the sutras.

original: ltung dang 'byung dang ldang ba dang // nges par 'byung dang gang zag dang / bcas pa dang ni rab dbye dang / rnam par nges phyir 'dul ba nyid //
analyzed: ltung dang 'byung dang ldang ba dang // nges par 'byung dang gang zag dang / bcas pa dang ni rab dbye dang / rnam par nges phyir 'dul ba nyid //
translated: Discipline is so called because of downfalls, origin, emergence, definite emergence, persons, proscriptions, divisions, and ascertainment.

original: ltung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / ldang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgo nas 'dul ba yin par rig par byas te /
analyzed: ltung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / ldang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgo nas 'dul ba yin par rig par byas te /
translated: It should be understood that discipline is so called because of downfalls, origin, emergence, and definite emergence.

original: de la ltung ba'i ris lnga'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba'i ris lnga'o //
translated: Therein, downfalls are of five types.

original: ltung ba rnams 'byung ba ni mi shes pa dang // nyon mongs pa mang pa dang / ma gus pa las so ;
analyzed: ltung ba rnams 'byung ba ni mi shes pa dang // nyon mongs pa mang pa dang / ma gus pa las so ;
translated: Downfalls originate from ignorance, from much affliction, and from disrespect.

original: / ltar ba ni bsam pas yin gyi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / ltar ba ni bsam pas yin gyi chad pa'i las kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Emergence is by intention, not by the act of proscription.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa bdun te //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa bdun te //
translated: Definite emergence is of seven types.

original: bshags pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa chad pa'i las khas len pa dang / bslab pa bcas pa la rnam grangs kyis gnang ba'i phyir glod pa dang / dge 'dun tshogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bag yang su byas pa'i phyir bag yangs su byas pa dang /
analyzed: bshags pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa chad pa'i las khas len pa dang / bslab pa bcas pa la rnam grangs kyis gnang ba'i phyir glod pa dang / dge 'dun tshogs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bag yang su byas pa'i phyir bag yangs su byas pa dang /
translated: The basis of training is relaxed through the Buddha's permission to transgress the rules in certain circumstances,🔽and through the Saṅgha's relaxation of the rules through a formal act of the community.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dag pho smos khyi mtshan gyu pa na ltung ba thun mong ma yin pa ni rten yongs gyur pa dang / chos kyi sdom gyi rnam pa so sor rtog pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dag pho smos khyi mtshan gyu pa na ltung ba thun mong ma yin pa ni rten yongs gyur pa dang / chos kyi sdom gyi rnam pa so sor rtog pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The basis of training is transformed through the transformation of the basis of the monk or nun, that is, the transformation of their sex organs, and through the transformation of the aspects of the vows.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa dang / bden pa mthong bas ltung ba phra mo'i yang phra mo med pa'i chos nyid thob pa'i phyir chos nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa dang / bden pa mthong bas ltung ba phra mo'i yang phra mo med pa'i chos nyid thob pa'i phyir chos nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The basis of training is obtained through the obtainment of the nature of the vows, that is, the obtainment of the nature of the vows that is free of even the slightest downfalls through perfect discernment and seeing the four truths.

original: yang don rnam par bzhis 'dul ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang don rnam par bzhis 'dul ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Again, the Vinaya should be understood through four topics:

original: gang zag las ni gang la brten nas bslab pa 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag las ni gang la brten nas bslab pa 'cha' ba'o //
translated: The basis of training is the person in dependence upon whom the training is established.

original: bcas pa las ni nam gang zag gi nyes pa gsol ba na /
analyzed: bcas pa las ni nam gang zag gi nyes pa gsol ba na /
translated: From the perspective of the Vinaya, when a person’s faults are confessed,🔽

original: ston pas dge 'dun bsdus te bslab pa 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ston pas dge 'dun bsdus te bslab pa 'cha' bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the rule, it is the rule of training that the Master promulgates after he has assembled the community, when a person has committed a transgression.

original: rab tu dbye ba las ni gang bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa la mdor bstan pa ste rnam par phye ba'o //🔽rnam par nges pa las ni de la ltung ba'am /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba las ni gang bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa la mdor bstan pa ste rnam par phye ba'o // rnam par nges pa las ni de la ltung ba'am /
translated: From the point of view of the analysis, it is the analysis of the rule of training that has been promulgated, the analysis of its meaning.

original: ltung ba med pa ni ji lta bu zhe nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni ji lta bu zhe nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of the determination, it is the determination of what is a transgression and what is not a transgression.

original: dmigs @165b pa rnyed pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //🔽dmigs pa chos dang nang dang ni //
analyzed: dmigs @165b pa rnyed pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo // dmigs pa chos dang nang dang ni //
translated: The search for the acquisition of the object has three quarters.

original: phyi dang gnyis ni yin par 'dod //🔽don gnyis kyis ni gnyis po rnyed //
analyzed: phyi dang gnyis ni yin par 'dod // don gnyis kyis ni gnyis po rnyed //
translated: The object is the teaching, the internal, the external, and both.🔽The acquisition of the two is by means of the two.

original: gnyis po dag ni me dmigs pas //
analyzed: gnyis po dag ni me dmigs pas //
translated: The non-acquisition of the two is by means of the non-acquisition of the two.

original: dmigs pa chos ni bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos ni bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object is the teaching, that is, the teaching of the Dharma.

original: lus la sogs pa ni nang dang phyi'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni nang dang phyi'o //
translated: The internal and the external are the body, etc.

original: de la 'dzin par gyur pa'i lus la sogs pa ni nang ste dmigs pa chos so //
analyzed: de la 'dzin par gyur pa'i lus la sogs pa ni nang ste dmigs pa chos so //
translated: The internal is the body, etc. which are grasped, that is, the object which is the teaching.

original: gzung ba gyur pa ni phyi'o //
analyzed: gzung ba gyur pa ni phyi'o //
translated: The external is that which is grasped.

original: de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gnyis so //
translated: The reality of those two is the second.

original: de la nang du phyi'i dmigs pa gnyis ni don gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du rnyed de //🔽gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am //
analyzed: de la nang du phyi'i dmigs pa gnyis ni don gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du rnyed de // gal te gzung ba'i don las 'dzin pa'i don tha mi dad par mthong ba'am //
translated: The two internal and external objective supports are found by means of two objects, respectively.🔽If one sees the object of apprehension as not different from the object of apprehension,

original: 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha mi dad par mthong na'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don las gzung ba'i don tha mi dad par mthong na'o //
translated: or if one sees the object of apprehension as not different from the object of apprehension.

original: phyi nang gi dmigs pa gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni de nyis nyid mi dmig spa las rig par bya'o //🔽yid kyi brjod pas bshad bzhin don /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dmigs pa gnyis po thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnyed pa ni de nyis nyid mi dmig spa las rig par bya'o // yid kyi brjod pas bshad bzhin don /
translated: The reality of all the internal and external objective supports is found by not observing those two.🔽The objective mental expression is the objective appearance

original: rab dang don du snang pa ni /
analyzed: rab dang don du snang pa ni /
translated: of the expressed object.

original: brjod las yin par rab 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: brjod las yin par rab 'dzin phyir //
translated: It is apprehended as being from the expression,

original: sems ni ming la gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems ni ming la gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: because the mind is based on names.

original: thos la sogs pa'i shes gsum gyis /
analyzed: thos la sogs pa'i shes gsum gyis /
translated: By means of the three knowledges of hearing and so forth,

original: chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: one finds the objective support of the Dharma.

original: dmigs pa rnam par gsum rnyed pa //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par gsum rnyed pa //
translated: Having found the three kinds of objective supports,

original: sngar bshad de la yang dag brten //
analyzed: sngar bshad de la yang dag brten //
translated: one should rely on them as previously explained.

original: chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa ni ;
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa rnyed pa ni ;
translated: Having found the objective support of the Dharma,

original: / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa gsum gyi gyur ro //🔽de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yid kyi brjod pa dag gi ji skad bshad pa'i don la rab tu dang ba de rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa gsum gyi gyur ro // de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yid kyi brjod pa dag gi ji skad bshad pa'i don la rab tu dang ba de rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: The three knowledges are those that arise from hearing, reflection, and meditative concentration.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed de /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed de /
translated: Among them, one acquires the knowledge that arises from hearing by means of the faith that comes from the mind’s expression in meditative concentration, because one holds to the meaning that was explained.

original: yid kyi brjod pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa dag gis so //
analyzed: yid kyi brjod pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtog pa dag gis so //
translated: The mind’s expression means the correct thoughts.

original: rab tu dang ba ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dang ba ni mos pa ste /
translated: Faith is the desire to see.

original: nges pa'o // rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'o // rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One holds to the meaning that was explained because one has faith in it.

analyzed: don du snang ba ni brjod pa las yin par rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed de ;
translated: One acquires the knowledge that arises from reflection by means of the appearance of the meaning, because one holds to the appearance as a verbal expression.

original: gal te yid kyi brjod pa kho na las don 'di snang gi //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi brjod pa kho na las don 'di snang gi //
translated: The appearance of the meaning arises from the mind’s expression, not from anything else.🔽One acquires the knowledge that arises from meditative concentration by means of the appearance of the meaning, because one holds to the appearance as a mental construct.

original: dmigs pa gnyis rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gnyis rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar yid kyi brjod pa las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong na'o //
translated: It is seen that it is not other than the verbal expression of the mind, as explained in the discovery of the two objects.

original: sems ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes bas de rnyed par rig par bya ste /🔽gnyis @166a * //
analyzed: sems ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes bas de rnyed par rig par bya ste / gnyis @166a * //

analyzed: mi dmigs pas rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa ltar gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed pa sngar bshad pa de ni chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa la yang dag par brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: yid la byed pa yongs su tshol ba las tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /

analyzed: mi gnod rten bcas gzhan yin te //

original: mos pa 'jog par byed dang gzhan //
analyzed: mos pa 'jog par byed dang gzhan //

analyzed: 'dun pa drag por byed pa dang // dman dang rdzogs rten rnam pa gnyis //

original: brjod dang bcas dang brjod med nyid //
analyzed: brjod dang bcas dang brjod med nyid //
translated: With expression and without expression.

original: shes pa dang ni mtshungs ldan pa ;
analyzed: shes pa dang ni mtshungs ldan pa ;

analyzed: / rnal 'byor rgyu bdag bcas pa dang // de ni 'dres la dmigs pa dang // ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa de //

analyzed: 'di yi yongs su shes pa lnga // rnam pa bsgom dang ldan pa ni //
translated: And the thorough knowledge of the entry into the nonapprehending🔽.🔽Its thirty-seven aspects🔽Are the four aspects of thorough knowledge,🔽The four aspects of the correct and discerning awareness of the teaching,

analyzed: bzhi dang gsum cu rtsa bdun no //

analyzed: de ni lam gnyis rang bzhin te //
translated: The path of application and the path of the adept.🔽It is of the nature of the small and the great.🔽It is of the nature of the small and the great.🔽It is of the nature of the small and the great.🔽It is of the nature of the small and the great.

analyzed: rigs nges pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang / rten rnam par dbye ba dang / mos pa 'jog par byed pa dang / 'dun pa skyed par byed pa dang // ting nge 'dzin la brten pa dang // shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: 1) definite lineage, 2) performance of action, 3) differentiation of the basis, 4) establishing devotion, 5) generating aspiration, 6) relying on samadhi, 7) being concomitant with knowledge,

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa dang / yongs su shes pa nges pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rang bzhin dang / phan yon yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa dang / yongs su shes pa nges pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rang bzhin dang / phan yon yid la byed pa dang /
translated: 8) observing the mixed, 9) observing the unmixed, 10) engaging in the aspects of full knowing and cultivation, 11) the nature of the path of calm abiding and insight, 12) keeping the benefits in mind,

original: nod par byed pa dang / sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa dang // dbang sgyur ba'i yid la byed pa dang / chung du yid la byed pa dang / rgya chen po yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: nod par byed pa dang / sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa dang // dbang sgyur ba'i yid la byed pa dang / chung du yid la byed pa dang / rgya chen po yid la byed pa'o //
translated: 13) accepting, 14) the mental attention of application, 15) the mental attention of mastery, 16) the mental attention of the small, and 17) the mental attention of the vast.

original: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs nges pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su nges pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among those, definite lineage is that which is definite in the lineage of śrāvakas and so on.

original: bya ba byed pa ni tshogs bsags pa'i gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa ni tshogs bsags pa'i gang yin pa'o //
translated: The performance of action is the accumulation of the collections.

original: rten rnam par dbye ba ni //
analyzed: rten rnam par dbye ba ni //
translated: The basis is twofold:

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa khyim na gnas pa'i rten can dang / gnod pa med pa rab tu byung ba'i rten can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa khyim na gnas pa'i rten can dang / gnod pa med pa rab tu byung ba'i rten can gang yin pa'o //
translated: the basis of the householder, which is defective, and the basis of the renunciate, which is non-defective.

original: mos pa 'jog @166b par byed pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa 'jog @166b par byed pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The establishment of devotion is the possession of recollection of the Buddha.

original: 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni de la yid ches pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni de la yid ches pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The generation of aspiration is the possession of faith in that.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /🔽rtog pa dang bcas byung ba dang bcas pa ste rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa gang yin pa ste / rtog pa dang bcas byung ba dang bcas pa ste rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med /
translated: The support of meditative concentration is the possession of the meditative concentrations of access and the actual.

original: dpyod pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa yang med pa'o //
translated: It is with conception and scrutiny, without conception but with scrutiny, and without conception and without scrutiny.🔽It is associated with knowledge, and it is associated with ignorance.

original: shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang / rnal 'byor mi shes pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyu dang / rnal 'byor mi shes pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The yoga of the bodhisattva is the yoga of the bodhisattva who is endowed with the perfections.

original: de yang go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang go rims bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they are, respectively, derived from hearing and reflection, and derived from cultivation.

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The object of mixed concentration is fivefold:

original: mdo dang sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang / nye bar gtod pa dang / ji snyed gzung ba dang / ji snyed bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo dang sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang / nye bar gtod pa dang / ji snyed gzung ba dang / ji snyed bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of concentration on the sutra, the object of concentration on the verse summary, the object of concentration on the prose summary, the object of concentration on the mnemonic, and the object of concentration on the teaching.

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa bdun te /🔽ming la dmigs pa dang / tshig la dmigs pa dang / yi ge la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pa ni tshor ba dang / chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ni rnam pa bdun te / ming la dmigs pa dang / tshig la dmigs pa dang / yi ge la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa la dmigs pa ni tshor ba dang / chos la bdag med pa la dmigs pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa dang /
translated: The object of unmixed concentration is sevenfold:

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of concentration on the name, the object of concentration on the word, the object of concentration on the letter, the object of concentration on the person as devoid of self, the object of concentration on the teaching as devoid of self, the object of concentration on material things, and the object of concentration on non-material things.

original: de la gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa ni ;
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi chos la dmigs pa ni ;
translated: The object of concentration on material things is

original: lus la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the object of concentration on the body.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la dmigs pa'o //🔽yongs su shes pa nges pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la dmigs pa'o // yongs su shes pa nges pa ni /
translated: The object of the formless is feeling, mind, and dharmas.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang ; yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu rig pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang ; yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu rig pa rnams la ste /
translated: The certainty of complete knowing is in the bases of complete knowing, the meaning of complete knowing, complete knowing itself, the result of complete knowing, and the full understanding of that.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal lo //🔽yongs su shes par bya ba'i don de nyid la /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal lo // yongs su shes par bya ba'i don de nyid la /
translated: The base of complete knowing is suffering.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of complete knowing is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self in that very base.

original: yongs su shes pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni lam mo //
translated: Complete knowing is the path.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The result of complete knowing is liberation.

original: de rab tu rig pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i //
analyzed: de rab tu rig pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i //
translated: The full understanding of that is the seeing of the wisdom of liberation.

original: sgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: sgom pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa ni /
translated: Engaging in the aspects of meditation is

original: rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa dang / rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'o //
translated: meditating on the four aspects and meditating on the thirty-seven aspects.

original: de la rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa ni //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa ni //
translated: The cultivation of the four aspects is as follows:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i @167a * //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i @167a * //
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of the person as selfless,

original: rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mthong pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mthong pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the aspects of phenomena as selfless, the cultivation of the aspects of seeing, and the cultivation of the aspects of knowing.

original: de la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the thirty-seven aspects is as follows:

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bsgom pa dang ; mi rtag pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gi dus na'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bsgom pa dang ; mi rtag pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gi dus na'o //
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of repulsiveness, suffering, impermanence, and selflessness is during the time of the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'thob pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / rten pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni yang dag par spong ba dag gi dus na'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / rten pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / gnyen po'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni yang dag par spong ba dag gi dus na'o //
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of attainment, reliance, removal, and antidote is during the time of the correct abandonings.

original: chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa sgom pa ni gang gi tshe 'dun pa skyed par byed pa na'o //🔽rnam par g-yeng ba dang / the tshom gyi gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni gang gi tshe 'bad par byed /
analyzed: chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa sgom pa ni gang gi tshe 'dun pa skyed par byed pa na'o // rnam par g-yeng ba dang / the tshom gyi gnyen po yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni gang gi tshe 'bad par byed /
translated: The cultivation of the mental attention that is the antidote to satisfaction is when one generates aspiration.🔽The cultivation of the mental attention that is the antidote to distraction and doubt is when one makes effort.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na ste /
translated: When one exerts vigor.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: In that order.

original: rgod pa'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni gang gi tse sems rab tu 'dzin pa na'o //
analyzed: rgod pa'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni gang gi tse sems rab tu 'dzin pa na'o //
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of samādhi that are the antidotes to agitation is when one holds the mind.

original: zhub pa'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: zhub pa'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the aspects of samādhi that are the antidotes to laxity is

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa na ste /
translated: when one properly stabilizes the mind.

original: 'di dang ni go rims bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po dag gi dus na rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang ni go rims bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po dag gi dus na rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the times of the four bases of magic power in that order.

original: sems gnas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / ji ltar yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa de bzhin du 'bad pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: sems gnas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / ji ltar yid ches pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa de bzhin du 'bad pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of conviction in the excellence of the supramundane mind's stability, the cultivation of the aspect of striving in the same way as the cultivation of the aspect of conviction, the cultivation of the aspect of non-forgetfulness of the teaching,

original: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni dbang po dag gi dus na'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni dbang po dag gi dus na'o //
translated: the cultivation of the aspect of the mind's stability, and the cultivation of the aspect of thorough analysis occur during the stage of the faculties.

original: yid la byed pa lnga po de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni stobs dag gi dus na'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa lnga po de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ni stobs dag gi dus na'o //
translated: The cultivation of those very five aspects of attention, which are the abandonment of the resistances, occurs during the stage of the powers.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu snang ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / de nyid la rnam par 'byed pa dang / spro ba dang / yid bde ba dang / las su rung ba dang / sems gnas pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi yang lag bdun dag gi dus na'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu snang ba'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / de nyid la rnam par 'byed pa dang / spro ba dang / yid bde ba dang / las su rung ba dang / sems gnas pa dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi yang lag bdun dag gi dus na'o //
translated: The cultivation of the aspect of the manifestation of perfect enlightenment, the cultivation of the aspect of thorough analysis of that, the cultivation of the aspect of delight in it, the cultivation of the aspect of mental fitness, the cultivation of the aspect of the mind's stability, and the cultivation of the aspect of equanimity occur during the stage of the branches of enlightenment.

original: thob par nges pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / yongs su sbyongs ba'i sa shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / gzhan la go @167b bar byed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la zhugs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: thob par nges pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / yongs su sbyongs ba'i sa shes pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / gzhan la go @167b bar byed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la zhugs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang /
translated: the aspect of meditation on the certainty of attainment, the aspect of meditation on the knowledge of the stage of thorough purification, the aspect of meditation on the understanding of others, the aspect of meditation on the practice of morality pleasing to the noble ones,

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul kun tu spyod pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / sngon bsgoms pas thob pa'i lam goms pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos la gnas pa'i rgya mtshan mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la sems gnas pas gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i tshul kun tu spyod pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / sngon bsgoms pas thob pa'i lam goms pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / chos la gnas pa'i rgya mtshan mi brjed pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la sems gnas pas gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: the aspect of meditation on the practice of the way of few desires, the aspect of meditation on the path obtained through previous meditation, the aspect of meditation on the sign of the nondisappearance of the basis in the Dharma, and the aspect of meditation on the transformation of the basis through the mind abiding in signlessness.

original: lam gyi yan lag gi dus na'o //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gi dus na'o //
translated: These are at the time of the branches of the path.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom ba lam gyi rang bzhin dag la ni bshad pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom ba lam gyi rang bzhin dag la ni bshad pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no explanation of the nature of the path, which is the meditation on serenity and insight.

original: phan yon yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phan yon yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attentiveness to benefit is twofold:

original: gnas ngan len sel ba dang / lta ba'i mtshan sel ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len sel ba dang / lta ba'i mtshan sel ba'o //
translated: the elimination of negative tendencies and the elimination of the signs of conceptualization.

original: nod par byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams las chos kyi rgyun gyi gdams ngag nod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nod par byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams las chos kyi rgyun gyi gdams ngag nod par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mental attention of receiving is that which receives the instructions of the Dharma stream from the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The mental attention of application is fivefold:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la grangs nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni gang gis mdo la sogs pa la ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i grangs nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul la grangs nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni gang gis mdo la sogs pa la ming dang / tshig dang yi ge'i grangs nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the investigation of number is that by which one investigates the number of names, words, and letters in the sutras, etc.

original: gnas pa nye bar rtog par sbyor ba pa ni gang gis gnas rnam pa gnyis nye bar rtog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa nye bar rtog par sbyor ba pa ni gang gis gnas rnam pa gnyis nye bar rtog par byed pa ste /
translated: The application of the investigation of location is that by which one investigates the two kinds of location.

original: tshad yod par gnas pa ni yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: tshad yod par gnas pa ni yi ge rnams so //
translated: The location of limited extent is the letters.

original: tshad med par gnas pa ni ming dang tshig dag go //
analyzed: tshad med par gnas pa ni ming dang tshig dag go //
translated: The location of unlimited extent is the names and words.

original: kun tu rtog pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba pa ni //
translated: The application of the investigation of conceptualization is that by which one investigates the conceptualization of the three kinds of letters, names, and words.

original: gang gis gnyis la brten nas gnyis su kun tu rtog pa nye bar rtog par byed pa ste /🔽ming du kun tu rtog pa la brten nas don du kun tu rtog pa dang / don du kun tu rtog pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis la brten nas gnyis su kun tu rtog pa nye bar rtog par byed pa ste / ming du kun tu rtog pa la brten nas don du kun tu rtog pa dang / don du kun tu rtog pa la brten nas /
translated: It is the imagination of the unreal that imagines duality on the basis of the two.

original: ming du kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ming du kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: On the basis of the imagination of the name, there is the imagination of the referent, and on the basis of the imagination of the referent, there is the imagination of the name.

original: yi ge ni kun brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ni kun brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The letters are not imagined.

original: rim pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba ni gang gi ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa nye bar rtog pa sbyor ba ni gang gi ming 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don 'dzin pa la 'jug pa nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the imagination of the sequence is the imagination that engages in the apprehension of the referent preceded by the apprehension of the name.

original: rtogs pa sbyor ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa sbyor ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The application of the realization should be understood as elevenfold.

original: glo bur ba nyid rtogs pa dang / snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa dang / don mi dmigs pa rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rtogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: glo bur ba nyid rtogs pa dang / snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa dang / don mi dmigs pa rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rtogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang /
translated: The realization of adventitiousness, the realization of the sign of appearance, the realization of the nonapprehension of the referent, the realization of the nonapprehension of apprehension, the realization of the dharmadhatu, the realization of the selflessness of persons,

original: chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang / bsam pa dman pa rtogs pa dang / yangs shing bdag nyid chen po'i @168a * //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang / bsam pa dman pa rtogs pa dang / yangs shing bdag nyid chen po'i @168a * //
translated: the realization of the absence of self in phenomena, the realization of inferior states of mind and the realization of the vast and the great self.🔽

original: bsam pa rtogs pa dang / ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa dang / chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rtogs pa dang / ji ltar rtogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa dang / chos rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: understanding the selflessness of phenomena, understanding the inferior attitude, understanding the attitude of the great being, understanding the arrangement of the teachings as they are understood, and understanding the arrangement of the teachings.

original: dbang bsgyur ba'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang bsgyur ba'i yid la byed pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The mental attention of mastery is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shin tu rnams par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa shin tu rnams par dag pa'o //
translated: the mastery of the purification of the obstacle of the passions, the mastery of the purification of the obstacle to omniscience, and the mastery of the purification of the accomplishment of excellences.

original: chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //🔽rtag tu gnyis bral 'khrul pa'i rten gang yin dang gang zhig rnam kun du //
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi don yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so // rtag tu gnyis bral 'khrul pa'i rten gang yin dang gang zhig rnam kun du //
translated: Two verses on the investigation of the meaning of reality🔽. That which is always devoid of duality, the basis of error, and that which is inexpressible and nonconceptual,

original: brjod par nus ma yin zhing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na //
analyzed: brjod par nus ma yin zhing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na //
translated: is reality.

original: shes bya spangs bya rang bzhin dri med 'dod gang rnam par sbyangs bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya spangs bya rang bzhin dri med 'dod gang rnam par sbyangs bya ste /
translated: The object to be known, the object to be relinquished, and the naturally stainless are asserted to be the object of purification.

original: de ni nam mkha' gser dang chu ltar nyon mongs pa las rnams dag 'dod //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' gser dang chu ltar nyon mongs pa las rnams dag 'dod //
translated: The afflictions and actions are asserted to be purified like space, gold, and water.

original: de kho na nyid rtag tu gnyis dang bral ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo ro bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtag tu gnyis dang bral ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo ro bo nyid yin te /
translated: The reality that is always free from duality is the imagined nature,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du gtan me dpa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du gtan me dpa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is absolutely devoid of the character of object and subject.

original: /'khrul pa'i rten ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: /'khrul pa'i rten ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The dependent is the basis of error,

original: des der kun tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des der kun tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is imagined as that.

original: brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is the inexpressible and non-conceptual nature.

original: de la de kho na nyid dang po ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid dang po ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Among these, the first reality is the object to be known.

original: gnyis pa ni spangs bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spangs bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The second is the object to be relinquished.

original: gsum pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma las rnam par sbyang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma las rnam par sbyang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The third is the object to be purified from adventitious contaminants,

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag go //
translated: because it is naturally pure.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang gser ba chu lta bur nyon mongs pa las rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' dang gser ba chu lta bur nyon mongs pa las rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: That which is pure by nature is pure of afflictions like space, gold, and water.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Space, etc., are not impure by nature.

original: de dag glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas rnam par dag par mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas rnam par dag par mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that they are not accepted as pure by being free from adventitious stains.

original: 'gro ba dag na de las gzhan yang cung zad yod min la //
analyzed: 'gro ba dag na de las gzhan yang cung zad yod min la //
translated: There is nothing else at all in the world apart from that.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la kun tu rmongs pa'i blo //🔽yod pa kun nas spangs te med la mngon zhen gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la kun tu rmongs pa'i blo // yod pa kun nas spangs te med la mngon zhen gang yin pa //
translated: And the minds of all beings are completely confused about that.

original: 'jig rten rmongs pa'i rnam pa tshabs chen 'di go ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'jig rten rmongs pa'i rnam pa tshabs chen 'di go ji lta bu //
translated: How is it that the world is so confused about this,🔽completely abandoning what exists and fixating on what does not exist?

original: 'jig rten na chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu las gzhan ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de lta bu las gzhan ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: In the world, there is nothing at all apart from the nature of phenomena,

original: chos nyid dang chos tha mi dang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos tha mi dang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of phenomena and phenomena are not different.

original: lhag pa ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag pa ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: de kho na nyid la sgyur ma lta bu yongs su tshol ba'i tshig su bcad pa @168b bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la sgyur ma lta bu yongs su tshol ba'i tshig su bcad pa @168b bco lnga'o //
translated: Fifteen verses investigating the illusion-like reality

original: ji ltar sgyu ma de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma de bzhin du /
translated: Just as an illusion is,

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog brjod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog brjod //
translated: so is the imagination of what is unreal described.

original: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bar //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bar //
translated: Just as an illusory creation is,

original: de bzhin gnyis su 'khrul ba brjod //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyis su 'khrul ba brjod //
translated: so is the error of duality described.

original: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyis btab pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyis btab pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the causes of error are the sticks, clods, and so on, which are enchanted by the spells of the magician, so is the imagination of what is unreal, the dependent nature, to be understood.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma de la sgyu ma byas pa rta dang glang po che dang gser la sogs pa'i gzugs de'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa de la gnyis su 'khrul pa gzung ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma de la sgyu ma byas pa rta dang glang po che dang gser la sogs pa'i gzugs de'i ngo bor snang ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa de la gnyis su 'khrul pa gzung ba dang /
translated: Just as in that illusion the illusory creation appears in the form of horses, elephants, gold, and so on, so in that imagination of what is unreal the error of duality appears as the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba ku brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba ku brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: The appearance as the apprehended and apprehender should be known as the imagined identity.

original: ji ltar de la de med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar de la de med pa //
translated: As it does not exist in that way,

original: de bzhin du ni don dam 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni don dam 'dod //
translated: so is the ultimate asserted.

original: ji ltar de ni dmigs pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni dmigs pa ltar //
translated: As it is perceived in that way,

original: de bzhin du ni kun rdzob nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni kun rdzob nyid //
translated: so is the conventional.

original: ji ltar de la de mad pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de la de mad pa ste /
translated: As it does not exist in that way,

original: sgyu ma byas pa de la glang po che la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang de la kun brtags pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa la don dam par 'dod do //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa de la glang po che la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang de la kun brtags pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa la don dam par 'dod do //
translated: just as an elephant created by magic does not exist as an elephant, so the dependent nature is asserted to be the ultimate, since it does not have the character of the duality of the imagined.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as an elephant created by magic is perceived as the entity of an elephant,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa da kun rdzob kyi bden par dmigs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa da kun rdzob kyi bden par dmigs so //
translated: so the imagined, which is not real, is perceived as the conventional truth.

original: de med na ni de yi rgyu //
analyzed: de med na ni de yi rgyu //
translated: If that did not exist,

original: gsal bar dmigs pa ji ltar bar //
analyzed: gsal bar dmigs pa ji ltar bar //
translated: how could the clear perception of that🔽occur?

original: de bzhin gnas ni gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: de bzhin gnas ni gzhan gyur na //
translated: In the same way, when the basis is transformed,

original: yang dag ma yin rtog pa dmigs //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rtog pa dmigs //
translated: the perception of the unreal imagination occurs.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de med na de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa'i don yang dag pa gsal bar dmigs pa de bzhin du gnas gzhan du gyur na gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i don yang dag🔽par dmigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de med na de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa'i don yang dag pa gsal bar dmigs pa de bzhin du gnas gzhan du gyur na gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i don yang dag par dmigs so //
translated: Just as when the illusion is absent, the object of the illusion, the stick and so on, is perceived as real, so when the basis is transformed, the object of unreal imagination is perceived as real, because the error of duality is absent.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten ma 'khrul ba //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten ma 'khrul ba //
translated: Just as the non-deluded

original: de yi rgyu la 'dod dgur spyod //
analyzed: de yi rgyu la 'dod dgur spyod //
translated: act freely with regard to the cause of the illusion,

original: de bzhin sdom brtson ma 'khrul ba //
analyzed: de bzhin sdom brtson ma 'khrul ba //
translated: so the non-deluded one who is diligent in the vow

original: gnas gzhan gyur la dgyes dgur spyod //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyur la dgyes dgur spyod //
translated: acts freely with regard to the transformation of the basis.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten ma 'khrul ba de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa 'dong dgur rang dbang du spyod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten ma 'khrul ba de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa 'dong dgur rang dbang du spyod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the non-deluded person acts freely and independently with regard to the cause of the illusion, the stick and so on,

original: 'phags pa 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba yang gnas gzhan du gyur pa la 'dod dgur dang dbang du spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba yang gnas gzhan du gyur pa la 'dod dgur dang dbang du spyod do //
translated: so the noble one who is not deluded acts freely and independently with regard to the transformation of the basis.

original: de lta bu ni de la yod //
analyzed: de lta bu ni de la yod //
translated: That exists in that way,

original: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: but its reality does not exist.

original: de ltas sgyu ma la sogs pa //
analyzed: de ltas sgyu ma la sogs pa //
translated: Therefore, illusion and so on

original: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
translated: are said to exist and not exist.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do //🔽de la yod pa med ma yin //🔽med pa yod pa @169a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do // de la yod pa med ma yin // med pa yod pa @169a * //
translated: The meaning of this verse is self-evident.🔽It is not that what exists does not exist.

original: nyid ma yin //
analyzed: nyid ma yin //
translated: It is not that what does not exist exists.

original: sgyu ma dag la sogs pa la //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag la sogs pa la //
translated: In illusions and so on,

original: yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod //
analyzed: yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod //
translated: the difference between existence and nonexistence is denied.

original: de la yod pa na med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yod pa na med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that what exists does not exist.

original: de lta bur yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: What exists in that way does not not exist.

original: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not that what does not exist exists.

original: glang po che la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no /
translated: What does not exist as an elephant and so on does not exist.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa de dag khyad par med par yang brjod do //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa de dag khyad par med par yang brjod do //
translated: The existence and nonexistence of illusions and so on are denied to be different.

original: de la de ltar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che la sogs par med par yin la /
analyzed: de la de ltar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che la sogs par med par yin la /
translated: What exists in that way is just what does not exist as an elephant and so on.

original: glang po che la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de nyid de nyid de lta bur yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de nyid de nyid de lta bur yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: What does not exist as an elephant and so on is just what exists in that way.

original: de bzhin gnyis snang de la yod //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyis snang de la yod //
translated: In the same way, duality appears there,

original: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: but its reality does not exist.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: Thus, in regard to form, etc.

original: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
translated: existence and non-existence are expressed.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa 'di la gnyis su snang ba ni yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa 'di la gnyis su snang ba ni yod do //
translated: And so, in this imagination of what is unreal, the appearance of duality exists,

original: gnyis kyi ngos po med do /
analyzed: gnyis kyi ngos po med do /
translated: but the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject does not exist.

original: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yi pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yi pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa nyid brjod do //
translated: Thus, in regard to the own-being of the imagination of what is unreal, existence and non-existence are expressed in regard to form, etc.

original: de la yod pa med ma yin //
analyzed: de la yod pa med ma yin //
translated: Therein, existence is not non-existence,

original: med pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: med pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: and non-existence is not existence.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni //
translated: In regard to form, etc.

original: yod med khyad par che 'bang brjod //🔽de la yod pa nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod med khyad par che 'bang brjod // de la yod pa nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: existence and non-existence are expressed as being without distinction.

original: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa'o ;🔽/ med pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa'o ; / med pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therein, existence is not non-existence, because the appearance of duality exists.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-existence is not existence, because the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject does not exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa khyad par med pa yang brjod de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa dang med pa khyad par med pa yang brjod de /
translated: Existence and non-existence are expressed as being without distinction in regard to form, etc.

original: gnyis po snang bar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyi dngos por med pa ma yin pas so //🔽sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa yi ;
analyzed: gnyis po snang bar yod pa gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyi dngos por med pa ma yin pas so // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa yi ;
translated: That which appears as the duality does not not exist as the thingness of the duality.🔽The extremes of superimposition and denial

original: / mtha' rnams dgag par bya phyir dang // theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dag //🔽dgag par bya phyir 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: / mtha' rnams dgag par bya phyir dang // theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dag // dgag par bya phyir 'dod pa yin //
translated: are to be refuted, and also going by the Hīnayāna.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa dang med pa dag gcig tu chad pa dang / khyad par med pa 'dir yang 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa dang med pa dag gcig tu chad pa dang / khyad par med pa 'dir yang 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it asserted that existence and nonexistence are not to be taken as one extreme and their absence as another?

original: go rims bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dgag par bya ba'i phyir dang / theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin te /
translated: It is asserted in order to refute, respectively, the extremes of superimposition and denial, and also in order to refute going by the Hīnayāna.

original: med pa la med pa nyid du rig nas sgro 'dogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: med pa la med pa nyid du rig nas sgro 'dogs par mi byed do //
translated: For, having understood that nonexistence is nonexistence, one does not superimpose existence on it.

original: yod pa la yod pa nyid du rig nas skur ba 'debs par mi byed do //
analyzed: yod pa la yod pa nyid du rig nas skur ba 'debs par mi byed do //
translated: Having understood that existence is existence, one does not deny it.

original: de gnyis khyad par med pa nyid du rig nas yod pas yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis khyad par med pa nyid du rig nas yod pas yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Having understood that the two are not different, one does not become disgusted with existence.

original: de @169b lta bas na theg pa dman pas nges par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de @169b lta bas na theg pa dman pas nges par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, one does not definitely emerge by means of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: 'khrul ba'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni //
translated: The cause of error and error itself

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gzugs can min rnams rig par 'dod //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gzugs can min rnams rig par 'dod //
translated: are held to be the perception of form and the perception of what is formless.

original: med phyir cig shos kyang med 'gyur //
analyzed: med phyir cig shos kyang med 'gyur //
translated: Because the one does not exist, the other does not exist either.

original: gzugs su 'khrul ba'i rgyun rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs su 'khrul ba'i rgyun rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yin la /
translated: The perception that is the cause of the error of form is the perception of form.

original: gzugs su 'khrul pa gang yi pa de ni gzugs can ma yi pa'i rnam par rig pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzugs su 'khrul pa gang yi pa de ni gzugs can ma yi pa'i rnam par rig pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: The error of form is held to be the perception of what is formless.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir cig shos gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med de //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir cig shos gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med de //
translated: Because the perception of form does not exist, the other, the perception of what is formless, does not exist either.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause.

original: sgyur ma'i glang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sgyur ma'i glang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa /
translated: The perception of the form of an illusory elephant

original: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste //
translated: is said to be twofold because of error.

original: de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang //
analyzed: de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang //
translated: Although there is no duality there,

original: gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs //
analyzed: gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs //
translated: it is perceived as a duality.

original: keng rus kyi ni gzugs 'dzin pa //
analyzed: keng rus kyi ni gzugs 'dzin pa //
translated: The perception of the form of a skeleton

original: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste /
translated: Because of delusion, duality is spoken of.

original: de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang //
analyzed: de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang //
translated: Although it is nondual as it is,

original: gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs //
analyzed: gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs //
translated: it is perceived as dual.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'khrul pa las gzung pa dang // 'dzin pa gnyis su brjod de /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i 'khrul pa las gzung pa dang // 'dzin pa gnyis su brjod de /
translated: From the delusion of grasping the illusory form of an elephant, the duality of the grasped and the grasper is spoken of.

original: de la gnyis po ji lta bar med kyang gnyis su rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: de la gnyis po ji lta bar med kyang gnyis su rnam par dmigs so //
translated: Although there is no duality as it is, it is perceived as dual.

original: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan yid la byed pa'i der 'dzin pa yang 'khrul pa las gnyis su brjod de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan yid la byed pa'i der 'dzin pa yang 'khrul pa las gnyis su brjod de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The same goes for the grasping of the mental image of a skeleton.

original: 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid chos gang yin //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i mtshan nyid chos gang yin //
translated: Whatever phenomena have the characteristic of delusion

original: de bzhin yod dbang de bzhin med //
analyzed: de bzhin yod dbang de bzhin med //
translated: exist in that way and do not exist in that way.

original: yod med khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod med khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no distinction between existence and nonexistence,

original: yod dang med dang sgyu ma 'dra //
analyzed: yod dang med dang sgyu ma 'dra //
translated: they exist, do not exist, and are like illusions.

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo nyid gang nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni yod pa dang med pa dang sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo nyid gang nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni yod pa dang med pa dang sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Whatever phenomena have the characteristic of delusion, which are the nature of the adverse factors, exist, do not exist, and are like illusions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du de bzhin yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du de bzhin yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin no //
translated: It is existent because it exists in that way as unreal imagination.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du de bzhin med pa'i phyir med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du de bzhin med pa'i phyir med pa yin no //
translated: It is nonexistent because it does not exist in that way as subject and object.

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: It is neither existent nor nonexistent because those two, existence and nonexistence, are not different.

original: yod pa yang ma yin la //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin la //
translated: It is not existent.

original: med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste ;
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste ;
translated: The characteristics of illusion are like that.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is like an illusion.

original: gnyen po'i chos ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos ni gang yin pa //
translated: The characteristics of the Dharma of the antidote

original: de bzhin med dang de bzhin yod //
analyzed: de bzhin med dang de bzhin yod //
translated: are nonexistence in that way and existence in that way.

original: de bzhin med phyir mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: de bzhin med phyir mtshan nyid med //
translated: Because of nonexistence in that way, there are no characteristics.

original: sgyu ma dang yang 'dra bar bstan //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang yang 'dra bar bstan //
translated: It is taught to be like an illusion.

original: gnyen po'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa gang dag yin pa de @170a * //
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa gang dag yin pa de @170a * //
translated: Those Dharmas of the antidote taught by the Buddha, such as the applications of mindfulness,

original: dag kyang mtshan nyid med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur bstan to //
analyzed: dag kyang mtshan nyid med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bur bstan to //
translated: are also taught to be without characteristics and to be like an illusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis bzung ba de bzhin med pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar bshad pa de ltar yod pa'i phyir dang / je ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis lhums su 'jug pa dang / bltams pa dang // mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sogs pa kun tu bstan pa de bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis bzung ba de bzhin med pa'i phyir dang / ji ltar bshad pa de ltar yod pa'i phyir dang / je ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis lhums su 'jug pa dang / bltams pa dang // mngon par 'byung ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sogs pa kun tu bstan pa de bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not exist as they are grasped by the foolish, because they do exist as they are explained, and because they do not exist as they are demonstrated by the Lord in his descent into the womb, birth, leaving home, and manifest perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Thus they are without own-being.

original: yod pa ma yin yang yod pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin yang yod pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: And although they do not exist, they appear as if they do.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore they are like illusions.

original: dpe'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: dpe'i don du tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the meaning of the similes:

original: sgyu ma'i rgyal po sgyur ma yin //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rgyal po sgyur ma yin //
translated: The illusory king is not illusory,

original: rgyal po gzhan gyis pham pa ltar //
analyzed: rgyal po gzhan gyis pham pa ltar //
translated: but is vanquished by another illusory king.🔽So it is with the Bodhisattvas

original: gang dag gis ni chos mthong ba'i //🔽rgyal sras de dag nga rgyal med //
analyzed: gang dag gis ni chos mthong ba'i // rgyal sras de dag nga rgyal med //
translated: who see reality and are without pride.

original: gnyen po'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag ni sgyu ma'i rgyal po lta bu ste /
translated: The antidotes are like the illusory king,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa spang bar bya'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the afflictions,

original: rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: and in order to control purification.

original: / kun nas nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dpe'i don gyis rgyal po lta bu yin te /
analyzed: / kun nas nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dpe'i don gyis rgyal po lta bu yin te /
translated: And those afflictions are like kings in the sense of being like examples,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they control the establishment of the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa pham par byed pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa pham par byed pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the afflictions are defeated by those antidotes,

original: rgyal pos rgyal po 'bebs pa lta bur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal pos rgyal po 'bebs pa lta bur blta bar bya ste /
translated: just as a king is defeated by another king.

original: de shes pas phyogs gnyis ka la byang chub sems dpa' rnams nga rgyal me dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shes pas phyogs gnyis ka la byang chub sems dpa' rnams nga rgyal me dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing that, the bodhisattvas do not become proud about either of the two sides.

original: sangs rgyas rnams sangs rgyas mchog rnams kyis de dang de las 'dus byas dag / gsungs pa sgyu ma rmi lam smig rgyu gzugs brnyan dang 'dra mig yor dang / brag ca lta bu dang ni chu zla'i gzugs 'dra sprul dang 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams sangs rgyas mchog rnams kyis de dang de las 'dus byas dag / gsungs pa sgyu ma rmi lam smig rgyu gzugs brnyan dang 'dra mig yor dang / brag ca lta bu dang ni chu zla'i gzugs 'dra sprul dang 'drar shes bya //
translated: The Buddhas, the best of men, have said that all conditioned things are like illusions, like dreams, like mirages, like reflections of forms, like optical illusions, like echoes, like the city of the Gandharvas, and like magical incarnations.

original: drug dang drug dang gnyis dang drug tshan gnyis dang gsum po re rer 'dod //
analyzed: drug dang drug dang gnyis dang drug tshan gnyis dang gsum po re rer 'dod //
translated: Six, six, two, two sets of six, and three are asserted for each.🔽The Blessed One said that things are like illusions, up to and like emanations.

original: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas sprul ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa de la chos rnam sgyur ma lta bu ni nang gi skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba nas sprul ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa de la chos rnam sgyur ma lta bu ni nang gi skye mched drug ste /
translated: Things that are like illusions are the six internal sense spheres,

original: bdag dang srog la sogs pa med bzhin du de ltar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang srog la sogs pa med bzhin du de ltar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear as such, although there is no self, no life-force, and so on.

original: rmi lam lta bu ni phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu ni phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
translated: Those that are like dreams are the six external sense spheres,

original: de nye bar spyad pa'i dngos por med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar spyad pa'i dngos por med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist as things that are enjoyed.

original: smig rgyu lta bu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gnyis te /
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gnyis te /
translated: Those that are like mirages are the two, mind and mental factors,

original: 'khrul bar byed pa'i @170b phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'khrul bar byed pa'i @170b phyir ro ;
translated: because they cause error.

original: / yang gzugs brnyan lta bu ni nang gi skye mched drug kho na ste /
analyzed: / yang gzugs brnyan lta bu ni nang gi skye mched drug kho na ste /
translated: Those that are like reflections are the six internal sense spheres,

original: sngon gyi las kyi gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are reflections of former karma.
