original: mig yor lta bu ni //
analyzed: mig yor lta bu ni //
translated: Those that are like emanations are the six external sense spheres,🔽because they are emanated by the power of karma.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grib ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grib ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are like the shadows of the internal sense bases.

original: phyi'i skye mched dru kho na ste /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched dru kho na ste /
translated: The external sense bases are only the two groups of six.

original: de'i dbang gis 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'byung bas so //
translated: Because they arise from those.

original: dru tshan gnyis su 'dod pa ni drug tshan gnyis su 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dru tshan gnyis su 'dod pa ni drug tshan gnyis su 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The two groups of six are the two groups of six sense bases.

original: brag ca lta bu ni bshad pa'i chos rnams so //🔽chu zla'i gzugs lta bu ni //
analyzed: brag ca lta bu ni bshad pa'i chos rnams so // chu zla'i gzugs lta bu ni //
translated: The Dharma that is taught is like an echo.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i chos rnams te /🔽ting nge 'dzin ni dad pa nyid kyis chu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i chos rnams te / ting nge 'dzin ni dad pa nyid kyis chu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma that is based on meditative concentration is like a reflection in the mirror.

original: sbrul ba lta bu ni //
analyzed: sbrul ba lta bu ni //
translated: Because meditative concentration is like a mirror, in the sense that it is clear and lucid.🔽The Dharma that is based on the perfections is like an emanation.

original: bsams bzhin du srid bar skye ba yongs su len pa yin te /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid bar skye ba yongs su len pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the taking up of birth in existence in whatever way is suitable.

original: bya ba thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the application to all actions without affliction.

original: shes bya yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //🔽yang dag min rtog yang dag min //
analyzed: shes bya yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa // yang dag min rtog yang dag min //
translated: A verse on the investigation of the knowable🔽False imagination is not real,

original: yang dag ma yin min mi rtog / rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin min mi rtog / rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa //
translated: Nor is it unreal, nor both, nor devoid of both.

original: shes bya thams cad yin par brjod //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad yin par brjod //
translated: It is said that all objects of knowledge are included in these four.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa ni //
translated: Unreal imagination is

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rnams par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rnams par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: imagination that is not in accord with supramundane wisdom.

original: yang dag pa yang ma yin la //
analyzed: yang dag pa yang ma yin la //
translated: Neither real nor unreal is

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni de'i rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bar gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni de'i rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bar gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is in accord with it, up to the stage of penetration.

original: mi rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni de bzhin nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Nonimagination is suchness and supramundane wisdom.

original: rtog pa yang ma yin mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni 'ji rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang ma yin mi rtog pa yang ma yin pa ni 'ji rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Neither imagination nor nonimagination is mundane wisdom obtained subsequently to the supramundane.

original: shes bya thams cad ni de tsam du zad do //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad ni de tsam du zad do //
translated: All objects of knowledge are included in these four.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnams par byang ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnams par byang ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the investigation of defilement and purification.

original: rang gi khams las gnyis snang zhing //
analyzed: rang gi khams las gnyis snang zhing //
translated: From its own realm, duality appears,

original: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig tu //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with ignorance and the afflictions,🔽the conceptualization that engages

original: 'jug pa'i rnam rtog rang 'byung ste //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam rtog rang 'byung ste //
translated: arises by itself,

original: rdzas gnyis rnam par spangs pa yi //🔽rang gi khams las zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rdzas gnyis rnam par spangs pa yi // rang gi khams las zhes bya ba ni //
translated: free from the two kinds of substance.

original: rang gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las so //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las so //
translated: “From its own realm” means from the seed, which is the store consciousness.

original: gnyis su snang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su snang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang pa'o //
translated: “Dualistic appearance” means the appearance of the grasped and the grasper.

original: ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang // lhan cig 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni //🔽'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas na 'di dag @171a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang // lhan cig 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni // 'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas na 'di dag @171a * //
translated: “Together with ignorance and the afflictions” means🔽that these are associated with ignorance and the afflictions.

original: ni ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ni ma rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They are associated with ignorance and the afflictions because they are associated with ignorance and the afflictions.

original: rdzas gnyis spangs pa ni //
analyzed: rdzas gnyis spangs pa ni //
translated: “Free from the two kinds of substance” means

original: gzungs ba'i rdzas dang / 'dzin pa'i rdzas te /
analyzed: gzungs ba'i rdzas dang / 'dzin pa'i rdzas te /
translated: free from the substance of the grasped and the substance of the grasper.🔽Thus, the afflictions should be sought.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: The purification of the afflictions should be understood in terms of the following:

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa yi //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa yi //
translated: The attainment of the distinctive object,

original: rang gi dbyings la gnas ldan phyir //
analyzed: rang gi dbyings la gnas ldan phyir //
translated: the abiding in one’s own realm,🔽and the non-arising of the seeds.

original: de nyid gnyis su snang med par //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su snang med par //
translated: It enters into the non-appearance of duality,

original: 'jug ste pags dang mda' bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug ste pags dang mda' bzhin no //
translated: like the skin and the arrow.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The attainment of the special objective is

original: chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed pa dang yin pa ste /
translated: the attainment of the objective of the Dharma,

original: de ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: which has already been explained.

original: rang gi dbyings la gnas ldan phyir /
analyzed: rang gi dbyings la gnas ldan phyir /
translated: Because it is endowed with the stability in its own realm,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: rang gi dbyings ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi dbyings ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: the own realm of the conceptualizations is suchness.

original: de la gnas pa ni ming la sems gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni ming la sems gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Stability in it is because the mind is stable in the name.

original: ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni goms pas sgom pa'i lam dang ngo //
analyzed: ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni goms pas sgom pa'i lam dang ngo //
translated: Endowment is because of cultivation in the path of meditation.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gnyis su snang ba med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa de nyid gnyis su snang ba med par 'jug ste /
translated: That conceptualization of the revolution of the basis enters into the non-appearance of duality,

original: pags pa dang mda' bzhin no //
analyzed: pags pa dang mda' bzhin no //
translated: like the skin and the arrow.

original: ji ltar pags pa de nyid khengs pa dang bral bas mnyen por 'gyur ba dang / mda' de nyid mes bsros pa dang drang por 'gyur pa de bzhin du zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pa dag gis sems dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba thob na gnas gzhan du gyur pa rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid yang gnyis su snang bar mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar pags pa de nyid khengs pa dang bral bas mnyen por 'gyur ba dang / mda' de nyid mes bsros pa dang drang por 'gyur pa de bzhin du zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pa dag gis sems dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba thob na gnas gzhan du gyur pa rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid yang gnyis su snang bar mi 'jug ste /
translated: Just as the skin, when it is free from swelling, becomes supple, and just as the arrow, when it is heated and straightened, becomes straight, so too, when the mind and wisdom are liberated by the cultivation of serenity and transcendent insight, those very concepts do not engage in the appearance of duality.

original: de ltar rnam par byang ba yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par byang ba yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Thus should the purification of the container consciousness be sought.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su chol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su chol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the investigation of mere representation

original: sems ni gnyis su snang ba ste //
analyzed: sems ni gnyis su snang ba ste //
translated: The mind appears as a duality,

original: de bzhin chags sogs snang ba'am //🔽dad la sogs par snang bar 'dod //
analyzed: de bzhin chags sogs snang ba'am // dad la sogs par snang bar 'dod //
translated: As form, etc., or as faith, etc.🔽It is held that there is no reality

original: nyon mongs dge chos yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs dge chos yod ma yin //
translated: Of the passions or of the virtuous natures.

original: sems tsam po 'di gzung bar snang ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba dang / gnyis su snang bar 'dod do //
analyzed: sems tsam po 'di gzung bar snang ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba dang / gnyis su snang bar 'dod do //
translated: This mere mind is held to appear as the duality of the grasped and the grasper, as the appearance of form, etc., or as the appearance of faith, energy, etc.

original: de bzhin du de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs par snang ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs par snang ba'am /
translated: Likewise, it is accepted that it appears as the afflictions, such as desire,

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos su snang bar 'dod la //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos su snang bar 'dod la //
translated: or it appears as virtuous phenomena, such as faith.

original: de dag tu snang ba las gzhan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de dag tu snang ba las gzhan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Apart from appearing as those, there is no characteristic of an afflicted phenomenon, such as desire,

original: dge ba dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
analyzed: dge ba dad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
translated: or a virtuous phenomenon, such as faith.

original: dper na gnyis su snang ba las gzhan pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gnyis su snang ba las gzhan pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, apart from appearing as dual, there is no characteristic of duality.🔽The mind engages in the appearance of various things🔽and has various aspects.

original: sems ni sna tshogs snang ba dang // rnam pa sna tshogs can du @171b 'jug / de la snang ste yod dang med //
analyzed: sems ni sna tshogs snang ba dang // rnam pa sna tshogs can du @171b 'jug / de la snang ste yod dang med //
translated: It appears as existent and nonexistent,

original: de phyir chos kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyir chos kyi ma yin no //
translated: but not as phenomena.

original: sems 'di nyid rnam grags kyi 'dod chags su snang ba'am /
analyzed: sems 'di nyid rnam grags kyi 'dod chags su snang ba'am /
translated: This very mind appears as desire,

original: zhe sdang du snang ba'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang du snang ba'am /
translated: appears as hatred,

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos su snang ba sna tshogs su snang ba dang / ci car dad pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos su snang ba sna tshogs su snang ba dang / ci car dad pa dang / brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: and appears as various other phenomena, and it has various aspects, such as faith and effort.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs can du 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs can du 'jug go //
translated: It is the various aspects of the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang dge ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems la snang ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang dge ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems la snang ba yod pa'am /
translated: The mind is said to be with appearance or without appearance in the states of defilement and of virtue.

original: med pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i chos rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the dharmas of defilement and of virtue are with appearance or without appearance,

original: der snang ba las ma gtogs pa de'i mtshan nyid me dpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba las ma gtogs pa de'i mtshan nyid me dpa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their characteristics are not different from the appearance of those.

original: mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight verses on the investigation of characteristics.

original: gcig gis ni bstan to //
analyzed: gcig gis ni bstan to //
translated: One verse is introductory.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshas do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bshas do //
translated: The rest explain.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can la //
translated: The Buddhas have rightly taught the basis of characteristics,🔽the characteristics themselves, the indication of characteristics, and their classification,

original: phan gdags phyir ni mtshan gzhi dang // mtshan nyid dang ni mtshon pa dang / rab tu dbye ba yang dag bshad //
analyzed: phan gdags phyir ni mtshan gzhi dang // mtshan nyid dang ni mtshon pa dang / rab tu dbye ba yang dag bshad //
translated: in order to help sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan to //
translated: This is the introduction.

original: sems ni lta bcas gang yin dang // de yi gnas skabs mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sems ni lta bcas gang yin dang // de yi gnas skabs mi 'gyur ba //
translated: The mind is with view, and its state is immutable.

original: 'di ni mdor nas mtshan gzhi ste //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor nas mtshan gzhi ste //
translated: This is the basis of characteristics in brief.

original: rab tu dbye na tshad med do /
analyzed: rab tu dbye na tshad med do /
translated: It is immeasurable if classified.

original: de la sems ni rnams par shes pa dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de la sems ni rnams par shes pa dang gzugs so //
translated: Mind refers to consciousness and form.

original: lta ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: View refers to mental factors.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Its state refers to factors not associated with mind.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas te /
translated: The unchanging refers to unconditioned space, etc.

original: de dang de'i rnam par rig pa rtag tu de bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i rnam par rig pa rtag tu de bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the representations of those are always engaged in that way.

original: de ltar na mtshan gzhi ni mdor bstun rnam pa de lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan gzhi ni mdor bstun rnam pa de lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, the basis of characteristics is, in brief, of five kinds.

original: rab tu dbye na ni tshad med do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye na ni tshad med do //
translated: If classified, it is limitless.

original: ji ltar brjod don du shes kyi //🔽rgyu mtshan de yi bag chags dang // de las kyang don snang ba ni //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod don du shes kyi // rgyu mtshan de yi bag chags dang // de las kyang don snang ba ni //
translated: The meaning of the term is understood from the explanation.🔽The signs of the imagined are🔽the habitual notions of those two🔽and the appearance of objects

original: kun brtags pa yi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yi mtshan nyid do //
translated: from those two.

original: mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The characteristics are, in brief, of three kinds:

original: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristics of the imagined, etc.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among them, the characteristics of the imagined are of three kinds:

original: ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes kyi rgyu mtshan dang ; brjod pa de'i bag chags dang / bag chags de la kyang tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la brjod pa'i dong yi 'dus shes med par don du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes kyi rgyu mtshan dang ; brjod pa de'i bag chags dang / bag chags de la kyang tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la brjod pa'i dong yi 'dus shes med par don du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The reason for the idea of the meaning of the expression, the instinct for that expression, and the appearance of the meaning without the idea of the meaning of the expression for those unskilled in terminology.

original: de la brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du don du 'du shes pa sems las byug ba ni ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyis 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la brjod pa ji lta ba bzhin du don du 'du shes pa sems las byug ba ni ji ltar brjod pa'i don gyis 'du shes so //
translated: The idea of the meaning as it is expressed is the idea of the meaning as it is expressed.

original: @172a * // de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: @172a * // de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The object of that is the reason.

original: de ltar na kun rtag pa bya ba gang yin pa dang / gyu bag chags gang las yin pa de gnyi ga 'dir kun rtags pa'i mtshan nyid du bzhed do //🔽ming dang don ni ji lta bar //
analyzed: de ltar na kun rtag pa bya ba gang yin pa dang / gyu bag chags gang las yin pa de gnyi ga 'dir kun rtags pa'i mtshan nyid du bzhed do // ming dang don ni ji lta bar //
translated: Thus, the activity of the imagination and the instinct from which it arises are both accepted here as the characteristics of the imagination.🔽As the name and the object,

original: don dang ming du snang ba gang //🔽yang dag min rtog rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: don dang ming du snang ba gang // yang dag min rtog rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: the appearance as name and object,🔽are the unreal imagination.

original: kun brtags pa yin mtshan no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yin mtshan no //
translated: The reason is the imagination.

original: rnam grags gzhan yang ming dang don ji bzhin par ji ming dang don ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: rnam grags gzhan yang ming dang don ji bzhin par ji ming dang don ji lta bar ro //
translated: Moreover, the name and the object appear as the name and the object, just as they are.

original: don dang ming du snang ba ni don dang ming du snang ba'o //🔽gal te ming ji lta bar don nam /
analyzed: don dang ming du snang ba ni don dang ming du snang ba'o // gal te ming ji lta bar don nam /
translated: The appearance as name and object is the imagined reality.

original: de ji lta bar ming du snang ba na yang dag pa ma yin //
analyzed: de ji lta bar ming du snang ba na yang dag pa ma yin //
translated: If the object appears as the name or the name appears as the object,🔽then the imagination of what is unreal is the imagined reality.

original: pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i dmigs pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /🔽kun brtags par bya ba ni 'di ste /
analyzed: pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i dmigs pa 'di ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin te / kun brtags par bya ba ni 'di ste /
translated: The object of the imagination of what is unreal is the imagined reality.

original: ming dang don zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad pas so //🔽rnam gsum rnam gsum snang ba can //
analyzed: ming dang don zhes bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad pas so // rnam gsum rnam gsum snang ba can //
translated: Name and object are merely that.🔽It has the appearance of the threefold

original: 'dzin dang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: 'dzin dang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: and the threefold nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //🔽'di la rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa gsum du snang ba yod pas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do // 'di la rnam pa gsum dang / rnam pa gsum du snang ba yod pas na /
translated: is the reality of the relative.🔽It has the appearance of the threefold and the threefold,

original: rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa gsum du snang ba can no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa gsum du snang ba can no //
translated: hence it has the appearance of the threefold and the threefold.

original: de la rnam pa gsum du snang ba ni gnas su snag ba dang // don du snag ba dang // lus su snag ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum du snang ba ni gnas su snag ba dang // don du snag ba dang // lus su snag ba'o //
translated: The appearance as the threefold objective aspect is the appearance as place, the appearance as object, and the appearance as body.

original: yang rnam pa gsum du snang ba ni yid dang / 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa rtog pa snang ba ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum du snang ba ni yid dang / 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa rtog pa snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance as the threefold subjective aspect is the appearance as mind, as grasping, and as conceptualization.

original: yid ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind is that which is always defiled.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs so //
translated: Grasping is the five groups of consciousness.

original: rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam shes pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the mental consciousness.

original: de la rnam pa gsum du snang ba dang po ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum du snang ba dang po ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The first of these three appearances is the characteristic of the apprehended.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The second is the characteristic of the apprehender.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan yin no //
translated: Thus, this false imagination is the dependent characteristic.🔽Nonexistence and existence, being and nonbeing,

original: med dang yod nyid dang yin dang // yod dang med pa mnyam nyid dang // ma zhi zhi dang rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: med dang yod nyid dang yin dang // yod dang med pa mnyam nyid dang // ma zhi zhi dang rnam mi rtog //
translated: equality, nonpacification and pacification, and nonconceptualization

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: are the characteristics of the perfected.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is thusness.

original: de ni kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad kyi med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad kyi med pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the non-existence of all the imagined dharmas.

original: de'i med pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang yin no //🔽yod pa dang med pa de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i med pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang yin no // yod pa dang med pa de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: It is existence because it exists as the non-existence of those.

original: yod pa dang med pa mnyam pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa mnyam pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It is the equality of existence and non-existence because those two, existence and non-existence, are not different.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs @172b pa'i glo bru ba dag gis ma zhi ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs @172b pa'i glo bru ba dag gis ma zhi ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It is the non-pacification of the mind because it is not pacified by the adventitious secondary mental afflictions.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhi ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhi ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It is the pacification of the mind because it is naturally pure.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni spros pa med pas rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni spros pa med pas rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-conceptuality because it is not the domain of discursive thought due to the absence of conceptual proliferation.

original: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
translated: By this, the three characteristics of thusness are taught.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of its own nature, the characteristic of defilement and purification, and the characteristic of non-discrimination.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
translated: The three characteristics have been explained.🔽The five kinds of indication are:

original: rgyu mtshun chos la dmigs nas ni //
analyzed: rgyu mtshun chos la dmigs nas ni //
translated: the object of the Dharma,🔽proper mental attention,🔽abiding in the realm of mind,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang // sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa dang / don yod pa dang med par mthong //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang // sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa dang / don yod pa dang med par mthong //
translated: and seeing the existent and the non-existent.

original: mtshon pa ni rnal 'byor gyis rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshon pa ni rnal 'byor gyis rnam lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of indication by the yogi are:🔽the basis,🔽the generation,🔽the mirror-like,

original: gzhi dang / bskyed pa dang / me long lta bu dang / snang ba dang rten to //
analyzed: gzhi dang / bskyed pa dang / me long lta bu dang / snang ba dang rten to //
translated: the light, and the support.

original: de la gzhi ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de la gzhi ni rgyu mthun pa'i chos te /
translated: The basis is the Dharma of the cause and effect.

original: sangs rgyas kyis thugs su chud nas bshad pa gang yin pa de ni thugs su chud pa de'i rgyu mthun pa yin no ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thugs su chud nas bshad pa gang yin pa de ni thugs su chud pa de'i rgyu mthun pa yin no ;
translated: That which is taught by the Buddha after he has realized it is the cause and effect of that realization.

original: / bskyed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: / bskyed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The generation is proper mental attention.

original: me long lta bu ni sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: me long lta bu ni sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The mirror-like is the samadhi of abiding in the realm of mind.

original: gong du ming la gnas par bshad par gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: gong du ming la gnas par bshad par gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: It is the same as the above-mentioned abiding in name.

original: snang ba ni don yod pa dang / med pa nyid du mthong ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni don yod pa dang / med pa nyid du mthong ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Appearance is supramundane wisdom, seeing the existence and non-existence of objects.

original: gang gis yod pa la yang yod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong la /
analyzed: gang gis yod pa la yang yod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong la /
translated: By it, one sees existence as it really is, and

original: med pa la yang med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: med pa la yang med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: one sees non-existence as it really is.

original: rten ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rten ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: Support is the transformation of the basis.

original: de ni mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa //
analyzed: de ni mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur // 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa //
translated: It is the equality of the noble lineages.

original: mnyam dang khyad 'phags 'bri med cing //
analyzed: mnyam dang khyad 'phags 'bri med cing //
translated: The equality of the noble lineages is the equality of the noble ones in the realm without discrimination.

original: 'phel med pa yi mtshan nyid 'dod //
analyzed: 'phel med pa yi mtshan nyid 'dod //
translated: It is characterized by non-decrease and non-increase.

original: mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'phags pa'i rigs thag pa med pa'i dbyings na de las gzhan pa'i 'phags pa dag dang ngo //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'phags pa'i rigs thag pa med pa'i dbyings na de las gzhan pa'i 'phags pa dag dang ngo //
translated: The equality of the noble lineages is the equality of the noble ones in the realm without discrimination.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'phags pa'i rigs dri ma med pa de la yang rnam par grol bar mnyam pa nyid kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'phags pa'i rigs dri ma med pa de la yang rnam par grol bar mnyam pa nyid kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: And in that stainless lineage of the noble ones of the buddhas, they are equal to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas by virtue of the equality of liberation.

original: khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa yang yin te /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags pa yang yin te /
translated: They are also superior by five kinds of distinctions.

original: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi ni nyon mongs pa dag chags dang bcas te rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi ni nyon mongs pa dag chags dang bcas te rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are superior by the distinction of purity, because they are purified of the passions together with their instincts.

original: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //🔽sku'i khyad @173a * //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro // sku'i khyad @173a * //
translated: They are superior by the distinction of perfection, because their fields are perfected.

original: par gyis ni chos kyi sku'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par gyis ni chos kyi sku'i phyir ro //
translated: They are superior by the distinction of body, because they have the Dharma body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i khyad par gyis ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are superior by the distinction of perfect enjoyment, because they uninterruptedly enjoy the Dharma in the circles of their retinues.

original: phrin las kyi khyad par gyis ni dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa sprul pa dag gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrin las kyi khyad par gyis ni dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa sprul pa dag gis sems can gyi don mdzad pa rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the difference of activity, he accomplishes the benefit of beings by means of emanations, such as residing in the Tusita heaven.

original: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'gag pa ni 'bri ba yang med la /
analyzed: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'gag pa ni 'bri ba yang med la /
translated: In that, there is no decrease in the cessation of the side of affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs skye ba na 'phel ba yang med do //🔽de ltar na rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa lnga po 'di ni mtshon pa yin te /🔽des mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed do //🔽rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs skye ba na 'phel ba yang med do // de ltar na rnal 'byor gyis rnam pa lnga po 'di ni mtshon pa yin te / des mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed do // rnam par grol ba yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: and there is no increase in the arising of the side of purification.🔽Thus, these five aspects of yoga are illustrations.

original: sa bon gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir //🔽gnas don lus su snang ba dag / gzhan du gyur pa zag med dbyings //🔽de ni rten kun 'gro ba can //🔽sa bon gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
