original: kun gzhi rnam par shes par gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes par gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the store-consciousness has been transformed.

original: gnas dang don dang las su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams gzhan du gyur pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: gnas dang don dang las su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams gzhan du gyur pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The realm of the Dharma is the transformation of the consciousnesses that appear as the place, the object, and the action.

original: rnam par grol ba'o //🔽de ni rten tu 'gro ba can te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'o // de ni rten tu 'gro ba can te /
translated: It is liberation.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas la mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas la mnga' ba yin no //
translated: It is the support of the powers of the Disciples, the Solitary Buddhas, and the Buddhas.

original: yid dang 'dzin dang rnam par rtog //
analyzed: yid dang 'dzin dang rnam par rtog //
translated: The mind, the grasping, and the discrimination,🔽are transformed into the nondiscriminative,

original: gyur phyir rnam par mi rtog dang // zhing dang ye shes las dag la //🔽dbang gi rnam par bzhi yin no //
analyzed: gyur phyir rnam par mi rtog dang // zhing dang ye shes las dag la // dbang gi rnam par bzhi yin no //
translated: the domain, the intuition, and the action.

original: gyur pa'i don ni yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: gyur pa'i don ni yid dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the mind, the grasping, and the discrimination is the transformation of the consciousnesses that appear as the place, the object, and the action.🔽The transformation of the store-consciousness is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.🔽The transformation of the consciousnesses that appear as the place, the object, and the action is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.🔽The transformation of the store-consciousness is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.

original: ro rims bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa dang zhi dang ye shes dang ye shes dang las dag la dbang rnam pa bzhin yin no //🔽dbang de mi g-yo la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ro rims bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa dang zhi dang ye shes dang ye shes dang las dag la dbang rnam pa bzhin yin no // dbang de mi g-yo la sogs pa'i //
translated: The transformation of the consciousnesses that appear as the place, the object, and the action is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.🔽The transformation of the store-consciousness is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.🔽The transformation of the consciousnesses that appear as the place, the object, and the action is the realm of the Dharma, which is liberation.

original: sa gsum la ni rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: sa gsum la ni rnam bzhi ste //
translated: The four masteries are in the three stages, the immovable, etc.

original: gcig la rnam gnyis de las gzhan //
analyzed: gcig la rnam gnyis de las gzhan //
translated: One is twofold, and the other is not.🔽

original: dbang re rer ni 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: dbang re rer ni 'dod pa yin //
translated: One has two powers on one level, and the others have one power each.

original: dbang de yang sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum la rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang de yang sa mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum la rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: These powers should be understood as fourfold on the three levels, Immovable, etc.

original: sa mi g-yo ba gcig la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa mi g-yo ba gcig la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One has two powers on the single level of the Immovable:

original: mngon par 'dad byed pa med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhing la dbang ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'dad byed pa med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhing la dbang ngo //
translated: the power over lifespans, because one is able to relinquish and to remain in lifespans, and the power over realms, because one purifies the buddhaverse.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sa la ni dbang re re @173b ste ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sa la ni dbang re re @173b ste ;
translated: The others have one power each on the other levels.

original: / legs pa'i blo gros la ni so sor yang dag par rig pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ngo //
analyzed: / legs pa'i blo gros la ni so sor yang dag par rig pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ngo //
translated: On the level of Excellent Understanding, one has the power over intuition, because one attains the special analytical knowledges.

original: chos kyi sprin la ni mngon par shes pa'i las rnams la thogs pa med pa'i phyir las dbang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la ni mngon par shes pa'i las rnams la thogs pa med pa'i phyir las dbang ngo //
translated: On the Cloud of Truth, one has the power over karma, because one is unimpeded in the activities of the superknowledges.

original: blo dang ldan pas srid gtogs bdag med pa gnyis ga 'ang rig 'gyur la ;
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas srid gtogs bdag med pa gnyis ga 'ang rig 'gyur la ;
translated: The wise one realizes both kinds of selflessness in all their aspects, in all the worldrealms, and in all times.

original: / de yang mnyam par shes nas de ni 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de nyid 'jug //
analyzed: / de yang mnyam par shes nas de ni 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de nyid 'jug //
translated: And knowing that it is the same, he enters into reality by way of apprehension.

original: de nas de la yid gnas phyir na de la de yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de nas de la yid gnas phyir na de la de yang mi snang ngo //
translated: Then, because his mind is fixed on that, that also does not appear to him.

original: de mi snang ba grol ba yin te mchog tu dmigs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de mi snang ba grol ba yin te mchog tu dmigs dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nonappearance of that is liberation, the supreme freedom from objectification.

original: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas srid pa gsum du gtogs pa bdag med pa rnam pa gnyi ga rig par gyur la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i rnam grangs gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas srid pa gsum du gtogs pa bdag med pa rnam pa gnyi ga rig par gyur la /
translated: Another enumeration of liberation: The bodhisattva has understood the two kinds of selflessness that pertain to the three realms of existence.

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po de yang kun brtags pa'i gang zag med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis po de yang kun brtags pa'i gang zag med pa bzhin du /
translated: And he knows that the two kinds of selflessness are like the nonexistence of the imaginary individual.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos me dpar shes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos me dpar shes pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he knows that the imaginary dharmas are also nonexistent.

original: mnyam par shes nas te /
analyzed: mnyam par shes nas te /
translated: “Knowing that they are the same” means that he knows that they are the same in being completely nonexistent.

original: rnam pa thams cad du me dpa'i phri ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du me dpa'i phri ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not know that they are nonexistent in every way.

original: 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam la 'jug go //
translated: He enters into the reality of mere representation by way of the apprehension that “this is mere apprehension.”

original: de nas de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de la yid gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam de la yid gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, because his mind is fixed on that reality of mere representation,

original: de kho na ni rnam par rig pa tsam de yang mi snang ngo //🔽de mi snang ba ni grol ba mchog tu dmigs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na ni rnam par rig pa tsam de yang mi snang ngo // de mi snang ba ni grol ba mchog tu dmigs pa dang bral ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That reality is consciousness only, and that also does not appear.

original: gang zag dang chos dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonappearance of that is the supreme liberation, which is the absence of the apprehension of persons and things.

original: tshogs kyis gzhi dang bskyed yod na //🔽ming tsam du ni mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshogs kyis gzhi dang bskyed yod na // ming tsam du ni mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: When there is a basis and generation by the accumulation,🔽one sees as mere names.

original: ming tsam mthong ste der mthong na //
analyzed: ming tsam mthong ste der mthong na //
translated: Seeing as mere names,

original: de yang phyis ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang phyis ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: one does not see even that later.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang tshogs skyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa'i sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang tshogs skyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa'i sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis so //
translated: Another explanation is that “generation by the accumulation” means by the power of the previous accumulation of the requisites.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni thos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni thos pa'o //
translated: “Basis” means hearing.

original: bskyed pa yod na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskyed pa yod na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When there is” means

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: proper attention.

original: ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam du ste /
analyzed: ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam du ste /
translated: “One sees as mere names” means as mere verbal expressions,

original: don dang bral bar ro //
analyzed: don dang bral bar ro //
translated: devoid of objects.

original: ming tsam du mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam du ste /
analyzed: ming tsam du mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam du ste /
translated: “Seeing as mere names” means as mere representations,

original: ming ni gzugs can ma yi pa'i phung po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ma yi pa'i phung po bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name is the four aggregates that are not form.

original: der mthong na de yang phyis mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: der mthong na de yang phyis mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: When it is seen there, it is not seen later on,

original: don med na de'i rnam par rig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med na de'i rnam par rig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the object does not exist, its perception does not exist.

original: de bas na 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the liberation of non-apprehension.

original: @174a * // sems ni gnas ngan len dang bcas //🔽bdag lha'i zhabs pas zin par ni //🔽rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te de //
analyzed: @174a * // sems ni gnas ngan len dang bcas // bdag lha'i zhabs pas zin par ni // rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te de //
translated: The mind is accompanied by the negative reflex actions.🔽It is engaged in the world,🔽but it is considered to be turned back,

original: nang du gnas phyir ldog par 'dod //
analyzed: nang du gnas phyir ldog par 'dod //
translated: because it is fixed internally.

original: rnam grags gzhan yang sems 'di ni skye ba rnams su gnas ngan len dang bcas par rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam grags gzhan yang sems 'di ni skye ba rnams su gnas ngan len dang bcas par rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, this mind is engaged in the world with the negative reflex actions.🔽It is engaged in the world, because it is accompanied by the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i zhabs pas zin pas zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu ston te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i zhabs pas zin pas zhes bya ba ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu ston te /
translated: This shows the cause of the negative reflex actions.

original: bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis kyi zin pas na de'i phyir gnas ngan len dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis kyi zin pas na de'i phyir gnas ngan len dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is accompanied by the negative reflex actions, because it is accompanied by the two kinds of views of self.

original: de nang du gnas pa'i phyir ldog go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nang du gnas pa'i phyir ldog go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is considered to be turned back, because it is fixed internally.

original: sems de sems kho na la gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems de sems kho na la gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the mind abides in the mind alone,

original: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not perceived.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /🔽rang dang rang gi bdag nyid du //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te / rang dang rang gi bdag nyid du //
translated: Two verses on the investigation of realitylessness.

original: med phyir rang gi ngo bo la //
analyzed: med phyir rang gi ngo bo la //
translated: Because of nonexistence in itself and in its intrinsic nature,🔽because of nonabiding in its own intrinsic reality,

original: mi gnas phyir dang 'dzin bzhin de //
analyzed: mi gnas phyir dang 'dzin bzhin de //
translated: and because of the nonexistence of that as it is grasped,

original: med phyir ngo bo nyid med 'dod //
analyzed: med phyir ngo bo nyid med 'dod //
translated: realitylessness is accepted.

original: rang med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa ni chos rnams rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa ni chos rnams rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Realitylessness due to nonexistence in itself is because things are dependent on conditions.

original: rang gi bdag nyid du med pa'i phyir ngo go nyid med pa ni 'gags pa rnams yang de'i bdag nyid du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid du med pa'i phyir ngo go nyid med pa ni 'gags pa rnams yang de'i bdag nyid du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Realitylessness due to nonexistence in its intrinsic nature is because things that have ceased do not arise again in that nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo la mi ngas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la mi ngas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Realitylessness due to nonabiding in its own intrinsic reality is because of momentariness.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this threefold realitylessness should be understood as corresponding to the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'dzin pa bzhin de me dpa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa la de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa bzhin de me dpa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa la de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since it does not exist in reality, it is said that it does not exist in essencelessness.

original: ji ltar byis pa rnams ngo bo nyid rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag gam /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnams ngo bo nyid rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag gam /
translated: Just as childish beings grasp at essence as permanent, blissful, pure, and a self,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'dzin pa de ltar ngo bo nyid 'di med pas de'i phyir yang chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'dzin pa de ltar ngo bo nyid 'di med pas de'i phyir yang chos rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: or as the imagined characteristic, since this essence does not exist, therefore phenomena are asserted to be essenceless.

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas //
translated: Since the latter is the basis of the former,

original: ngo bo nyid ni med pa yis //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni med pa yis //
translated: essencelessness is established.

original: skye med 'gag med gzod nas zhi //
analyzed: skye med 'gag med gzod nas zhi //
translated: Nonarising, noncessation, primordial peace,

original: rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa grub //
analyzed: rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa grub //
translated: and natural nirvana are established.

original: ngo bon yid med pas ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa grub ste /
analyzed: ngo bon yid med pas ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa grub ste /
translated: Since there is no essence, nonarising and so forth are established.

original: gang zhig ngo bo nyid med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ngo bo nyid med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That which is essenceless is unarisen.

original: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: That which is unarisen is unceasing.

original: gang ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
translated: That which is unarisen and unceasing is primordially peaceful.

original: gang gzod nas zhi ba de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzod nas zhi ba de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: That which is primordially peaceful is naturally in a state of Nirvaṇa.

original: de ltar na ngo go nyid med pa la sog spa 'di dag phyi @174b ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas ngo bo nyid med pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo go nyid med pa la sog spa 'di dag phyi @174b ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas ngo bo nyid med pas skye ba med pa la sogs pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since these non-substantialities are the bases of the subsequent ones, non-production, etc. are established by non-substantiality.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa 'phags pa ste /
translated: A verse on the investigation of acquiescence in the non-production of things.

original: thog ma dang ni de nyid gzhan nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid rang dang gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: thog ma dang ni de nyid gzhan nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid rang dang gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: The beginning, sameness, otherness, intrinsic identity, self, transformation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang khyab bar la ;
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang khyab bar la ;
translated: Affliction, and pervasion—

original: / skyed ba med pa'i chos la bzod par bshad //
analyzed: / skyed ba med pa'i chos la bzod par bshad //
translated: acquiescence in the non-production of things is taught.

original: chos brgyad la skye ba med par bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos bzod pa'o //
analyzed: chos brgyad la skye ba med par bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos bzod pa'o //
translated: Acquiescence in the non-production of the eight things is acquiescence in the non-production of things.

original: de thog ma ni 'khor ba la ste /
analyzed: de thog ma ni 'khor ba la ste /
translated: The beginning is in regard to cyclic life.

original: de la thog ma skye ba med do //
analyzed: de la thog ma skye ba med do //
translated: There is no beginning production in that.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid ni snga ma dang phyi ma rnams la ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid ni snga ma dang phyi ma rnams la ste /
translated: Sameness and otherness are in regard to the former and latter moments.

original: 'khor ba na chos gang dag sngar skyes pa de dag nyid skye ba ni med de /
analyzed: 'khor ba na chos gang dag sngar skyes pa de dag nyid skye ba ni med de /
translated: There is no arising of those dharmas in cyclic existence that have already arisen.

original: de'i ngo bor mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not arise in their own nature.

original: gzhan dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they arise from another,

original: sngon med pa'i rnam par mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i rnam par mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not arise in a different aspect.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The own-character is

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la ste /
translated: in the imagined nature,

original: de la ni nam yang skye ba med do //
analyzed: de la ni nam yang skye ba med do //
translated: because there is never any arising in that.🔽Non-arising is in the relative,

original: rang skye ba med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang la'o //
analyzed: rang skye ba med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang la'o //
translated: because there is no arising in the other.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yongs su grub pa la ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni yongs su grub pa la ste /
translated: Transformation is in the perfect,

original: de la ni gzhan du 'gyur bar skye ba med do //
analyzed: de la ni gzhan du 'gyur bar skye ba med do //
translated: because there is no arising in the transformation of that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni spangs pa la ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni spangs pa la ste /
translated: Affliction is in abandonment,

original: zad pa shes pa thob pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi blta'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa thob pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi blta'o //
translated: because the arising of affliction is not seen in one who has attained the knowledge of elimination.

original: khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku rnams la ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku rnams la ste /
translated: Distinction is in the bodies of the Buddha’s qualities,

original: de dag la ni khyad par du skye ba med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni khyad par du skye ba med do //
translated: because there is no arising of distinction in them.

original: de ltar na chos de dag la skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos de dag la skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas is explained in those dharmas.

original: theg pa gcig pa nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bdun te /🔽chos dang bdag me dgrol ba rnams //
analyzed: theg pa gcig pa nyid yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bdun te / chos dang bdag me dgrol ba rnams //
translated: Seven verses on the investigation of the single vehicle.

original: mtshungs phyir rigs ni thad dad phyir //
analyzed: mtshungs phyir rigs ni thad dad phyir //
translated: The single vehicle is taught because of the sameness of reality,🔽the sameness of the lack of self, the liberation of both,

original: bsam gnyis thob phyir sbrul pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsam gnyis thob phyir sbrul pa'i phyir //
translated: the attainment of the two aspirations, the manifestation,

original: mthar thug phyir na theg gcig nyid //
analyzed: mthar thug phyir na theg gcig nyid //
translated: and the ultimate arrival.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pas na chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pas na chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The single vehicle is taught because of the sameness of the realm of reality, since the realm of reality of the disciples, etc. is not different.

original: bgrod par bya bas na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bgrod par bya bas na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: It is a vehicle because it is to be gone on.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams bdag med pa 'dra bas bdag med ba mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams bdag med pa 'dra bas bdag med ba mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The single vehicle is taught because of the sameness of the lack of self, since the persons, the disciples, etc. are alike in being selfless.

original: 'gro ba bos na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba bos na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: It is a vehicle because it is gone on by beings.

original: rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The single vehicle is taught because of the sameness of liberation, since the disciples, etc. are alike in being liberated.

original: 'gro ba bas na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba bas na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: It is a vehicle because it is gone on by beings.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bas na rigs @175a * //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs su ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bas na rigs @175a * //
translated: Because those of unfixed lineage, such as śrāvakas, are liberated by the Mahāyāna, there is one vehicle.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: There is one vehicle because of the difference in lineage.

original: 'dis 'gro bas na theg pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bas na theg pa yin pas so //
translated: Because one goes by it, it is a vehicle.

original: bsam pa gnyis thob pa'i phir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can thams cad la bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa brnyes pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos de'i ris su nge spa sngo byang chub kyi tshogs spyad pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su bzung ba'i khyad par phyogs tsam thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyud tha mi dad par mos pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: bsam pa gnyis thob pa'i phir theg pa gcig pa nyid de / sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can thams cad la bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa brnyes pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos de'i ris su nge spa sngo byang chub kyi tshogs spyad pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su bzung ba'i khyad par phyogs tsam thob par bya ba'i phyir rgyud tha mi dad par mos pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi
translated: There is one vehicle because of obtaining the two aspirations.

original: dgongs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the buddhas obtain the aspiration for all sentient beings and because śrāvakas who have practiced the accumulations of enlightenment in their lineage obtain the aspiration of the buddhas through the power of the buddhas in order to obtain a mere portion of the special support of the tathāgatas.

original: de ltar na bsam pa gcig pa nyid thob pa bas sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams gcig pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa gcig pa nyid thob pa bas sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams gcig pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the Buddha and the disciples are the same in having attained the same thought, and so there is one vehicle.

original: sbrul pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: sbrul pa'i phyir theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: There is one vehicle because of manifestation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga ni lan brgya phrag du mar nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su myang ngan las 'das so zhes gsungs pa lte ba ste /
analyzed: nga ni lan brgya phrag du mar nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su myang ngan las 'das so zhes gsungs pa lte ba ste /
translated: I have passed into final liberation many hundreds of times through the disciples vehicle.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi don du de ltar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi don du de ltar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in that way for the sake of those to be trained.

original: mthar thug pa'i phyir yang theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i phyir yang theg pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: There is one vehicle because of the ultimate,🔽for that which has no further destination is a vehicle.

original: gang phan chad bgrod par bya ba med pa de ni theg pa yin pas sangs rgyas nyid kho na theg pa gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: gang phan chad bgrod par bya ba med pa de ni theg pa yin pas sangs rgyas nyid kho na theg pa gcig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, only buddhahood is the one vehicle.

original: de ltar bas na mod de dang de las ni dgongs pa de dang des theg pa gcig pa nyid du gsungs par rig par bya'i //
analyzed: de ltar bas na mod de dang de las ni dgongs pa de dang des theg pa gcig pa nyid du gsungs par rig par bya'i //
translated: Thus, in this and that scripture, one should understand that the one vehicle is taught by that intention.

original: theg pa gsum med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gsum med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that there are not three vehicles.

original: yang ci'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs pa de dang des theg pa gcig pa nyid du bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs pa de dang des theg pa gcig pa nyid du bshad ce na /
translated: Why do the Buddhas, with that intention, teach the One Vehicle?

original: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // gzhan dag yang dag gzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // gzhan dag yang dag gzung ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to lead some, and in order to hold others.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni //
translated: The Buddhas

original: ma nges rnams la theg gcig bshad //
analyzed: ma nges rnams la theg gcig bshad //
translated: have taught the One Vehicle to the uncommitted.

original: kha cig drang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rigs can ma nges pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig drang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rigs can ma nges pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: In order to lead some means in order to lead those of the Listener type who are uncommitted.

original: gzhan dag yang dag par bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can ma nges pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag par bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can ma nges pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: In order to hold others means in order to hold those of the Bodhisattva type who are uncommitted.

original: nyan thos ma nge rnams gnyis te //
analyzed: nyan thos ma nge rnams gnyis te //
translated: The uncommitted Listeners are of two kinds:

original: theg don mthong dang mthong ba'i //
analyzed: theg don mthong dang mthong ba'i //
translated: those who see the meaning of the vehicle and those who do not.

original: don mthong 'dod chags bral ba dang // 'dod chags bral min 'di dman pa'o //
analyzed: don mthong 'dod chags bral ba dang // 'dod chags bral min 'di dman pa'o //
translated: Those who see the meaning are free from attachment, and those who do not are not free from attachment.

original: nyan thos ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos ma nges pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The uncommitted Listeners are of two kinds:🔽those who see the meaning of the vehicle and those who do not.

original: theg pa'i don mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba theg pa chen @175b pos nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa'i don mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba theg pa chen @175b pos nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Seeing the meaning of the vehicle is seeing the truth, which is the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa'i don ma mthong ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba theg pa che pos nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa'i don ma mthong ba ni bden pa ma mthong ba theg pa che pos nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Not seeing the meaning of the vehicle is not seeing the truth, which is the Great Vehicle.

original: don mthong ba yang 'dod pa dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: don mthong ba yang 'dod pa dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: Those who see the meaning are those who are free from attachment to the desire realm and those who are not free from attachment.

original: don mthong ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa yin te /
analyzed: don mthong ba rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dman pa yin te /
translated: The two kinds of seeing the meaning that were explained are inferior.

original: rtog ba bul ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtog ba bul ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they are slow in understanding.

original: de gnyis 'phags pa'i lam thob pa //
analyzed: de gnyis 'phags pa'i lam thob pa //
translated: Those two, having obtained the noble path,🔽are reborn in the desire realm

original: srid pa dag tu bsgyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid pa dag tu bsgyur ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to transform existence.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab bsgyur ba yi //🔽skye ba dang ni yang dag ldan //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab bsgyur ba yi // skye ba dang ni yang dag ldan //
translated: They are endowed with inconceivable transformation.

original: don mthong ba de gnyis ni 'phags pa'i lam thob ba srid pa dag tu bsgyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don mthong ba de gnyis ni 'phags pa'i lam thob ba srid pa dag tu bsgyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Those two who see the meaning, having obtained the noble path, are reborn in the desire realm in order to transform existence.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgyur ba'i skye ba dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgyur ba'i skye ba dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they have an inconceivable transformation of birth.

original: 'phags pa'i lam de skye bar bsgyur ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de skye bar bsgyur ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The transformation of birth of this noble path is inconceivable.

original: de ltar ba na bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgyur ba yin no //🔽gcig ni smon lam dbang gis na //🔽skye ba rab tu sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de ltar ba na bsam gyis mi khyab par bsgyur ba yin no // gcig ni smon lam dbang gis na // skye ba rab tu sgrub par byed //
translated: Thus, it is an inconceivable transformation.🔽One is accomplished by the power of vows,🔽and the other is accomplished by emanations,

original: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba dang // ldan phyir sprul pas rab tu sgrub //
analyzed: cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba dang // ldan phyir sprul pas rab tu sgrub //
translated: because of possessing non-return.

original: de gnyis la gcig ste 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de ni smon lam gyi dbang gis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba 'dzin to //
analyzed: de gnyis la gcig ste 'dod chags dang ma bral ba gang yin pa de ni smon lam gyi dbang gis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba 'dzin to //
translated: Of those two, the one who is not free from attachment takes on birth as he wishes, by the power of his vows.

original: cig shos ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang ldan pa'i stobs kyis sbrul pa dag gis 'dzin to //
analyzed: cig shos ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang ldan pa'i stobs kyis sbrul pa dag gis 'dzin to //
translated: The other, by the power of possessing non-return, takes on birth by means of emanations.

original: de gnyis yang dang yang du ni //
analyzed: de gnyis yang dang yang du ni //
translated: Those two, again and again,

original: rang sems kun tu 'byung ldan pas //
analyzed: rang sems kun tu 'byung ldan pas //
translated: through the arising of their own minds,

original: myang ngan 'das la mngon dga'i phyir //
analyzed: myang ngan 'das la mngon dga'i phyir //
translated: because of delighting in nirvana,

original: rtog pa bul pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: rtog pa bul pa yin par 'dod //
translated: are considered to be slow in wisdom.

original: de gnyis ga yang rang gi nyan thos kyis sems skyo ba dang ldan pa yang dang yang dang du kun tu 'byung bas mya ngan las 'das pa la lhag par dga' ba'i phyir rtog pa bul pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de gnyis ga yang rang gi nyan thos kyis sems skyo ba dang ldan pa yang dang yang dang du kun tu 'byung bas mya ngan las 'das pa la lhag par dga' ba'i phyir rtog pa bul pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: Both of them are considered slow witted because they delight in nirvana, since their disciples are repeatedly and continuously discouraged.

original: yun ring mi gzhig na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro //🔽don byas ma yin de sangs rgyas //
analyzed: yun ring mi gzhig na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir ro // don byas ma yin de sangs rgyas //
translated: They do not fully awaken to highest genuine enlightenment for a long time.🔽Those who have not done what had to be done are Buddhas

original: med par skyes nas sbrul don gnyer //
analyzed: med par skyes nas sbrul don gnyer //
translated: in an age when there is no Buddha.🔽They are intent on the goal of the absorptions,

original: bsam gtan don brtson der brten nas //
analyzed: bsam gtan don brtson der brten nas //
translated: and having relied on that,

original: byang chub dam pa 'thob pa 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa 'thob pa 'gyur //
translated: attain the highest enlightenment.

original: bden pa mthong ba 'dod chags dang ma bral ba don ma byas pa slob pa gang yin pa de ni /🔽sangs rgyas med pa'i dus su skyes nas sbrul pa don du gnyer bas bsam gtan gyi don du brtson par 'gyur zhing sbrul pa de la yang brten nas rim gyis byang chub dam @176a * //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba 'dod chags dang ma bral ba don ma byas pa slob pa gang yin pa de ni / sangs rgyas med pa'i dus su skyes nas sbrul pa don du gnyer bas bsam gtan gyi don du brtson par 'gyur zhing sbrul pa de la yang brten nas rim gyis byang chub dam @176a * //
translated: Those who have seen the truth but are not free from attachment, who are learners and have not done what had to be done,🔽are born in an age when there is no Buddha.🔽They are intent on the goal of the absorptions in order to seek rebirth.

original: pa thob par 'gyur ngo //
analyzed: pa thob par 'gyur ngo //
translated: And having relied on that rebirth, they gradually attain the highest enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas skabs gsum la gnas pa de la dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas skabs gsum la gnas pa de la dgongs nas /
translated: The Bhagavān had in mind the three times when it is present.

original: dpal phreng gi mdo las me'i dpes nyan thos su gyur nas /
analyzed: dpal phreng gi mdo las me'i dpes nyan thos su gyur nas /
translated: The Lord had in mind the three states of the one abiding in the three states when he said in the Śrīmālā-sūtra:🔽“Having become a śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes a pratyekabuddha,

original: phyis ni sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /🔽gang gi tshe sngon bden pa mthong ba'i gnas skabs dang // gang gi tshe sangs rgyas med pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyis bsam gtan bskyed nas skye ba'i lus bor te /
analyzed: phyis ni sangs rgyas su yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te / gang gi tshe sngon bden pa mthong ba'i gnas skabs dang // gang gi tshe sangs rgyas med pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyis bsam gtan bskyed nas skye ba'i lus bor te /
translated: and later he becomes a buddha.”

original: sprul pa'i lus 'dzin pa dang / gang gi tshe byang chub dam pa 'thob pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i lus 'dzin pa dang / gang gi tshe byang chub dam pa 'thob pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The three states are the state of having previously seen the truth, the state of having generated the meditative concentrations on one’s own and, when there are no buddhas, having cast off the body of birth and taken on the body of emanation, and the state of having attained supreme enlightenment.

original: rig pa'i gnas yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa /🔽rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa / rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
translated: A verse on the investigation of the sciences🔽The supreme āryas do not become omniscient

original: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
translated: without striving in the five sciences.

original: de lta bas na gzhan dag tshar bcad rjes gzung dang // bdag nyid kun shes bya phyir de la de brtson byed //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan dag tshar bcad rjes gzung dang // bdag nyid kun shes bya phyir de la de brtson byed //
translated: Therefore, he strives for that in order to refute others, to take care of them, and to know everything himself.

original: rig pa'i gnas ni rnam pa lnga ste ;
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas ni rnam pa lnga ste ;
translated: The branches of learning are five:

original: nang rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
analyzed: nang rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa'o //
translated: inner science, medical science, logical reasoning, grammar, and the arts and crafts.

original: de dag gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpas btsal bar bya ste ston te /
analyzed: de dag gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpas btsal bar bya ste ston te /
translated: The bodhisattva seeks them all

original: bye brag med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: without distinction in order to attain omniscience.

original: bye brag tu ni gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa ni gzhan de dag la ma mos pa rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni gtan tshigs rig pa dang / sgra rig pa ni gzhan de dag la ma mos pa rnams tshar bcad pa'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
translated: In particular, he seeks the science of logic and grammar in order to refute those who do not believe in them.

original: gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa ni gzhan de dag la mos pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: gso ba rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas rig pa ni gzhan de dag la mos pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
translated: He seeks the medical science and the science of the arts and crafts in order to help those who do believe in them.

original: nang rig pa ni bdag nyid kun shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: nang rig pa ni bdag nyid kun shes par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol lo //
translated: Inner knowledge is sought for the sake of knowing oneself.

original: khams brtas pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: khams brtas pa yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum ste /
translated: Thirteen verses on the investigation of the development of the elements.

original: pha rol tu phyir pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyir pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of perfecting the transcendences,🔽the bodhisattva investigates the transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gang dag khams brtas par byed pa de dag kho na tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa gang dag khams brtas par byed pa de dag kho na tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan to //
translated: The very same contemplations associated with the transcendences that develop the elements are indicated by these verses.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang po ni 'di yin te //
translated: The first verse is🔽Joy in the vision of the cause, recollection of the support,

original: rgyu dmigs nas ni dga' ba dang / rten la de rjes dran pa dang // 'bras bu thun mong 'dod pa dang / ji ltar byang chub bzhin mos pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dmigs nas ni dga' ba dang / rten la de rjes dran pa dang // 'bras bu thun mong 'dod pa dang / ji ltar byang chub bzhin mos pa'o //
translated: desire for the common weal, and aspiration as in enlightenment.

original: de dag kyang rgyu dmigs nas dga' @176b ba yid la byed pa nas bdag nyid mchog tu nges par 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu dmigs nas dga' @176b ba yid la byed pa nas bdag nyid mchog tu nges par 'dzin pa yid la byed pa'i bar dag yin no //
translated: These are the contemplations of joy in the vision of the cause, up to the contemplation of the conviction of one's own supremacy.

original: de la rgyu dmigs nas dga' ba yid 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu dmigs nas dga' ba yid 'byed pa ni /
translated: Joy in the vision of the cause is

original: re zhig dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa bdag nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs mthong ba dang / rgyu dmigs nas dga' bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams brtas par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pa bdag nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs mthong ba dang / rgyu dmigs nas dga' bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i khams brtas par byed do //
translated: First of all, the bodhisattva who is established in the spiritual gene perceives the gene of the transcendences in himself, and, observing the cause, he delights in the development of the potential for the transcendences.

original: rigs la gnas pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed pas de'i 'og tu rten la de rjes su dran pa byed pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa byang chub kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang 'di snyam du 'di skad bdag la byang chub kyi sems yod pas na //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed pas de'i 'og tu rten la de rjes su dran pa byed pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa byang chub kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang 'di snyam du 'di skad bdag la byang chub kyi sems yod pas na //
translated: The one who is established in the gene arouses the thought of supreme enlightenment, and subsequently he cultivates recollection of the support.

original: gdon mi za bar pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la byed do //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro snyam du yid la byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva perceives the thought of enlightenment in himself as the support of the transcendences, and he thinks, “Since I have the thought of enlightenment, undoubtedly I will perfect these transcendences.”

original: sems bskyed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba'am 'bras bu thun mongs 'dod pa yid la byed de /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba'am 'bras bu thun mongs 'dod pa yid la byed de /
translated: The generation of the resolve is the attention to the common result of the perfections, or to the application to the aims of self and other by the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni gzhan dang thun mong du gyur cig //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni gzhan dang thun mong du gyur cig //
translated: One should think, May the result of these perfections become common to all, may it not be otherwise!

original: gzhan du ma gyur cig snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ma gyur cig snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the motivation.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba ni //
translated: The application to the aims of self and other is the attention to the result of the perfections, because the result of the perfections is the aim of self and other.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu ji ltar byang chub pa bzhin du mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu ji ltar byang chub pa bzhin du mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The attention to the faith that accords with enlightenment is the attention to the result of the perfections, because one has faith in the result of the perfections in accordance with the way it is.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du bdag kyang mos so snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du bdag kyang mos so snyam du mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he thinks, “Just as the Lord Buddhas have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to the transcendences, so also do I aspire.”

original: thams cad du yang gi rims ni de lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang gi rims ni de lta bur rig par bya'o //

original: pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / tshogs yongs su smin pa dang / rang dang gzhan la phan pa dang / tshe phyi ma la rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa nyid do //

original: yang dag spro ba mchog dang brtse //
analyzed: yang dag spro ba mchog dang brtse //

translated: One is loving through practicing generosity and so on; one is compassionate toward sentient beings through not associating with stinginess and so on; one is joyful toward sentient beings who possess generosity and so on; and one is equanimous through the aspiration that they be free of the afflictions.
