analyzed: rgyas pa ni thos pa la mos pa rgyas pas so ;
translated: Extensive, because of the extensiveness of the faith of hearing.

original: / lhag pa'i bsam pa ni chos kyi sgo'i rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: / lhag pa'i bsam pa ni chos kyi sgo'i rgyun gyis so //
translated: Intense, because of the stream of the door of Dharma.

original: chen po ni dbang 'byor pa thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chen po ni dbang 'byor pa thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Great, for those who have attained mastery.

original: spang ba dang bcas pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: spang ba dang bcas pa ni dang po'o //
translated: Accompanied by application, for those who have not attained mastery.

original: spang ba med pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba med pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Irreproachable, because it is free of the three nonvirtues of body, etc.🔽Well known, because it is well known in the world.

original: dbang 'byor pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is mastery.

original: sku med pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sku med pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The fourth is without body, that is, it is born of hearing and reflection,

original: chos kyi sku dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the body of truth.

original: sku dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //🔽sku thob pa ni sa bdun po dag la'o //
analyzed: sku dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o // sku thob pa ni sa bdun po dag la'o //
translated: The fifth has a body, that is, it is born of meditation, on the stage of action in faith.🔽The sixth has attained a body, on the first seven stages.

original: sku yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa lhag pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sku yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa lhag pa rnams la'o //
translated: The seventh has a fully developed body, on the remaining stages.

original: nga rgyal mang ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal mang ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: The eighth has much pride, on the stage of action in faith.

original: nga rgyal phra ba ni sa bdun pa dag la'o ;
analyzed: nga rgyal phra ba ni sa bdun pa dag la'o ;
translated: The ninth has subtle pride, on the first seven stages.

original: / nga rgyal med pa ni sa lhag ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: / nga rgyal med pa ni sa lhag ma rnams la'o //
translated: The tenth has no pride, on the remaining stages.

original: rgyu gnyis kyi chos yongs su btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyi chos yongs su btsal ba la tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the investigation of the Dharma as cause

original: bstan bcos gzugs dang gzugs min la //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzugs dang gzugs min la //
translated: . The Dharma is the cause of form,🔽of marks, of health, of lordship through the superknowledges,

original: mtshan dang de bzhin nad med dang // mngon shes rnams kyis dbang phyug dang // de zad me shes nyid kyi rgyu //
analyzed: mtshan dang de bzhin nad med dang // mngon shes rnams kyis dbang phyug dang // de zad me shes nyid kyi rgyu //
translated: and of inexhaustibility.

original: chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o //
translated: The Dharma is the cause of form, of the major and minor marks of the Buddha.

original: gzugs ma yin pa la ni nad med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa la ni nad med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of health is in the formless realm,

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pacifies the disease of the afflictions.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dbang phyug rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dbang phyug rgyu yang yin no //
translated: They are also the cause of mastery through the superknowledges.

original: de dag zag mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yang yin te /🔽phung po'i lhag ma @180a * //
analyzed: de dag zag mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yang yin te / phung po'i lhag ma @180a * //
translated: They are also the cause of noncontamination,

original: ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are uninterrupted even in the nirvana without remainder.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Brahmaparipṛcchā Sūtra says:

original: chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos yongs su tshol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos yongs su tshol bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Bodhisattvas who have four qualities seek the Dharma.

original: dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don gyis sman gyis 'du shes dang / chud mi za ba'i don nyis nor gyi 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i don gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: dkon pa'i don gyis rin po che'i 'du shes dang / nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don gyis sman gyis 'du shes dang / chud mi za ba'i don nyis nor gyi 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i don gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa zhes gsungs so//
translated: The idea of a jewel, because of its rarity; the idea of medicine, because it cures the disease of the addictions; the idea of wealth, because it is inexhaustible; the idea of nirvana, because it is the pacification of all suffering.

original: mtshan rnams ni mdzes par byed pa'i phyir rin po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtshan rnams ni mdzes par byed pa'i phyir rin po che lta bu ste /
translated: The marks are like jewels, because they are beautiful.

original: de bas na de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos la rin po che ra 'du shes so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos la rin po che ra 'du shes so //
translated: Therefore, one should have the idea of the Dharma as a jewel, because it is the cause of that.

original: nad med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sman du 'du shes so //
analyzed: nad med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sman du 'du shes so //
translated: One should have the idea of it as medicine, because it is the cause of health.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dbang phyug gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nor du 'du shes so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dbang phyug gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nor du 'du shes so //
translated: One should have the idea of it as wealth, because it is the cause of the sovereignty of the superknowledges.

original: de dag zad mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
analyzed: de dag zad mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes te /
translated: One should have the idea of it as nirvana, because it is the cause of its inexhaustibility.

original: zad pas 'jigs pa med pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: zad pas 'jigs pa med pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is the meaning of fearlessness through exhaustion.

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su tshol ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the investigation of conceptualization🔽The sons of the Victor investigate nonexistence, existence,

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyis ni med pa dang yod pa dang // sgro 'dogs skur pa'i rtog pa dang gcig nyid du ma nyid //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyis ni med pa dang yod pa dang // sgro 'dogs skur pa'i rtog pa dang gcig nyid du ma nyid //
translated: superimposition, denial, identity, difference,

original: rang dang khyad par rtog dang ming don ji bzhin du //
analyzed: rang dang khyad par rtog dang ming don ji bzhin du //
translated: conceptualization of the imagined, and the adherence to the meaning of words.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa yang dag spang bar bya //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa yang dag spang bar bya //
translated: They should completely abandon conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpas rnam par rtog par rtog pa rnam pa bcu spang bar byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rnam par rtog par rtog pa rnam pa bcu spang bar byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva should abandon ten kinds of conceptualization.

original: med par rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: med par rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: The conceptualization of nonexistence is the antidote to which the Perfection of Insight says,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod par zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod par zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Here the bodhisattva exists as a bodhisattva.”

original: yod par rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod par rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of existence is the antidote to which the same text says, “The bodhisattva does not see a bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of superimposition is the antidote to which it was said, “Śāriputra, form is empty of the entityness of form.”

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por stong ba nyid por stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por stong ba nyid por stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of denial is the antidote to which it was said, “It is not by emptiness.”

original: gcig pa nyid du rnam par @180b rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rnam par @180b rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of identity is the antidote to which it was said, “The emptiness of form is not form.”

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa gang gi gnyen por stong ba nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa gang gi gnyen por stong ba nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The conceptualization of difference is the antidote to which it was said, “Form is not other than emptiness;

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: emptiness is not other than form.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs gang yin pa de ni ming tsam mi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs gang yin pa de ni ming tsam mi zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that is a specific characteristic is the antidote to the conceptual thought that is a name, as is stated in the statement: “Whatever form there is, that is merely a name.”

original: khyad par lam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs la ni skye ba yang med /
analyzed: khyad par lam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por gzugs la ni skye ba yang med /
translated: The conceptual thought that is a special quality is the antidote to the conceptual thought that is a path, as is stated in the statement: “In form there is no arising,

original: 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med /
translated: no cessation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: no defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba yang med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and no purification.”

original: ming ji lta ba de bzhin du don mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por ming ni bcos ma ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba de bzhin du don mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por ming ni bcos ma ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that is a name as it is in reality is the antidote to the conceptual thought that is a meaning as it is in reality, as is stated in the statement: “A name is a fabrication.”

original: don ji ta bar ming du mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpas ming de dag yang par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: don ji ta bar ming du mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpas ming de dag yang par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The conceptual thought that is a meaning as it is in reality is the antidote to the conceptual thought that is a name as it is in reality, as is stated in the statement: “The bodhisattva does not see those names as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na mngon par mi zhen to zhes bya gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na mngon par mi zhen to zhes bya gsungs pa yin te /
translated: When he does not see them as real, he does not cling to them.”

original: don ji lta bar snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta bar snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar blo gros dge ba brtson 'grus drag bsten nas //
analyzed: de ltar blo gros dge ba brtson 'grus drag bsten nas //
translated: Thus, having relied on intense effort with a virtuous intellect,

original: de bzhin nyid bcas gnyis kyi chos nyid yongs btsal ba //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bcas gnyis kyi chos nyid yongs btsal ba //
translated: having thoroughly investigated the reality of the two, i.e., the conventional and the ultimate,

original: de phyir rtag tu skyed dgu rnams kyi ston par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir rtag tu skyed dgu rnams kyi ston par 'gyur //
translated: he is always the teacher of the people.

original: de ni rgya mtsho bzhin du yon tan rnams kyis gang //
analyzed: de ni rgya mtsho bzhin du yon tan rnams kyis gang //
translated: He is filled with good qualities like the ocean.

original: mjug sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yongs su tshol ba'i bdag nyid rnam pa gsum ston te /
analyzed: mjug sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis yongs su tshol ba'i bdag nyid rnam pa gsum ston te /
translated: This concluding verse shows the three kinds of thorough investigation:

original: thabs kyis tshe ba'i bdag nyid ni brtson 'grus drag po nyid kyi phyir dang / kun rdzob dang ngang don dam pa'i chos nyid yongs su tshol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs kyis tshe ba'i bdag nyid ni brtson 'grus drag po nyid kyi phyir dang / kun rdzob dang ngang don dam pa'i chos nyid yongs su tshol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The kind of thorough investigation that is skillful means, because of intense effort and because of the thorough investigation of the conventional and ultimate realities.

original: de bzhin nyid dang bcas pa ni bden pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang bcas pa ni bden pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The kind that is reality, because of the thorough investigation of suchness.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi che ba'i bdag nyid skye dgu rnams kyi ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi che ba'i bdag nyid skye dgu rnams kyi ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The kind that is for the benefit of others, because he becomes the teacher of the people.

original: rang go don gyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni rgya mtsho bzhin du yon tan rnams kyis gang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang go don gyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni rgya mtsho bzhin du yon tan rnams kyis gang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of its meaning is like the ocean, because it is full of good qualities.

original: chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the investigation of the teaching is completed.

original: // / chos ston pa la ser sna dgag ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /🔽brtan pa rnams ni srog dang longs spyod tshigs ches rnyed cing snying po med pa @181a * //
analyzed: // / chos ston pa la ser sna dgag ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / brtan pa rnams ni srog dang longs spyod tshigs ches rnyed cing snying po med pa @181a * //
translated: A verse to prevent stinginess in teaching the Dharma🔽The steadfast always give generously to suffering beings, with a joyful mind,

original: dag ; / rab dga'i yid kyis sems can sdug bsngal rnams la sbyin rnams rgya chen rtag gtong na //
analyzed: dag ; / rab dga'i yid kyis sems can sdug bsngal rnams la sbyin rnams rgya chen rtag gtong na //
translated: their lives and wealth, which are difficult to obtain and have no essence.

original: chos yangs skye dgu rnams la rnam pa kun tu phan byed tshegs ches rnyed min zhing //
analyzed: chos yangs skye dgu rnams la rnam pa kun tu phan byed tshegs ches rnyed min zhing //
translated: What need is there to mention the Dharma, which is vast, always beneficial to all beings in every way, not difficult to obtain,

original: shin tu btang yang zad med 'phel 'gyur ba lta lan cig ma yin smos ci dgos ;
analyzed: shin tu btang yang zad med 'phel 'gyur ba lta lan cig ma yin smos ci dgos ;
translated: and which, though given abundantly, is not exhausted but increases, not just once but again and again?

original: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rjes srog dang longs spyod tshegs chen pos rnyed cing zad par 'gyur bas snying po med pa dag kyang sems can sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba rnams la sbyin pa rgya chen po rtag tu gtong na /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rjes srog dang longs spyod tshegs chen pos rnyed cing zad par 'gyur bas snying po med pa dag kyang sems can sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba rnams la sbyin pa rgya chen po rtag tu gtong na /
translated: The bodhisattvas, out of compassion, always give away their lives and possessions, which are acquired with great difficulty and are perishable and therefore worthless, to suffering beings.

original: chos gang zhig tshegs chen pos rnyed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: chos gang zhig tshegs chen pos rnyed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: How much more so will they give away the Dharma, which is not acquired with great difficulty,

original: shin tu btang yang zad pa med la /
analyzed: shin tu btang yang zad pa med la /
translated: which does not perish even when given away,

original: 'phel bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: and which increases when taught!

original: chos la don med pa nyid dang don yod pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos la don med pa nyid dang don yod pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the pointlessness and point of the Dharma.

original: gang phyir so so rang rig bya phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ma bstan //
analyzed: gang phyir so so rang rig bya phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ma bstan //
translated: The Bhagavat has not taught the Dharma in order that it be known individually by each one.

original: thugs rje'i bdag nyid sbrul chen lta bus rigs bshad dbugs 'dra'i chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bdag nyid sbrul chen lta bus rigs bshad dbugs 'dra'i chos rnams kyis //
translated: But the compassionate one, like a great snake, has spread the Dharma, which is like his breath,

original: skye bo nyid kyi chos la kun nas drangs te nyid zhi zhal gyi sgo //
analyzed: skye bo nyid kyi chos la kun nas drangs te nyid zhi zhal gyi sgo //
translated: in order to draw beings to his own Dharma and to open the door of peace.

original: rnam par dag pa rgya chen thun mong zad mi shes la yang dag bkod //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rgya chen thun mong zad mi shes la yang dag bkod //
translated: He has been established in the vast, pure, common, inexhaustible treasure.

original: de la sprul chen po lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: de la sprul chen po lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The great emanations are the Buddhas.

original: de dag nyid kyi zhi ba zhal gyi sgo ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi zhi ba zhal gyi sgo ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The door of their mouths, which is peace, is the Dharma Body,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa rgya che ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ba dang / gtan du ba'i phyir zad mi shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa rgya che ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ba dang / gtan du ba'i phyir zad mi shes pa yang yin no //
translated: which is vast purity, because of the purity from the afflictions and from the obstructions to omniscience, together with their traces. It is inexhaustible, because it is common to all Buddhas and is permanent.

original: de ltas rnal 'byor can gyis sgom pa gang yin de ni don med min //
analyzed: de ltas rnal 'byor can gyis sgom pa gang yin de ni don med min //
translated: Therefore, the meditation of the yogis is not meaningless.

original: de ltas bde bar gshegs kyi bstan pa gang yin de yang don med min //🔽gal te thos pa tsam gyis don mthong 'gyur na sgom pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltas bde bar gshegs kyi bstan pa gang yin de yang don med min // gal te thos pa tsam gyis don mthong 'gyur na sgom pa don med 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the Sugatas is not meaningless.🔽If one could see the truth by hearing it, meditation would be meaningless.

original: gal te ma thos par yang sgom 'jug 'gyur na bstan pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te ma thos par yang sgom 'jug 'gyur na bstan pa don med 'gyur //
translated: If one could enter into meditation without hearing it, the teaching would be meaningless.

original: de lta bas na rnal 'byor can rnams kyi bsgom pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnal 'byor can rnams kyi bsgom pa don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meditation of the yogis is not meaningless,

original: de'i dbang gis so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i chos rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by its power they realize the Dharma which is to be known personally.

original: bstan pa yang don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan pa yang don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the teaching is not meaningless,

original: rigs par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyis nyid kyi chos nyid la skye bo kun nas 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyis nyid kyi chos nyid la skye bo kun nas 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the Dharma which is well taught, the teacher leads all beings to their own true nature.

original: @181b bsgom pa dang / bshad pa ji ltar na don med par mi 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ston to //
analyzed: @181b bsgom pa dang / bshad pa ji ltar na don med par mi 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ston to //
translated: How the meditation and the teaching are not meaningless is shown by the first half of the verse.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: ston pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: ston pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the teacher

original: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the best of beings

original: lung dang rtogs dang dbang 'byor pas //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs dang dbang 'byor pas //
translated: is from the scriptures, from realization, and from mastery.

original: sa dang gzugs ni thams cad dang // nam mkha' las kyang 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: sa dang gzugs ni thams cad dang // nam mkha' las kyang 'byung ba yin //
translated: It arises from the earth, from forms, and from space.

original: de la dbang 'byor pa las ni sa chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang 'byor pa las ni sa chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Of these, that which arises from mastery is that of those who have entered the great stages.

original: gzugs thams cad las ni shing dang sil snyan la sogs pa'i bar las kyang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad las ni shing dang sil snyan la sogs pa'i bar las kyang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: All forms, even such things as wood and musical instruments, are its source.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the perfection of teaching🔽The teaching of the bodhisattvas is considered perfect when it is extensive, free from discouragement,

original: rgya che the tshom spong ba dang // gzung 'os de nyid gnyis ston pa //🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: rgya che the tshom spong ba dang // gzung 'os de nyid gnyis ston pa // 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: gracious, and a revealer of reality in its twofold mode.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs yin zhes bya //
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs yin zhes bya //
translated: This is the perfection of teaching of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: This verse is from the Brahmapariprccha Sutra.

original: chos bzhi po dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag nyid kyi shes rab sbyangs pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par ston pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni ches kyi sbyin pa chen po rnam par 'byed do zhes gang gsungs pa'i don bzhi ston pa yin te /
analyzed: chos bzhi po dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdag nyid kyi shes rab sbyangs pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par ston pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni ches kyi sbyin pa chen po rnam par 'byed do zhes gang gsungs pa'i don bzhi ston pa yin te /
translated: The four topics are: the bodhisattvas who possess the four dharmas of upholding the holy Dharma, training in their own wisdom, performing the deeds of holy beings, and teaching thoroughly the afflictions and purification, they discern the great gift of Dharma.🔽One verse on the analysis of the gift of fearlessness.🔽The brave bodhisattva, in order to protect others from fear, gives fearlessness, which is threefold:

original: gcig gis ni mang du thos pa'i phyir ston pa rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gis ni mang du thos pa'i phyir ston pa rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: The brave bodhisattva, in order to protect others from fear, gives fearlessness, which is threefold:🔽The first is the fearlessness of being unafraid in the face of the fears of samsara and personal salvation.

original: gnyis pas ni shes rab che ba'i phyir the tshom spong ba ste /🔽gzhan dag gi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni shes rab che ba'i phyir the tshom spong ba ste / gzhan dag gi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is the fearlessness of being unafraid in the face of the fears of the dangers of the life-cycle.

original: gsum pas ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las can yin pa'i phyir gzung bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las can yin pa'i phyir gzung bar 'os pa'o //
translated: The third is the fearlessness of being unafraid in the face of the fears of the dangers of the life-cycle.

original: bzhi pas ni bden pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa gnyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni bden pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid rnam pa gnyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourth shows the two kinds of reality, the reality of the process of affliction and the reality of the process of purification.

original: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the supreme beings is

original: 'jam zhing rgyags bral mi skyo ba //
analyzed: 'jam zhing rgyags bral mi skyo ba //
translated: gentle, not haughty, not wearying,🔽clear, various, reasonable,

original: gsal zhing sna tshogs rigs pa dang // 'go zhing zang zing med kun 'gro //
analyzed: gsal zhing sna tshogs rigs pa dang // 'go zhing zang zing med kun 'gro //
translated: engaging, disinterested, and universal.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa 'di la 'jam pa ni gzhan gyis brgal ba la tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyags pa dang @182a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa 'di la 'jam pa ni gzhan gyis brgal ba la tshig rtsub mo mi 'byin pa'i phyir ro // rgyags pa dang @182a * //
translated: In this second verse, “gentle” means that it does not use harsh words in debate.

original: bral ba ni bstod dam grub na rgyags par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba ni bstod dam grub na rgyags par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not haughty” means that it is not haughty when praised or successful.

original: mi skyo ba ni dub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skyo ba ni dub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not wearying” means that it is not exhausted.

original: gsal ba ni zad par ston pas slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni zad par ston pas slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Clear” means that it is not stingy with the teacher’s instructions, because it teaches completely.

original: sna tshogs ni mi zlos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni mi zlos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Various” means that it is not repetitive.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Reasonable” means that it is not contradicted by validating cognition.

original: 'go ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'go ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the most excellent of words and syllables.

original: zang zing med pa ni /
analyzed: zang zing med pa ni /
translated: It is disinterested,

original: dad pa'i lhag par bya ba don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i lhag par bya ba don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not motivated by the desire for material gain or for honor.

original: kun tu 'gro ba ni theg pa gsum car la 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba ni theg pa gsum car la 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is universal, because it is directed to all three vehicles.

original: tshig phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: tshig phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the excellence of speech

original: rgyal sras tshig ni mi zhan pa ;
analyzed: rgyal sras tshig ni mi zhan pa ;
translated: The speech of the victors' spiritual heir is not weak,🔽melodious, well expressed, and clear,

original: / snyan zhing legs bshad grags pa dang // ci rigs pa dang zang zing med //
analyzed: / snyan zhing legs bshad grags pa dang // ci rigs pa dang zang zing med //
translated: appropriate, and disinterested.

original: ran zhing de bzhin yangs pa yin //🔽mi zhan pa ni grong khyer pa ste /
analyzed: ran zhing de bzhin yangs pa yin // mi zhan pa ni grong khyer pa ste /
translated: It is timely, and likewise expansive.

original: 'khor la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not weak, because it is not timid in the assemblies.

original: snyan pa ni snyan zhing 'jebs pa'o //🔽legs par bshad pa ni rnam par gsal ba ste /🔽yi ge legs par nges par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni snyan zhing 'jebs pa'o // legs par bshad pa ni rnam par gsal ba ste / yi ge legs par nges par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is melodious, because it is pleasant to the ear.🔽It is well expressed, because it is clear.🔽It is clear, because it is well articulated.

original: grags pa ni rnam par rig par byed pa ste /🔽grags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa ni rnam par rig par byed pa ste / grags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear, because it is well articulated.

original: ci rigs pa ni mnyan par 'os pa ste /
analyzed: ci rigs pa ni mnyan par 'os pa ste /
translated: It is appropriate, because it is suitable for the occasion.

original: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in accord with the disciples.

original: zang zing med pa ni brten pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing med pa ni brten pa med pa ste /
translated: It is disinterested, because it is independent.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is independent of gain, honor, and flattery.

original: ran pa ni mi mthun pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ran pa ni mi mthun pa med pa ste /
translated: It is moderate, because it is not excessive.

original: ran pa la mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ran pa la mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not excessive, because it does not weary the disciples.

original: yangs pa ni gtugs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yangs pa ni gtugs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is extensive, because it is inexhaustible.

original: yi ge phun sum tshogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yi ge phun sum tshogs pa la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the perfection of letters

original: bstan dang de bzhin bshad pa dang // theg dang mthun dang bde ba dang // grags pa dang ni ci rigs dang // nges par 'byung dang mthun pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bstan dang de bzhin bshad pa dang // theg dang mthun dang bde ba dang // grags pa dang ni ci rigs dang // nges par 'byung dang mthun pa'i phyir //
translated: . It is taught, explained, in accord with the vehicles, pleasant, famous, appropriate, liberative, and reasonable.

original: bstan pa ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni tshig dang yi ge rigs pa ste /
translated: It is taught, because it is reasonable in its words and letters.

original: rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable, because it is not contrary to the principles of reality.

original: bshad pa ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: It is explained, because it is connected.

original: bstan pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is connected, because it is not contrary to the teaching.

original: theg pa dang mthun pa ni mthun pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa dang mthun pa ni mthun pa ste /
translated: It is in accord with the vehicles, because it is suitable.

original: theg pa gsum car dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa gsum car dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is suitable, because it is not contrary to any of the three vehicles.

original: bde ba ni rung ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni rung ba ste /
translated: It is appropriate,

original: sgra nyam nga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra nyam nga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not harsh sounding.

original: grags pa ni 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: grags pa ni 'byor pa ste /
translated: It is prosperous,

original: don grags pa nyid kyis 'don pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don grags pa nyid kyis 'don pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is prosperous with meaning.

original: ci rigs pa ni 'phrod pa ste /
analyzed: ci rigs pa ni 'phrod pa ste /
translated: It is suitable,

original: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is suitable for those to be trained.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni 'tsham pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni 'tsham pa ste /
translated: It is appropriate,

original: mya ngan las @182b 'das pa'i ched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las @182b 'das pa'i ched kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of nirvana.

original: mthun pa ni 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs te /
analyzed: mthun pa ni 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi tshogs te /
translated: It is harmonious,

original: slob ma'i 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma'i 'phags pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is harmonious with the noble path of disciples.

original: de mdor sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi //
analyzed: de mdor sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi //
translated: In brief, the supreme beings’

original: yi ge phun tshogs yin zhes bya //
analyzed: yi ge phun tshogs yin zhes bya //
translated: speech is perfect.

original: bde gshegs gsung ni mtha' yas te //🔽yan lag drug cu bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: bde gshegs gsung ni mtha' yas te // yan lag drug cu bsam mi khyab //
translated: The speech of the sugatas is infinite,

original: yan lag drug cu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag drug cu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni /
translated: with sixty inconceivable qualities.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag pos bstan pa las /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag pos bstan pa las /
translated: The sixty inconceivable qualities of speech are taught in the Lord of Secrets’ Oral Instructions Tantra:

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rnam pa drug cu bstan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rnam pa drug cu bstan pa /
translated: The Buddha’s speech is taught to have sixty aspects.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni rnam pa drug cu dang ldan par 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni rnam pa drug cu dang ldan par 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāntamati, the speech of the Tathāgata arises endowed with sixty aspects.

original: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is gentle, smooth, pleasing, agreeable, pure, and so on at length.

original: de la mnyen pa ni sems can gyi khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mnyen pa ni sems can gyi khams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is gentle because it reveals the roots of virtue of the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'jam pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la reg na bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la reg na bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is smooth because it is pleasant to experience in this very life.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because it has a good meaning.

original: yid du 'thad pa ni yi ge bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa ni yi ge bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is agreeable because it has good words.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa gong na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa gong na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it is supramundane and unsurpassed.

original: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all latent and manifest afflictions.

original: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clear means that the words and letters are well known.

original: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa thams cad kyi lta ba 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant means that it has the good quality of the power to destroy the views of all non-Buddhists with bad ideas.

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Worth listening to means that it leads to liberation through practice.

original: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol thams cad kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Unassailable means that it cannot be defeated by any opponent.

original: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beautiful means that it delights.

original: dul ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Gentle means that it is the antidote to desire and so on.

original: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bca' ba'i thabs bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bca' ba'i thabs bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not harsh means that it is the easy method for making vows.

original: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das nas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das nas nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Not coarse means that it correctly teaches the method for liberation after transcending that.

original: / rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum char gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum char gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well disciplined means that it teaches the discipline of all three vehicles.

original: rnar snyan pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnar snyan pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing to the ear, because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i @183a * //
analyzed: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir ro // sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i @183a * //
translated: It is refreshing to the body, because it produces concentration.🔽It is refreshing to the mind, because it produces joy through insight.

original: phyir ro ; / snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gladdening to the heart, because it resolves doubts.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It produces joy and ease, because it removes wrong certainty.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not oppressive, because there is no regret in practicing it.

original: kun tu shes par bya ba ni //
analyzed: kun tu shes par bya ba ni //
translated: It is to be fully understood,

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the perfection of knowledge born of hearing.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be cognized, because it is the basis for the perfection of knowledge born of contemplation.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med par chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med par chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear, because the teacher teaches the Dharma without holding anything back.

original: dga' bar byed pa ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing, because it pleases those who have attained their own goal.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni rang gi don rjes su ma thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni rang gi don rjes su ma thob pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is delightful, because it delights those who have not attained their own goal.

original: kun shes par byed pa ni /
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa ni /
translated: It causes understanding,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du rung ba'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du rung ba'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes awareness, because it teaches the conceivable Dharma.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable, because it does not contradict valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa ni gdul ba la ji ltar rigs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gdul ba la ji ltar rigs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is coherent, because it teaches in accordance with the disciples.

original: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without the fault of repetition, because it is not meaningless.

original: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lion's roar is powerful because it terrifies all the hosts of non-Buddhists.

original: glang po che'i sgra skad ni rgya che ba'i phyir ro //🔽'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni brjid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glang po che'i sgra skad ni rgya che ba'i phyir ro // 'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni brjid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elephant's voice is majestic because it is vast.🔽The sound of the dragon's voice is majestic because it is majestic.

original: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the lord of the nagas is worthy of being grasped because it is worthy of being grasped.

original: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro //🔽ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rno ba dang 'jigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro // ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rno ba dang 'jigs pa'i phyir ro ;

original: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grag pa ni grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni mi 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grag pa ni grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni mi 'da' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the kalaviṅka's voice is proclaimed because it is proclaimed.🔽The

original: rnga'i sgra ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnga'i sgra ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the drum is the forerunner of victory over all demons and adversaries.

original: ma khengs pa ni bstod kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma khengs pa ni bstod kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not arrogant because it is not defiled by praise.

original: mi dma' ba ni smad kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dma' ba ni smad kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not low because it is not defiled by blame.

original: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni thams @183b cad lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam pa thams cad du rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni thams @183b cad lung bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam pa thams cad du rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is engaged in all sounds because it is engaged in all aspects of the character of the declaration of all things.

original: tshig zur chag med pa ni bsnyel te mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig zur chag med pa ni bsnyel te mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not broken because it does not forget.

original: ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not incomplete because it is always present for the performance of the duties of guiding.

original: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is not faint because it is not dependent on gain and honor.

original: / mi zhan pa ni bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mi zhan pa ni bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not weak because it is free from fear.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is joyful because it is not discouraged.

original: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽thab dang bcas pa'i ched ni /
analyzed: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // thab dang bcas pa'i ched ni /
translated: It is pervasive because it is endowed with knowledge of all the sciences.

original: sems can rnams kyi de dag gi don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi de dag gi don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is for the sake of the assembly because it accomplishes all the aims of living beings.

original: / rgyun chags pa ni rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rgyun chags pa ni rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is continuous because it is uninterrupted.

original: 'brel pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni /
translated: It is connected because it is present in various forms.

original: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa rnam pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It fulfills all sounds because many different sound-cognitions are present in a single sound.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies all faculties because many different object-cognitions are present in a single object.

original: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable because it is in accord with its promise.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unchanging because it is applied at the appropriate time.

original: ma rtabs  pa ni rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rtabs  pa ni rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not hurried because it does not speak hurriedly.

original: 'khor kun tu grag pa ni 'khor nye ba dang ring bas mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor kun tu grag pa ni 'khor nye ba dang ring bas mtshungs par thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is heard everywhere, because it is heard equally by those near and far.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni /
translated: It is endowed with the best of all aspects,

original: 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all mundane goals are transformed into the Dharma of examples.

original: ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four verses on the greatness of the teacher.

original: ngag tshig shin tu rigs pa dang // bstan dang rnam 'byed the tshom gcod //
analyzed: ngag tshig shin tu rigs pa dang // bstan dang rnam 'byed the tshom gcod //
translated: His speech is very reasonable, and it teaches, analyzes, and resolves doubts.

original: lan mang byed dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: lan mang byed dang ldan pa ni //
translated: It is repeated many times,

original: mgo smos rnam spros go rnams la //
analyzed: mgo smos rnam spros go rnams la //
translated: for those who understand through brief statements, and for those who understand through detailed explanations.

original: brjod pa ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ngag gis so //
translated: It is expressed by speech.

original: 'dogs pa ni tshig shin tu rigs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: 'dogs pa ni tshig shin tu rigs pa dag gis so //
translated: It is applied by very reasonable words.

original: rab tu 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par 'brel pa ni go rims bzhin du stan pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / the tshom gcod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par 'brel pa ni go rims bzhin du stan pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / the tshom gcod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is well-founded, analytical, and resolving of doubts, respectively, by teaching, analysis, and resolution of doubts.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni bshad pa la nges pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir lan mang du byed pa dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni bshad pa la nges pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir lan mang du byed pa dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “he teaches it clearly” shows that he teaches it many times, in order to generate the power of certainty in the explanation.

original: ston pa ni mgo smos pas go ba rnams la'o //🔽yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni rnam par spros @184a * //
analyzed: ston pa ni mgo smos pas go ba rnams la'o // yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni rnam par spros @184a * //
translated: “He teaches” refers to those who understand through a brief indication.

original: na go ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: na go ba rnams la'o //
translated: “He teaches it perfectly” refers to those who understand through an extensive explanation.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ston pa 'di //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ston pa 'di //
translated: This teaching of the buddhas

original: 'khor gsum gyis ni dag pa ste //
analyzed: 'khor gsum gyis ni dag pa ste //
translated: is pure in three ways.🔽It should be understood as being free

original: 'di ni nyes pa brgyad dag dang // bral ba nyid du shes par bya //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa brgyad dag dang // bral ba nyid du shes par bya //
translated: from the eight faults.

original: 'khor gsum gyis dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gsum gyis dag pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase “pure in three ways” refers to the purity of the three sectors.

original: ngag dang tshig dag dang / ji ltar ston pa ste /
analyzed: ngag dang tshig dag dang / ji ltar ston pa ste /
translated: The purity of the speaker is the purity of the voice and words.

original: bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / gang dag la ston pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / gang dag la ston pa ste /
translated: The purity of the teaching is the purity of the teaching itself.

original: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros na go ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros na go ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The purity of the listener is the purity of the person who understands through a brief indication or through an extensive explanation.

original: yang ston pa 'di nyid go rims bzhin du nyes pa brgyad dang bral bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang ston pa 'di nyid go rims bzhin du nyes pa brgyad dang bral bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This teaching should be understood as being free from the eight faults, in the same order.

original: le lo dang ni mi 'go ba //
analyzed: le lo dang ni mi 'go ba //
translated: Laziness, lack of courage,🔽lack of opportunity, uncertainty,

original: skabs mi 'byed dang ma nges dang // the tshom dag ni mi gcod dang // de dang bral ba brtan mi byed //
analyzed: skabs mi 'byed dang ma nges dang // the tshom dag ni mi gcod dang // de dang bral ba brtan mi byed //
translated: not resolving doubts, and not stabilizing the mind free from doubt.

original: nyes pa brgyad po de dag kyang le lo dang / mi 'go ba dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa dang / don nges pa ma yin pa nyid dang / the tshom mi gcod pa nyid dang ; / de dang bral ba brtan por mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa brgyad po de dag kyang le lo dang / mi 'go ba dang / go skabs mi 'byed pa dang / don nges pa ma yin pa nyid dang / the tshom mi gcod pa nyid dang ; / de dang bral ba brtan por mi byed pa ste /
translated: These eight faults are laziness, lack of courage, lack of opportunity, uncertainty of meaning, not resolving doubts, and not stabilizing the mind free from doubt.

original: nges par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “certainly” is understood.

original: skyo ba dang ni ser sna nyid //
analyzed: skyo ba dang ni ser sna nyid //
translated: Discouragement and stinginess

original: 'di dag gtam gyi nyes par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di dag gtam gyi nyes par 'dod //
translated: are considered faults in teaching.

original: de dag med phyir sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: de dag med phyir sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: Because the Buddha is free of these,

original: bshad pa bla na med par 'gyur //🔽skyo ba dang ni gang gis yang dang yang du ston par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa bla na med par 'gyur // skyo ba dang ni gang gis yang dang yang du ston par mi byed pa'o //
translated: his teaching is unsurpassed.🔽Discouragement is the cause of not teaching again and again.

original: ser sna nyid ni zad par yang dag par rab tu ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna nyid ni zad par yang dag par rab tu ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Stinginess is the cause of not teaching completely.

original: don phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the perfection of meaning.

original: dad dang dga' dang blo rnams kyi //
analyzed: dad dang dga' dang blo rnams kyi //
translated: Because it is the cause of faith, joy and understanding,

original: rgyu phyir chos 'di dge ba yin //
analyzed: rgyu phyir chos 'di dge ba yin //
translated: this doctrine is virtuous.🔽It is virtuous in the beginning, middle and end,🔽it is endowed with the essence,🔽it is endowed with the two aims, easy to grasp,

original: don rnam gnyis ldan gzung sla dang // yon tan bzhi ldan tshangs spyod ston //
analyzed: don rnam gnyis ldan gzung sla dang // yon tan bzhi ldan tshangs spyod ston //
translated: and it teaches pure action with four qualities.🔽It is endowed with the essence,

original: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin ldan pa dang // khams gsum nyon mongs rnam spong rdzogs byed dang // ngo bo nyid dag dri ma dag pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin ldan pa dang // khams gsum nyon mongs rnam spong rdzogs byed dang // ngo bo nyid dag dri ma dag pa ste //
translated: it is endowed with the two aims, easy to grasp,

original: tshangs spyod yon tan bzhi ldan yin par 'dod //🔽yon tan bzhi ldan gyi tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i chos ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa dag gis dad pa dang dga' ba dang / blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thog ma dang /
analyzed: tshangs spyod yon tan bzhi ldan yin par 'dod // yon tan bzhi ldan gyi tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i chos ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa dag gis dad pa dang dga' ba dang / blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thog ma dang /
translated: and it teaches pure action with four qualities.

original: bar dang tha mar dge ba yin no //
analyzed: bar dang tha mar dge ba yin no //
translated: The doctrine which perfectly teaches pure action endowed with four qualities is virtuous in the beginning, middle and end, because it is the cause of faith, joy and understanding, respectively, through learning, reflection and meditation.

original: de la dad pa ni mos pa dang yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni mos pa dang yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is confidence and resolve.

original: dga' ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags pa'i @184b sgo nas thob pa nyid du nus par rig nas rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags pa'i @184b sgo nas thob pa nyid du nus par rig nas rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the delight that comes from knowing that one is able to attain the goal by means of rational investigation.

original: blo ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: Intellect is the knowledge of reality as it is, in a mind that is concentrated.

original: don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas de'i phyir don bzang po yin te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas de'i phyir don bzang po yin te /
translated: It is good in meaning because it is endowed with two kinds of meaning:

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the conventional and the ultimate truth.

original: gzur sla bas de'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po yin te /
analyzed: gzur sla bas de'i phyir tshig 'bru bzang po yin te /
translated: It is good in letter because it is easy to understand,

original: tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because its words and syllables are well known.🔽The pure life is endowed with four excellences:

original: yon tan bzhi ldan gyi tshangs par spyod pa la ma 'dres pa ni gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan bzhi ldan gyi tshangs par spyod pa la ma 'dres pa ni gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is unadulterated, because it is not shared with others;

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is complete, because it is complete in the abandonment of the passions of the three realms;

original: yongs su dag pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is pure, because it is uncontaminated by nature.

original: yongs su byang ba ni dri ma rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa zad pa rnams kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ni dri ma rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa zad pa rnams kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Purified means that the continuum of those whose defilements are exhausted is purified by means of the purification of stain.

original: ldem por dgongs pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of indirect expressions:

original: gzhug pa ldem por dgongs pa dang // mtshan nyid ldem por dgongs pa gzhan //
analyzed: gzhug pa ldem por dgongs pa dang // mtshan nyid ldem por dgongs pa gzhan //
translated: 1. There is the indirect expression of introduction, another of characteristic,

original: gnyen po ldem por dgongs pa dang // bsgyur la ldem por dgongs pa ste //
analyzed: gnyen po ldem por dgongs pa dang // bsgyur la ldem por dgongs pa ste //
translated: of antidote, and of transformation.

original: nyan thos dang ni ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ni ngo bo nyid //
translated: 2. The indirect expression of the śrāvaka, of the essence,🔽and likewise of the disciple, of the fault,

original: de bzhin nyes pa gdul ba dang // brjod pa zab pa nyid la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nyes pa gdul ba dang // brjod pa zab pa nyid la ni //
translated: and of the profound expression,

original: ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi //
translated: are the four kinds of indirect expressions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa la ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa la ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The indirect expressions of the Buddha's teaching should be understood as fourfold.

original: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang / mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem bor dgongs pa dang // bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang / mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem bor dgongs pa dang // bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The indirect expression of introduction, the indirect expression of characteristic, the indirect expression of antidote, and the indirect expression of transformation.

original: de la gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyan thos rnams la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyan thos rnams la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The intention of indirect expression in regard to introduction is to be seen in the Sravakayana.

original: bstan pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don du mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don du mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the purpose of introducing to the teaching, in order to avoid frightening them, form, etc. are taught as existing.

original: mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa ni kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum la blta bar bya ste //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa ni kun brtags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum la blta bar bya ste //
translated: The intention of indirect expression in regard to characteristic is to be seen in the three natures, imagined, etc.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the purpose of teaching that all things are without own-being, unborn, etc.

original: gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyes pa rnams gdul bar bya ba la blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: le lo'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' legs par smra ba yin pa ste //

analyzed: bshad pas skye bo'i nang na nyi ma bzhin du lham //

analyzed: rgyu lngas legs par smra ba nyid dang / nyi ma bzhin du lham pa'i phan yon yin te /

analyzed: 'jig rten 'dun @186b par byed pa'i sgo nas ya mtshan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu lnga ni /
analyzed: rgyu lnga ni /
translated: The five causes are

analyzed: gang gis phyin ci ma log pa dang / yang dang yang du dang / zang zing med pa'i sems dang / tshig gzung bar 'os ba dang / gdul ba dang 'tsham par 'chad pa yin no //
translated: It is unmistaken, repeated, disinterested, its words are acceptable, and it is adapted to the disciple.

original: bshad pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: bshad pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on teaching is completed.

original: // / sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: // / sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the analysis of practice🔽The wise, having abandoned the two errors

analyzed: blo ldan gnyis la log nyid dang // yang dag nyid rnams spangs gsum gyis //
translated: with regard to the two,

analyzed: gang zag dang ni chos dag la //
translated: the person and the doctrine,

original: bdag med rnam gnyis kun shes nas //
analyzed: bdag med rnam gnyis kun shes nas //
translated: and having understood the two kinds of no-self,

analyzed: ji skad du / don kun shes shing chos kun shes nas chos dang mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin / mthun par zhugs pa yin /

analyzed: / gnyis la log pa nyid dang yang dag pa nyid /

translated: The three concentrations are on the non-existence of the imagined reality, the emptiness concentration; and on the existence of the other-dependent reality and the perfected reality, the wishless and signless concentrations.

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum po 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes 'dren pa'i phyir log pa nyid kyang ma yin la /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //

analyzed: don shes pas ni chos rnams kun //

analyzed: gzings dang 'dra ba nyid du rig / thos pas chog par 'dzin spong ba //
