original: des na chos shes pa zhes brjod //
analyzed: des na chos shes pa zhes brjod //
translated: and so is called the one who knows the meaning.

original: de ltar don shes pa ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gzings lta bu nyid du shes shing thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa spong bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar don shes pa ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos thams cad gzings lta bu nyid du shes shing thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa spong bar byed de /
translated: Thus, understanding the meaning, one understands that all Dharma teachings, such as the sutras, are like rafts and one abandons the grasping at the sufficiency of mere learning.

original: des na chos shes pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na chos shes pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, one understands the Dharma.🔽Through the understanding of the two,

original: / so so'i skye bo'i shes pa yis //
analyzed: / so so'i skye bo'i shes pa yis //
translated: the ordinary person,🔽one realizes the two kinds of selflessness

original: de bzhin du ni gnyis rtogs nas //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gnyis rtogs nas //
translated: in that way.

original: shes pa de yongs rdzogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: shes pa de yongs rdzogs bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to perfect that understanding,

original: mthun pa'i chos ni rab tu sgrub //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos ni rab tu sgrub //
translated: one practices the Dharma that is concordant with it.

original: so so'i skye bo'i don dang chos shes pa rnam pa gnyis po des de bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i bdag med pa gnyis @187a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i don dang chos shes pa rnam pa gnyis po des de bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i bdag med pa gnyis @187a * //
translated: Through the two kinds of understanding of the meaning and the Dharma by the ordinary person, one realizes the two kinds of selflessness as they have been explained.

original: rtogs nas / shes pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: rtogs nas / shes pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed de /
translated: In order to perfect that understanding, one practices.

original: de ltar na mthun pa'i chos la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mthun pa'i chos la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one engages in the Dharma that is concordant with it.

original: de nas des ni sa dang por //
analyzed: de nas des ni sa dang por //
translated: Then, on the first ground,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag nyid //🔽kun dang mnyam par 'jig rten las//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag nyid // kun dang mnyam par 'jig rten las//
translated: the bodhisattva attains🔽the unsurpassed supramundane wisdom

original: 'das pa'i ye shes bla med 'thob //
analyzed: 'das pa'i ye shes bla med 'thob //
translated: equal to all of them.

original: de nas des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bla na med pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bla na med pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, he attains the unsurpassed supramundane intuition.

original: theg pa ches khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa ches khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other vehicle more exalted than this.

original: sa dang po sa rab tu dga' ba la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam par ro //
analyzed: sa dang po sa rab tu dga' ba la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam par ro //
translated: On the first stage, the Joyous, he is equal to all the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de'i sa pa rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de'i sa pa rnams dang ngo //
translated: “Of that stage” means of that stage.

original: de ltar na mthun par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mthun par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Thus he is engaged in the same way,

original: de'i sa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽mthong bas spang bya'i nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro // mthong bas spang bya'i nyon mongs rnams //
translated: because he is equal to the bodhisattvas of that stage.🔽Having completely destroyed

original: thams cad yang dag zad byas nas //🔽shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bya'i phyir ;
analyzed: thams cad yang dag zad byas nas // shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bya'i phyir ;
translated: all the addictions abandoned by the path of insight,🔽he applies himself to the cultivation

original: / sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: / sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: of the transcendences in order to abandon the obscurations to knowledge.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do //🔽rnam 'jog rnam par mi rtog pa'i //🔽ye shes lhan cig spyod pa yis //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do // rnam 'jog rnam par mi rtog pa'i // ye shes lhan cig spyod pa yis //
translated: The meaning of this verse is self evident.🔽The bodhisattva who is in the first stage🔽is called “engaged in the same way”

original: de bzhin sa ni lhag ma la //
analyzed: de bzhin sa ni lhag ma la //
translated: because he is engaged in the same activity as those who are in the other stages.

original: mthun pa yi ni chos spyod do //
analyzed: mthun pa yi ni chos spyod do //
translated: He practices the Dharma in accord with it.

original: lhag mas ni mthun pa'i chos spyod pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: lhag mas ni mthun pa'i chos spyod pa nyid ston te /
translated: The rest of the verse shows the practice of the Dharma in accord with it.

original: rnam par 'jog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sa rnam par 'jog pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sa rnam par 'jog pa'i ye shes dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The terms “determinative” and “nonconceptual” refer to the gnosis that determines the stages and the nonconceptual gnosis.

original: lhan cig spyod pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel bar spyod pa ste /
translated: “ In accord with” means in connection with.

original: phan tshun bar chad med pas so //
analyzed: phan tshun bar chad med pas so //
translated: Because they are mutually uninterrupted.🔽Four verses on conscientious attitudes in practice

original: sgrub pa la bag yod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa la bag yod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four verses on the conscientious attitude toward practice.

original: blo ldan gang du sgrub pa'i yul //
analyzed: blo ldan gang du sgrub pa'i yul //
translated: The wise person’s place of practice🔽is well-stocked, well-situated,🔽well-natured, well-accompanied,

original: legs par rnyed dang gnas bzang dang // sa bzang ba dang grogs bzang dang // rnal 'byor bde ba'i yon tan ldan //
analyzed: legs par rnyed dang gnas bzang dang // sa bzang ba dang grogs bzang dang // rnal 'byor bde ba'i yon tan ldan //
translated: and well-qualified for yoga.

original: mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa la sogs pa 'khor lo bzhis bag yod par bya ba ston te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa la sogs pa 'khor lo bzhis bag yod par bya ba ston te /
translated: The four circles show conscientious attitudes in the practice of dwelling in a favorable place, etc.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa ston to //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa ston to //
translated: This verse shows dwelling in a favorable place.

original: legs par rnyed pa ni chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams tshegs chung ngus rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par rnyed pa ni chos gos dang / bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams tshegs chung ngus rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good attainment means that the necessities of life, such as robes, alms, bedding, and so forth, are obtained with little difficulty.

original: gnas bzang ba ni rkun po la sogs pa skye bo ngan pa dag mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas bzang ba ni rkun po la sogs pa skye bo ngan pa dag mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good location means that it is not a place where bad people such as thieves and so forth live.

original: sa @187b bzang ba ni nad med pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa @187b bzang ba ni nad med pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good ground means that it is a place free from disease.

original: grogs bzang po ni grogs tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grogs bzang po ni grogs tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good companions means that one’s companions are those who are in accord with oneself in morality and view.

original: rnal 'byor bde ba ni nyin par 'du 'dzi nyung zhing ljan ljin nyung ba'i phyir dang / mtshan mo sgra chung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bde ba ni nyin par 'du 'dzi nyung zhing ljan ljin nyung ba'i phyir dang / mtshan mo sgra chung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Good yoga means that during the day there is little distraction and little noise, and that at night there is little sound, and so forth.🔽The bodhisattva is one of great learning,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thos mang dang ; / bden mthong smra mkhas brtse ba can //🔽skyo med skyes bu dam pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thos mang dang ; / bden mthong smra mkhas brtse ba can // skyo med skyes bu dam pa ni //
translated: sees the truth, is eloquent, and full of love.🔽He is a great man,

original: chen po yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: chen po yin par shes par bya //
translated: a true spiritual being.

original: gnyis pa 'dis ni skyes bu dam pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'dis ni skyes bu dam pa nyid ston te /
translated: This second verse shows him to be a true spiritual being.

original: lung dang rtogs pa dang / tshig tu smra ba dang / zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snyom las med pa nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽dmigs pa bzang dang ston pa bzang //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa dang / tshig tu smra ba dang / zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snyom las med pa nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // dmigs pa bzang dang ston pa bzang //
translated: because it is endowed with the qualities of scripture and realization, of speaking with words, of an unattached mind, and of being indefatigable.🔽The good objective, the good teaching,🔽the good means, the good deliverance,

original: thabs bzang ba dang nges 'byung dang // sbyor ba bzang po'i bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: thabs bzang ba dang nges 'byung dang // sbyor ba bzang po'i bdag nyid kyi //
translated: and the good application are explained

original: yang dag smon lam yin par bshad //
analyzed: yang dag smon lam yin par bshad //
translated: as the nature of the true aspirational prayer.

original: gsum pa 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa ston te /
analyzed: gsum pa 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa ston te /
translated: This third verse shows the nature of the true aspirational prayer as consisting of proper mental attention.

original: dam pa'i chos la dmigs pa dang / tshogs bsags pa dang / zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dus su sgom pa dang / gong du bya ba yod pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / rtag tu dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dmigs pa dang / tshogs bsags pa dang / zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dus su sgom pa dang / gong du bya ba yod pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / rtag tu dang gus par byas te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the objective of the holy Dharma, the accumulation of the stores, the meditation at the proper time of the signs of serenity, etc., the non-satisfaction with just a little because there is more to be done, and the constant and respectful application.

original: dga' dang dal bar skye ba dang // nad med ba dang ting 'dzin dang // rnam par 'byed pa byed rgyu ni //🔽sngon chad bsod nams byas pa nyid //🔽bzhi pa 'dis ni rgyu rnam pa lngas sngon bsod nams byas pa nyid ston te /🔽dga' ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gis na mi mthun pa'i yul du gnas na yang dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' dang dal bar skye ba dang // nad med ba dang ting 'dzin dang // rnam par 'byed pa byed rgyu ni // sngon chad bsod nams byas pa nyid // bzhi pa 'dis ni rgyu rnam pa lngas sngon bsod nams byas pa nyid ston te / dga' ba'i rgyu nyid ni gang gis na mi mthun pa'i yul du gnas na yang dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: 1. Delight, birth in a favorable state,🔽freedom from illness, meditative concentration,🔽and discernment are the causes of the bodhisattvas'🔽previous creation of merit.🔽🔽This fourth verse shows the previous creation of merit by five causes.🔽The cause of delight is that by which one is not disconsolate even when living in a disagreeable country.🔽

original: dal bar skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni /🔽gang gis na skyes bu dam pa la brten pa 'thob pa yin no //🔽nad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rgyu nyid ni /🔽gang gis na bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam 'grub pa yin no //🔽nyon mongs pa kho nas nyon mongs pa las nges bar 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /🔽chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs pa //🔽gang phyir chos med de yi phyir //
analyzed: dal bar skye ba'i rgyu nyid ni /🔽gang gis na skyes bu dam pa la brten pa 'thob pa yin no //🔽nad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rgyu nyid ni /🔽gang gis na bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam 'grub pa yin no //🔽nyon mongs pa kho nas nyon mongs pa las nges bar 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /🔽chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs pa //🔽gang phyir chos med de yi phyir //

original: sangs rgyas rnams @188a * //🔽kyis de dag las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams @188a * // kyis de dag las //
translated: The Buddhas have declared🔽that the renunciation of attachment and so on

original: nges 'byung chags sogs yin par dgongs //
analyzed: nges 'byung chags sogs yin par dgongs //
translated: is the reality of attachment and so on.🔽The Bhagavån has declared:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags las ma gtogs par 'dod chags las nges par 'byung bar nga mi smra ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags las ma gtogs par 'dod chags las nges par 'byung bar nga mi smra ste /
translated: I do not teach that there is any renunciation of attachment other than attachment,🔽and the same is true of hatred and delusion.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes gang gsungs pa de'i dgongs pa ston te /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes gang gsungs pa de'i dgongs pa ston te /
translated: This shows the intention of that statement.

original: gang gi phyir chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pas chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ming 'thob la ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pas chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ming 'thob la ;
translated: Because there is no phenomenon other than reality, and there is no phenomenon other than the reality of the realm of phenomena, therefore the reality of attachment and so on is also called attachment and so on.

original: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pas de la dgongs pa ni de yin par rig par bya'o //🔽chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pas de la dgongs pa ni de yin par rig par bya'o // chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
translated: And since that is the renunciation of attachment and so on, that is the intention.🔽Because there is no phenomenon

original: gang phyir chos med de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir chos med de yi phyir //
translated: other than the reality of the realm of phenomena,

original: kun nas nyon mongs bstan pa la //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs bstan pa la //
translated: the teaching of the afflictions

original: blo ldan dgongs pa de yin 'dod //
analyzed: blo ldan dgongs pa de yin 'dod //
translated: The wise should understand that this is the intended meaning.

original: ma rig pa dang / byang chub ni gcig go zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa der yang dgongs pa ni de kho na yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / byang chub ni gcig go zhes kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa der yang dgongs pa ni de kho na yin te /
translated: In the teaching of the universal defilement of the identity of ignorance and enlightenment, that is also the intended meaning.

original: ma rig pa dang byang chub kyi chos nyid la de dag nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang phyir chags sogs de nyid la //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang byang chub kyi chos nyid la de dag nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro // gang phyir chags sogs de nyid la //
translated: Because the reality of ignorance and enlightenment is designated as such.🔽Because of the proper engagement with just those

original: tshul bzhin 'jug pa de yi phyir //🔽de las rnam grol 'gyur des na //
analyzed: tshul bzhin 'jug pa de yi phyir // de las rnam grol 'gyur des na //
translated: craving, etc.,🔽there is liberation from just those.

original: de yis de dag las nges 'byung //
analyzed: de yis de dag las nges 'byung //
translated: Therefore, there is definite liberation from just those.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag kho na la tshul bzhin du 'jug na de dag las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag kho na la tshul bzhin du 'jug na de dag las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one properly engages with just those craving, etc., one is liberated from just those.

original: de lta bas na de dag yongs su shes pa nyid de dag gi nges par 'byung ba yin pas 'di la dgongs pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag yongs su shes pa nyid de dag gi nges par 'byung ba yin pas 'di la dgongs pa ni de yin no //
translated: Therefore, the very thorough knowledge of those is the definite liberation from those. This is the intended meaning.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa yongs su spang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa yongs su spang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the elimination of the attentions of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: sems can ched du dmyal ba'i srid par gnas pa yis //
analyzed: sems can ched du dmyal ba'i srid par gnas pa yis //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they remain in the hells.

original: sdug bsngal mi bzad cis kyang rgyal sras gnod byed min //🔽ji srid yon tan skyon gyis theg pa dman zhugs pa'i //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi bzad cis kyang rgyal sras gnod byed min // ji srid yon tan skyon gyis theg pa dman zhugs pa'i //
translated: The Bodhisattva is not harmed by anything, even by the most terrible sufferings, when he remains in the hells for the sake of living beings.

original: rnam rtog dge ba sna tshogs blo ldan gnod byed yin //🔽blo dang ldan pa dmyal bar gnas pa dus kun tu //
analyzed: rnam rtog dge ba sna tshogs blo ldan gnod byed yin // blo dang ldan pa dmyal bar gnas pa dus kun tu //
translated: The wise man is harmed by the various thoughts of virtue, which are the cause of his entering the Lesser Vehicle, because of the faults of his thoughts.

original: byang chub dri med yangs pa'i bar du gcod byed min //🔽theg pa gzhan la rab bsil rnam rtog bdag phan pa /
analyzed: byang chub dri med yangs pa'i bar du gcod byed min // theg pa gzhan la rab bsil rnam rtog bdag phan pa /
translated: The wise man is not harmed at any time, even when he is in the hells, by the obstacles to the vast, immaculate enlightenment.

original: rab @188b tu bde bar gnas kyang bar du gcod par byed //
analyzed: rab @188b tu bde bar gnas kyang bar du gcod par byed //
translated: The thoughts of the other vehicle, which are cool because of their lack of benefit for others, are an obstacle even when they are very comfortable.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis la gcig gis sgrub par byed pa ni gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis la gcig gis sgrub par byed pa ni gnyis pa yin te /
translated: In these two verses, the first verse is the proof of the second.

original: gnyi ga'i don go bar zad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of both is self evident.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la skrag pa dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la skrag pa dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste ;
translated: Four verses to prevent fear of realitylessness and natural purity

original: chos med pa dang dmigs pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs med rnam dag / sgyu ma la sogs 'dra ba dang // de bzhin nam mkha' 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: chos med pa dang dmigs pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs med rnam dag / sgyu ma la sogs 'dra ba dang // de bzhin nam mkha' 'drar shes bya //
translated: And also to be like space.

original: ji ltar tshul bzhin bris pa'i ri mo la //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul bzhin bris pa'i ri mo la //
translated: Just as in a painting

original: mthon dman med kyang snang ba de bzhin du //🔽yang dag ma yin rtog la rnam kun tu //
analyzed: mthon dman med kyang snang ba de bzhin du // yang dag ma yin rtog la rnam kun tu //
translated: There are no high and low, yet they appear to be,🔽So, in every respect,

original: gnyis po rtag tu med kyang snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis po rtag tu med kyang snang bar 'gyur //
translated: The two are always absent in the imagination of what is unreal, yet they appear.

original: ji ltar chu rnyog pa las dangs pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar chu rnyog pa las dangs pa na //
translated: Just as when water is cleared of silt,

original: dangs pa nyid de de las skye min gyi //
analyzed: dangs pa nyid de de las skye min gyi //
translated: The clarity is not produced from it,

original: de ni de la dri ma bral bar zad //
analyzed: de ni de la dri ma bral bar zad //
translated: But it is simply that the water has become free of stains,

original: de bzhin rang sems dag la tshul de nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin rang sems dag la tshul de nyid //
translated: So it is with the mind.

original: sems ni rtag tu rang bzhin 'od gsal 'dod ;
analyzed: sems ni rtag tu rang bzhin 'od gsal 'dod ;
translated: The mind is always held to be naturally luminous,

original: / de ni glo bur nyes pas ma rung byas //
analyzed: / de ni glo bur nyes pas ma rung byas //
translated: But it is ruined by adventitious faults.

original: chos nyid sems las gzhan pa sems gzhan ni //
analyzed: chos nyid sems las gzhan pa sems gzhan ni //
translated: A mind that is different from the mind of reality

original: 'od gsal ma yin rang bzhin la brjod do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ma yin rang bzhin la brjod do //
translated: Is not luminous, for it is said to be the nature.

original: chos med pa yang yin la chos dmigs kyang dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos med pa yang yin la chos dmigs kyang dmigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said that phenomena do not exist, yet they are also observed.

original: byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas yin la /
translated: The childish are frightened by the idea that

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
translated: the realm of reality is essentially uncontaminated,

original: phyis rnam par dag go zhes bya ba yang skrag pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: phyis rnam par dag go zhes bya ba yang skrag pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: and that later it is purified.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rab tu bsgrubs pas des mi skrag pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rab tu bsgrubs pas des mi skrag pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: These are established as being like a magical creation, etc., and like space, respectively, and so one is not frightened by them.

original: de bzhin du ri mo'i mthon dman dang 'dra ba dang / chu rnyog pa las dangs pa dang 'dra bar yang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ri mo'i mthon dman dang 'dra ba dang / chu rnyog pa las dangs pa dang 'dra bar yang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, they are like the high and low points of a painted canvas, and like water that is cleared of turbidity, respectively.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni /
translated: The third verse

original: sems chu dang 'dra bar bsgrub ste /
analyzed: sems chu dang 'dra bar bsgrub ste /
translated: establishes the mind as being like water.

original: ji ltar chu rang bzhin gyis dangs pa las glo bur gyi rnyog pas rnyogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar chu rang bzhin gyis dangs pa las glo bur gyi rnyog pas rnyogs pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as water is naturally clear, but is temporarily turbid due to a foreign cause,

original: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar 'dod pa las glo bur gyi nyes pas ma rung bar byas so //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar 'dod pa las glo bur gyi nyes pas ma rung bar byas so //
translated: so the mind is held to be naturally radiant, but is made unfit by a foreign fault.

original: chos nyid kyi sems las ma gtogs pa sems gzhan te /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid @189a * //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sems las ma gtogs pa sems gzhan te / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid @189a * //
translated: There is no other mind apart from the mind of reality.

original: ni ; / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du mi brjod do //
analyzed: ni ; / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du mi brjod do //
translated: The dependent nature is not described as naturally luminous.

original: de lta bas na sems ni 'dir chos nyid kyi sems kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems ni 'dir chos nyid kyi sems kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind here should be understood as the mind of reality.

original: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i ltung ba dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i ltung ba dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste /
translated: Four verses to prevent downfalls arising from attachment.🔽The bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la //
translated: should have love for sentient beings

original: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin //
analyzed: bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin //
translated: as a father has for his son,

original: rkang gi khong nas byams pa che //
analyzed: rkang gi khong nas byams pa che //
translated: with a love that comes from the marrow of the bones.

original: de ltas rtag phan byed par 'dod //🔽sems can rnams la phan byed phyir //
analyzed: de ltas rtag phan byed par 'dod // sems can rnams la phan byed phyir //
translated: Thus, he always wishes to help them.

original: de la chags skyes ltung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la chags skyes ltung mi 'gyur //
translated: He is not defiled by attachment to them.

original: 'di yi zhe sdang rnam kun du //
analyzed: 'di yi zhe sdang rnam kun du //
translated: His hatred is always

original: sems can kun dang 'gal bar 'gyur ;
analyzed: sems can kun dang 'gal bar 'gyur ;
translated: opposed to all sentient beings.

original: / ji ltar phug ron rang gi bu mchog byams //
analyzed: / ji ltar phug ron rang gi bu mchog byams //
translated: Just as a pigeon loves her own eggs🔽and sits on them with love,

original: rang gi bu de nye bar 'khyud nas 'dug / de 'dra ba la khong khro 'gal ba ltar //
analyzed: rang gi bu de nye bar 'khyud nas 'dug / de 'dra ba la khong khro 'gal ba ltar //
translated: hatred is opposed to that.

original: brtser bcas lus can bu la'ang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: brtser bcas lus can bu la'ang de dang 'dra //
translated: And the same for the Bodhisattva’s love for his children.

original: gang phyir byams pa de phyir khong khro 'gal //
analyzed: gang phyir byams pa de phyir khong khro 'gal //
translated: Because of love, hatred is excluded;

original: gang phyir zhi ba de phyir gnod sems 'gal ;
analyzed: gang phyir zhi ba de phyir gnod sems 'gal ;
translated: because of peace, ill will is excluded;

original: / gang phyir don byed de phyir sgyu sems 'gal //
analyzed: / gang phyir don byed de phyir sgyu sems 'gal //
translated: because of service, deceit is excluded;

original: gang phyir sim byed de phyir 'jigs byed 'gal //
analyzed: gang phyir sim byed de phyir 'jigs byed 'gal //
translated: because of comfort, intimidation is excluded.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags su dgongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags su dgongs te /
translated: The love of the Bodhisattva for sentient beings is considered to be a kind of passion,

original: sems can la phan par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can la phan par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de dag la des byas pa'i ltung ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag la des byas pa'i ltung ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: He stops the downfall that is created by that.

original: phug ron dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phug ron dper brjod pa ni /
translated: The pigeon is given as an example,

original: de 'dod chags mang ba'i phyir bu la byams pa yang shin tu che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dod chags mang ba'i phyir bu la byams pa yang shin tu che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of his great love for his young, due to his great passion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang bcas pa ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva, who is full of love,

original: sems can rnams la khong khro ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la khong khro ba 'gal lo //
translated: has hatred for sentient beings excluded.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang gi phyir byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams la byams pa dang / gnod pa zhi ba dang / don sgrub pa dang / dga' ba skyed pas sim par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir yang khong khro ba yang 'gal la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang gi phyir byams pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas sems can rnams la byams pa dang / gnod pa zhi ba dang / don sgrub pa dang / dga' ba skyed pas sim par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir yang khong khro ba yang 'gal la /
translated: Because bodhisattvas, through their love and so on, love sentient beings, pacify their harms, accomplish their aims, and gladden them, they are also incompatible with anger.

original: de'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gnod pa'i sems la sogs pa yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gnod pa'i sems la sogs pa yang 'gal lo //
translated: And anger is incompatible with the attitudes of harm, and so on, that precede it.

original: sgrub pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: Five verses on the analysis of practice:

original: sman bzang po la nad pa bzhin //
analyzed: sman bzang po la nad pa bzhin //
translated: Like a sick man with good medicine,

original: 'khor ba la ni 'jug par byed //
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni 'jug par byed //
translated: they enter samsara.

original: nad pa la ni sman pa bzhin //
analyzed: nad pa la ni sman pa bzhin //
translated: Like a doctor with a sick person,

original: sems can rnams la sgrub par byed //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sgrub par byed //
translated: they practice for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bran ma grub pa ji @189b bzhin du //
analyzed: bran ma grub pa ji @189b bzhin du //
translated: Like an unaccomplished servant,

original: bdag nyid la ni sgrub par byed //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni sgrub par byed //
translated: they practice with regard to themselves.

original: zong la tshong pa ji bzhin du //
analyzed: zong la tshong pa ji bzhin du //
translated: Like a merchant with his merchandise,

original: 'dod pa dag la sgrub par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la sgrub par byed //
translated: they practice with regard to their desires.

original: gos la btso blag mkhan bzhin du //
analyzed: gos la btso blag mkhan bzhin du //
translated: Like a dyer with his cloth,

original: las la rab tu sgrub par byed //
analyzed: las la rab tu sgrub par byed //
translated: they practice with regard to their actions.

original: bu gzhon pa la pha bzhin du //
analyzed: bu gzhon pa la pha bzhin du //
translated: Like a father to his young son,

original: sems can mi 'tshe sgrub par byed //
analyzed: sems can mi 'tshe sgrub par byed //
translated: he accomplishes the avoidance of harm to sentient beings.

original: me don gnyer ba gtsub shing ltar //
analyzed: me don gnyer ba gtsub shing ltar //
translated: Like one seeking fire by rubbing wood,

original: rtag par rab tu sgrub par byed //🔽yid brtan bzhin du lhag pa'i sems //
analyzed: rtag par rab tu sgrub par byed // yid brtan bzhin du lhag pa'i sems //
translated: he always accomplishes the increase of virtue.

original: ma rdzogs pa la sgrub par byed //🔽sgyu ma mkhan ltar shes bya la //
analyzed: ma rdzogs pa la sgrub par byed // sgyu ma mkhan ltar shes bya la //
translated: Like a good friend, he accomplishes the development of the superior mind.

original: shes rab kyis ni sgrub par byed //🔽de ni byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni sgrub par byed // de ni byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: Like a magician, he accomplishes the knowledge of the knowable by means of wisdom.🔽This is the way and the place

original: ji ltar gang du sgrub par 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar gang du sgrub par 'dod //
translated: where the bodhisattva wishes to accomplish.

original: ji ltar gang dang gang du sgrub pa de ston par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar gang dang gang du sgrub pa de ston par byed de /
translated: He shows the way and the place where he wishes to accomplish.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni sman bzang po la sogs pa la nad pa la sogs pa ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni sman bzang po la sogs pa la nad pa la sogs pa ltar ro //
translated: The way is like a sick person, etc.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs par te /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs par te /
translated: The place is in cyclic existence, etc.

original: so sor brtags nas 'khor ba brten pa'i phyir dang / snying rjes sems can nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis thebs pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems legs par 'chos pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pas go rims bzhin du longs spyod 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: so sor brtags nas 'khor ba brten pa'i phyir dang / snying rjes sems can nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis thebs pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir dang / rang gi sems legs par 'chos pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pas go rims bzhin du longs spyod 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because he relies on samsara after careful consideration, because he does not abandon afflicted beings out of compassion, because he thoroughly disciplines his own mind, and because he increases his wealth by means of the transcendence of generosity and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir dang / sems can gnod par byed pa dag gis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos sgom pa la bar chad med par brtson pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir dang / sems can gnod par byed pa dag gis mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos sgom pa la bar chad med par brtson pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because he purifies the actions of body and so on, because he is not disturbed by beings who do harm, because he strives without interruption to cultivate virtuous natures, because he does not relish the taste of concentration,

original: shes bya la phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya la phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he is unmistaken about the knowable.

original: sgrub pa'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the perfection of accomplishment

original: de ltar rtag tu brtson 'grus rgya chen ldan //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu brtson 'grus rgya chen ldan //
translated: Thus, always endowed with vast effort,

original: gnyis yongs smin par bya la rab brtson de //
analyzed: gnyis yongs smin par bya la rab brtson de //
translated: He strives to bring about the full maturation of both himself and others.

original: rim gyis dri med mi rtog blo mchog gis //
analyzed: rim gyis dri med mi rtog blo mchog gis //
translated: In stages, through the highest, stainless, nonconceptual intuition,

original: sgrub pa bla na med par rab tu 'gro //
analyzed: sgrub pa bla na med par rab tu 'gro //
translated: he attains the unsurpassed accomplishment.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas sgrub pa po dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas sgrub pa po dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa la mi rtog pa'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the bodhisattva should be understood as the purification of the three sectors, because of the nonconceptuality of the intuition of the objective selflessness with regard to the one who accomplishes, that which is accomplished, and the accomplishment itself.

original: gnyis yongs smin par bya la rab brtson de //
analyzed: gnyis yongs smin par bya la rab brtson de //
translated: He strives to bring about the full maturation of both himself and others.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang bdag nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang bdag nyid do //
translated: This refers to sentient beings and himself.

original: sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on accomplishment is completed.

original: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
analyzed: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
translated: and is engaged in the precepts,

original: ji ltar chu yis rgya mtsho bzhin //🔽dge chos rnams kyis yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: ji ltar chu yis rgya mtsho bzhin // dge chos rnams kyis yang dag rdzogs //

original: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
analyzed: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //

original: zhes bya ba ni chen po'i gnas skabs su phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chen po'i gnas skabs su phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has reached the stage of greatness.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: de bzhin du ni tshogs bsags pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni tshogs bsags pa'i //
translated: The bodhisattva who has thus accumulated the equipment,

original: rgyal sras gzod nas dag pa po //
analyzed: rgyal sras gzod nas dag pa po //
translated: pure from the beginning,

original: legs par shes shing sems dge ba //
analyzed: legs par shes shing sems dge ba //
translated: well knowing, with a virtuous mind,

original: sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: sgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: is well set in the cultivation.

original: gzod ma nas dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir dang / don phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'i sgo nas theg pa chen po la lta ba drang por byas pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Pure from the beginning means that he has purified the vow of the bodhisattva and has straightened out his views on the Great Vehicle by not misapprehending its meaning.

original: legs par shes pa ni thos pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par shes pa ni thos pa mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Well knowing means that he has much learning.

original: sems dge ba ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dge ba ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With a virtuous mind means that he is free from the obstructions.

original: de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni //🔽sangs rgyas rnams las zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni // sangs rgyas rnams las zhi gnas dang // ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir //
translated: At that time, in the stream of the Dharma,🔽he obtains the extensive precepts from the Buddhas

original: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: in order to obtain the vast calming and insight.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this verse is selfevident.

original: de nas dang por sdom brtson de //
analyzed: de nas dang por sdom brtson de //
translated: Then, first, that one who is zealous for the vow🔽of morality,

original: mdo yi sde la sogs pa'i chos ;
analyzed: mdo yi sde la sogs pa'i chos ;
translated: in the Dharma of the Sutras, etc.,

original: / mi gnyis don ni rnam 'byed pa //
analyzed: / mi gnyis don ni rnam 'byed pa //
translated: discriminates the meaning of non-duality,

original: mdo sogs ming la sems 'jog go //
analyzed: mdo sogs ming la sems 'jog go //
translated: and fixes his mind on the name of the Sutras, etc.

original: de nas de ni rim bzhin du //
analyzed: de nas de ni rim bzhin du //
translated: Then, in order,

original: tshig rab dbye la dpyod byed cing //
analyzed: tshig rab dbye la dpyod byed cing //
translated: he analyzes the divisions of the words,

original: so so'i nang na tshul bzhin du //🔽de yi don yang rnam par dpyod //
analyzed: so so'i nang na tshul bzhin du // de yi don yang rnam par dpyod //
translated: and in each one,🔽he analyzes the meaning.

original: don de dag ni nges gzung nas //
analyzed: don de dag ni nges gzung nas //
translated: Having ascertained those meanings,

original: chos la kun nas sdom par byed //🔽de yi don ni thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: chos la kun nas sdom par byed // de yi don ni thob bya'i phyir //
translated: he comprehends the Dharma.🔽Then, in order to attain that meaning,

original: de nas de ni smon par byed //
analyzed: de nas de ni smon par byed //
translated: he aspires to it.

original: dang por mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la mdo la sogs pa'i ming sa bcu pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu gang yin pa de la sems 'jog par byed do //
