translated: First, he fixes his mind on the name of the Dharma, such as the Sutra of the Ten Stages, in the Dharma of the Sutras, the Songs, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'dis ni sems drug bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'dis ni sems drug bstan te /
translated: By these three verses, six minds are taught.

original: rtsa ba'i sems dang / rjes su dpyod pa'i sems dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang / nges par 'dzin pa'i sems dang / sdom pa'i sems dang / smon pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sems dang / rjes su dpyod pa'i sems dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i sems dang / nges par 'dzin pa'i sems dang / sdom pa'i sems dang / smon pa'i sems so //
translated: the basic thought, the thought of subsequent analysis, the thought of thorough analysis, the thought of ascertainment, the thought of restraint, and the thought of aspiration.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni mdo'i sde la sogs @190b pa'i chos rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //🔽rjes su dpyod pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni mdo'i sde la sogs @190b pa'i chos rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o // rjes su dpyod pa'i sems ni /
translated: The basic thought is that which takes as its object the names of the teachings such as the scriptures.

original: gang gis mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i ming gi sgo nas dmigs pa rnams kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i ming gi sgo nas dmigs pa rnams kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The thought of subsequent analysis is that which follows the analysis of the meanings that are referred to by the names of the scriptures, etc.🔽The thought of thorough analysis is that which analyzes the meanings and the words.🔽The thought of ascertainment is that which ascertains the meanings and the words that have been analyzed.

original: rnam par dpyod pa'i sems ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa'i sems ni /
translated: The thought of restraint is that which restrains the mind from distraction.

original: gang gis don dang yi ge dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis don dang yi ge dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The thought of aspiration is that which aspires to the realization of the meaning that has been ascertained.

original: de la don ni rnam pa bzhis dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de la don ni rnam pa bzhis dpyod par byed de /
translated: The meaning is analyzed in four ways:

original: bgrang ba dang / 'jal ba dang / rtog pa dang / so sor rtog pas so //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / 'jal ba dang / rtog pa dang / so sor rtog pas so //
translated: by counting, by measuring, by investigating, and by discerning.

original: de la bgrang ba ni grangs 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la bgrang ba ni grangs 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Counting is the apprehension of number.

original: dper na gzugs ni skye mched bcu dang / gcig gi phyogs so //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni skye mched bcu dang / gcig gi phyogs so //
translated: For example, form is either ten bases or one part of a base.

original: tshor ba ni tshor ba drug gi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshor ba ni tshor ba drug gi tshogs so //
translated: Feeling is the group of the six collections of feeling.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Such is the explanation.

original: 'jal ba ni grangs dang ldan pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa med par 'tsham par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jal ba ni grangs dang ldan pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa med par 'tsham par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Apprehending is the grasping of the characteristics of the phenomena endowed with number, without exaggeration or deprecation.

original: rtog pa ni tshad mas rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni tshad mas rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualizing is the conceptualizing of the valid cognition.

original: so sor rtog pa ni bgrang ba dang / gzhal ba dang ; brtags pa'i don la lta ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni bgrang ba dang / gzhal ba dang ; brtags pa'i don la lta ba'o //
translated: Discerning is the view of the object which is counted, measured, and examined.

original: yi ge rnam pa gnyis kyis spyod par byed de /
analyzed: yi ge rnam pa gnyis kyis spyod par byed de /
translated: One practices with two kinds of letters:

original: yi ge tshogs pa rnams don dang bcas pa nyid dang / sil bu rnams don med pa nyid kyis so //🔽nges par 'dzin pa'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rjes su dpyad pa'am /
analyzed: yi ge tshogs pa rnams don dang bcas pa nyid dang / sil bu rnams don med pa nyid kyis so // nges par 'dzin pa'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rjes su dpyad pa'am /
translated: the collection of letters with meaning and the collection of letters without meaning.

original: rnam par dpyad pa de'i rgyu mtshan nges par 'dzin pa'o //🔽sdom pa'i sems ni ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa'i don rtsa ba'i sems la bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa de'i rgyu mtshan nges par 'dzin pa'o // sdom pa'i sems ni ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa'i don rtsa ba'i sems la bsdus te /
translated: The mind of ascertainment is that by which one ascertains the reason of what has been examined or analyzed.

original: kun nas sdom pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas sdom pa'i rnam par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind of restraint is the arising of the mind of restraint by collecting the meaning of the analysis into the fundamental mind.

original: smon pa'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don tam /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin gyi don tam /
translated: The aspirational mind is the object of concentration.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don tam /
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don tam /
translated: Or it is the object of perfecting that.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'i don tam /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'i don tam /
translated: Or it is the object of the result of the spiritual life.

original: sa la 'jug pa'i don tam /
analyzed: sa la 'jug pa'i don tam /
translated: Or it is the object of entering the stages.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i don kyang rung /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i don kyang rung /
translated: Or it is the object of special progress.

original: gang gi don du rab tu brtson pa de la 'dun pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du rab tu brtson pa de la 'dun pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the aspiration that arises together with the desire for the object for which one strives.

original: 'di sems kho na dmigs par snang ba 'byung gi / sems las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes kyang rung /
analyzed: 'di sems kho na dmigs par snang ba 'byung gi / sems las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes kyang rung /
translated: It is also acceptable to know that the mind alone appears as the object, and that there is no object apart from the mind.

original: ma shes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ma shes kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one knows that or not,

original: dmigs pa ni sems yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems yin te /
translated: the object is the mind.

original: gzhan ma yin pas sems rnam pa drug po dmigs par rnam par gzhag go //🔽yid kyi brjod pas rgyun chags su //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pas sems rnam pa drug po dmigs par rnam par gzhag go // yid kyi brjod pas rgyun chags su //
translated: Since it is not something else, the mind is established as the object in six aspects.

original: btsal bya so sor brtag par bya //🔽yid @191a * //
analyzed: btsal bya so sor brtag par bya // yid @191a * //
translated: One should seek and examine

original: la byed pa brjod med pa /
analyzed: la byed pa brjod med pa /
translated: with mental expression in a continuous process.🔽One should examine with mental attention

original: ro gcig pas kyang dpyad par bya //
analyzed: ro gcig pas kyang dpyad par bya //
translated: that is inexpressible and of one taste.

original: chos kyi ming ni bsdoms pa'ang 'di //
analyzed: chos kyi ming ni bsdoms pa'ang 'di //
translated: This is the summary of the names of the teachings.

original: zhig nas lam du shes par bya //
analyzed: zhig nas lam du shes par bya //
translated: One should know that the path is to recognize them as such.🔽The path of insight is to analyze

original: lhag mthong lam ni de don rnams //🔽rnam par dpyod par shes par bya //🔽zung du 'brel ba'i lam ni de //
analyzed: lhag mthong lam ni de don rnams // rnam par dpyod par shes par bya // zung du 'brel ba'i lam ni de //
translated: those very objects.🔽The path of union is to know

original: bsdoms pa yin par rnam shes bya //🔽zhum pa'i sems ni rab gzung ste //
analyzed: bsdoms pa yin par rnam shes bya // zhum pa'i sems ni rab gzung ste //
translated: that they are combined.🔽When the mind is slack, one should

original: rgod pa yang ni zhi bar bya //
analyzed: rgod pa yang ni zhi bar bya //
translated: stimulate it; when excited, one should calm it.

original: de nas dmigs pa de la ni //
analyzed: de nas dmigs pa de la ni //
translated: Then, when the mind is settled🔽on the object, one should rest in equanimity.

original: mnyam par gyur na btang snyoms gzhag / de la rtag tu bya ba dang // gus par byas te sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: mnyam par gyur na btang snyoms gzhag / de la rtag tu bya ba dang // gus par byas te sbyar bar bya //
translated: One should always practice these mental orientations with devotion.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'dis ni yid la byed pa bcu gcig bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'dis ni yid la byed pa bcu gcig bstan te /
translated: These four verses present the eleven mental orientations:

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dang / zhi gnas yid la byed pa dang / lhag mthong yid la byed pa dang / zung du 'brel pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dang / zhi gnas yid la byed pa dang / lhag mthong yid la byed pa dang / zung du 'brel pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: the mental orientation with both ideation and scrutiny, the mental orientation with no ideation but with scrutiny, the mental orientation with neither ideation nor scrutiny, the mental orientation of serenity, the mental orientation of insight, the mental orientation of union, the mental orientation of equanimity, the mental orientation of the absence of false discrimination, the mental orientation of the absence of effort, the mental orientation of the absence of any basis, and the mental orientation of the absence of any aim.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / rtag tu sbyor ba yid la byed pa dang / gus par bya ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan yid la byed pa dang / rtag tu sbyor ba yid la byed pa dang / gus par bya ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The conscientious attitude of the reason of retention, the conscientious attitude of the reason of calm abiding, the conscientious attitude of the reason of equanimity, the conscientious attitude of constant application, and the conscientious attitude of respect.

original: dmigs pa la ni sems gtad nas //
analyzed: dmigs pa la ni sems gtad nas //
translated: Having fixed the mind on the objective field,

original: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya ;
analyzed: de rgyun rnam par g-yeng mi bya ;
translated: one should not scatter it about.

original: rnam g-yeng myur du rtogs byas nas //
analyzed: rnam g-yeng myur du rtogs byas nas //
translated: Having quickly recognized the distraction,

original: de la slar ni glan par bya //🔽blo ldan gong nas gong du yang //
analyzed: de la slar ni glan par bya // blo ldan gong nas gong du yang //
translated: one should return to the object.🔽The wise one should gather the mind within,

original: sems ni nang du bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: sems ni nang du bsdu bar bya //
translated: more and more.

original: de nas yon tan mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nas yon tan mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Then, because of seeing the virtues,

original: ting nge 'dzin la sems gdul lo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sems gdul lo //
translated: one should subdue the mind in concentration.

original: rnam g-yeng nyes pa mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam g-yeng nyes pa mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of seeing the faults of distraction,

original: de la mi dga' zhi bar bya //
analyzed: de la mi dga' zhi bar bya //
translated: one should pacify the dislike for that.

original: brnab sems yid mi bde ba sogs //
analyzed: brnab sems yid mi bde ba sogs //
translated: Like the arising of covetousness, sorrow, etc.,

original: langs pa de bzhin zhi bar bya //
analyzed: langs pa de bzhin zhi bar bya //
translated: so should one pacify them.

original: de nas sdom brtson can gyis ni //
analyzed: de nas sdom brtson can gyis ni //
translated: Then, the one who is diligent

original: sems la mngon par 'du byed bcas //
analyzed: sems la mngon par 'du byed bcas //
translated: should apply himself to the mind.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba 'thob //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba 'thob //
translated: One attains the effortless state

original: de goms pa las 'du mi byed //
analyzed: de goms pa las 'du mi byed //
translated: through cultivation of that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'dis ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus gnas pa'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi po 'dis ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus gnas pa'i thabs bstan te /
translated: These four verses show the means of mental stability through the nine aspects of mental stability.

original: rnam pa dgu ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ni /
translated: The nine aspects are

original: sems 'jog par byed /🔽kun tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: sems 'jog par byed / kun tu 'jog par byed /
translated: placing the mind,🔽fully placing it,

original: nges par 'jog par byed /🔽nye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: nges par 'jog par byed / nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: definitely placing it,🔽closely placing it,

original: 'dul bar byed /🔽zhi bar byed /
analyzed: 'dul bar byed / zhi bar byed /
translated: taming it,🔽pacifying it,

original: nye bar zhi bar byed /🔽rgyud gcig tu byed /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar byed / rgyud gcig tu byed /
translated: thoroughly pacifying it,🔽unifying it,

original: mnyam @191b par 'jog par byed ces bya ba yin no //🔽de nas de yi lus dang sems //
analyzed: mnyam @191b par 'jog par byed ces bya ba yin no // de nas de yi lus dang sems //
translated: and focusing it.🔽Then, having attained

original: shin tu sbyangs pa che thob nas //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa che thob nas //
translated: great pliancy of body and mind,

original: yid la byed dang bcas shes bya //
analyzed: yid la byed dang bcas shes bya //
translated: one is said to have attention.

original: de yis de ni 'phel byas nas //
analyzed: de yis de ni 'phel byas nas //
translated: Through increasing that,

original: 'phel ba ring du 'gro ba yis //🔽dngos gzhi'i gnas pa des 'thob po //
analyzed: 'phel ba ring du 'gro ba yis // dngos gzhi'i gnas pa des 'thob po //
translated: through the increase that goes far,

original: mngon shes don du gnyer bas te //
analyzed: mngon shes don du gnyer bas te //
translated: one attains the actual basis of meditative concentration.🔽One who seeks higher perception

original: sbyangs na las su rung ba'i mchog / bsam gtan las 'thob mngon par shes //
analyzed: sbyangs na las su rung ba'i mchog / bsam gtan las 'thob mngon par shes //
translated: attains the highest flexibility through training.

original: mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgo nas de //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgo nas de //
translated: By means of the realization of the aids to liberation,

original: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la //
translated: he goes to the various worldrealms

original: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyan pa'i phyir //🔽'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro //
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyan pa'i phyir // 'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro //
translated: in order to worship and to hear

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la //
translated: the immeasurable buddhas.🔽By means of the realization of the aids to penetration,

original: bskal dpag med par bsnyen bkur byas //
analyzed: bskal dpag med par bsnyen bkur byas //
translated: he serves the immeasurable buddhas for immeasurable eons.

original: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir //
translated: By means of the realization of the aids to penetration,

original: sems ni las rung mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni las rung mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: his mind becomes most serviceable.

original: bsam gtan las su rung ba mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan las su rung ba mchog tu 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The most serviceable in meditative concentration is to be supplied.

original: bskal pa dpag tu med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni grangs med dpag tu med par gyur par ro //
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni grangs med dpag tu med par gyur par ro //
translated: Immeasurable eons means incalculable and immeasurable.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyi lhag ma'i don go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyi lhag ma'i don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the rest of these verses is selfevident.

original: de nas de dag sngon rol du //
analyzed: de nas de dag sngon rol du //
translated: Then, prior to that,

original: phan yon lnga ni 'thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: phan yon lnga ni 'thob 'gyur te //
translated: he obtains five benefits,

original: des na rnam par dag pa'i snod //
analyzed: des na rnam par dag pa'i snod //
translated: and thus becomes a vessel for purification.

original: bla na med pa nyid 'gyur 'di'i //🔽lus las gnas ngan len pa kun //
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid 'gyur 'di'i // lus las gnas ngan len pa kun //
translated: This is his unsurpassability.🔽All the negative tendencies

original: skad cig re re la zad 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig re re la zad 'gyur //
translated: of his body are eliminated moment by moment.

original: lus dang sems ni kun tu yang //
analyzed: lus dang sems ni kun tu yang //
translated: And the body and mind are completely🔽

original: shin tu sbyangs pas gang bar 'gyur //🔽chos rnams snang ba thams cad du //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas gang bar 'gyur // chos rnams snang ba thams cad du //
translated: And the body and mind become filled with pliancy.

original: yongs su chad pa med rtogs 'gyur //🔽yang dag pa yi rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: yongs su chad pa med rtogs 'gyur // yang dag pa yi rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: And one realizes the non-division of all the appearances of things.

original: ma brtags pa dag rab tu mthong ;
analyzed: ma brtags pa dag rab tu mthong ;
translated: One sees the signs of reality without conceptualizing them.

original: / de bzhin chos sku rab rdzogs dang // rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir //🔽blo dang ldan pas rnam kun du //
analyzed: / de bzhin chos sku rab rdzogs dang // rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir // blo dang ldan pas rnam kun du //
translated: And in order to perfect and purify the Dharma Body,🔽the wise always and in every way

original: rtag tu rgyu yongs 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyu yongs 'dzin par byed //
translated: uphold the cause.

original: de nas dag pa'i sngon rol du phan yon lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas dag pa'i sngon rol du phan yon lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, prior to the purity, one obtains five benefits.

original: dag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa'o ;
analyzed: dag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa'o ;
translated: Purity is the stage of pure universal responsibility.

original: / de dag thob pas na rnam par dag pa'i snod nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: / de dag thob pas na rnam par dag pa'i snod nyid 'thob ste /
translated: By obtaining them, one becomes a vessel for purification.

original: bla na med pa ni theg pa bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni theg pa bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unsurpassed means that it is the unsurpassed vehicle.

original: de bzhin chos sku rab rdzogs dang // rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin chos sku rab rdzogs dang // rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: And in order to perfect and purify the Dharma Body,🔽the wise always and in every way🔽uphold the cause.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the verse.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o//
translated: On the tenth stage, it is complete.

original: @192a * // sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: @192a * // sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: On the stage of Buddha, it is pure.

original: phan yon lnga po 'di dag las /
analyzed: phan yon lnga po 'di dag las /
translated: Among these five benefits,

original: gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin la /
translated: three are on the side of serenity,

original: gnyis ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and two are on the side of transcendent insight.

original: 'di'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i lam yang dag dag par 'grub pa yin no //🔽de nas de 'drar gyur pa yi //
analyzed: 'di'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i lam yang dag dag par 'grub pa yin no // de nas de 'drar gyur pa yi //
translated: Up to this point, the mundane path has been accomplished.🔽Then, the bodhisattva,🔽in that state,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pas //🔽yid kyi brjod pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pas // yid kyi brjod pa ma gtogs par //
translated: with mind concentrated,

original: don kun rab tu mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: don kun rab tu mi mthong ngo //
translated: does not see any object apart from mental expression.

original: chos kyi snang ba 'phel bya'i phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba 'phel bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to increase the light of Dharma,

original: brtson 'grus brtan po kun tu rtsom //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan po kun tu rtsom //
translated: he exerts himself with firm effort.

original: chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas ni //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas ni //
translated: When the light of Dharma increases,

original: sems tsam la ni gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni gnas par 'gyur //
translated: he abides in mind only.

original: de nas don kun snang ba ni //
analyzed: de nas don kun snang ba ni //
translated: Then, all objects

original: sems su rab tu snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems su rab tu snang bar 'gyur //
translated: appear as mind only.

original: de tshe de yi gzung ba yi //
analyzed: de tshe de yi gzung ba yi //
translated: At that time, he does not perceive

original: rnam par g-yeng ba de spangs 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba de spangs 'gyur //
translated: One will be free from distraction.🔽

original: de nas de la 'dzin pa yi /
analyzed: de nas de la 'dzin pa yi /
translated: Then, having abandoned that distraction,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig lus //🔽de tshe bar chad med pa yi //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig lus // de tshe bar chad med pa yi //
translated: only the distraction of grasping🔽remains for him.🔽Then he quickly touches🔽the concentration that is without obstacles.

original: ting nge 'dzin la myur du reg / de'i 'og tu nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la myur du reg / de'i 'og tu nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
translated: After that, there are the states of the aids to penetration.

original: nam zhig byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu sems mnyam par gzhag pas yid kyi brjod pa las ma gtogs pa don thams cad ma mthong gi /'di'i yid kyi brjod pa kho na rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid du snang bar mthong ba na /
analyzed: nam zhig byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu sems mnyam par gzhag pas yid kyi brjod pa las ma gtogs pa don thams cad ma mthong gi /'di'i yid kyi brjod pa kho na rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid du snang bar mthong ba na /
translated: When a bodhisattva who is thus concentrated on the mind does not see any object except mental expressions, and when he sees only mental expressions appearing as their own characteristics and as their general characteristics,

original: de ni 'di'i dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di'i dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: then that is the state of heat for him.

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas chu bo tsha sgo can gyi mdo las /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas chu bo tsha sgo can gyi mdo las /
translated: With reference to that, it is said in the Sutra of the Hot, Pervading River:

original: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ni chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs pa ni snang ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ni chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs pa ni snang ba 'di yin no //
translated: “This appearance is a synonym for the acquiescence in the ascertainment of the Dharma.”

original: de chos kyi snang ba de nyid spel ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'i byed pas brtson 'grus brtan po rtsom par byed pa de ni 'di'i rtse mo'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de chos kyi snang ba de nyid spel ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'i byed pas brtson 'grus brtan po rtsom par byed pa de ni 'di'i rtse mo'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: In order to increase that light of Dharma, he exerts himself with firm effort, by means of a non-abiding activity. This is the stage of its peak.

original: de chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas sems tsam la gnas te /
analyzed: de chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas sems tsam la gnas te /
translated: Having increased the light of Dharma, he abides in mind-only,

original: 'di ni sems kho nar zad do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kho nar zad do zhes bya bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he realizes that it is only mind.

original: de nas don du snang ba thams cad ni sems kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: de nas don du snang ba thams cad ni sems kho nar zad kyi /
translated: Then, he sees that all appearances of objects are only mind,

original: don sems las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong ste /
analyzed: don sems las gzhan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mthong ste /
translated: and that objects are not other than mind.

original: de'i tshe ni 'di'i gzung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba spangs la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'di'i gzung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba spangs la /
translated: At that time, he abandons the distraction of the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig lus @192b so ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba 'ba' zhig lus @192b so ;
translated: Only the distraction of the apprehender remains.

original: / de ni 'di'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: / de ni 'di'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the stage of his acceptance.

original: de'i tshe bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang myur du reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang myur du reg par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, he quickly reaches the uninterrupted samadhi.

original: de ni 'di'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the stage of his supreme worldly dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir de 'di'i bar chad med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'di'i bar chad med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is this called his “absence of obstacles”?

original: 'di ltar de yi mjug thogs su //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yi mjug thogs su //
translated: Because immediately after that

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba spang //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba spang //
translated: he abandons the distraction of grasping.

original: 'di dag go rims bzhin du ni //
analyzed: 'di dag go rims bzhin du ni //
translated: These are, respectively,

original: dro bar gyur pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa yin zhes bya //
translated: the state of heat and so on.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa yin no //🔽de nas des ni 'jig rten las //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa yin no // de nas des ni 'jig rten las //
translated: Thus, these are the states of heat and so on that are conducive to penetration.🔽Then, by means of the unsurpassed

original: 'das pa'i ye shes bla med pas ;🔽/ rnam par mi rtog dri ma med //
analyzed: 'das pa'i ye shes bla med pas ; / rnam par mi rtog dri ma med //
translated: supramundane wisdom,🔽he attains the nondiscriminative, stainless,

original: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob //
translated: and twofold freedom.

original: de yan chad ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: de yan chad ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs yin te /
translated: From this point on is the stage of the path of vision.

original: bla na med pa ni ye shes bla na med pas so //🔽rnam par mi rtog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni ye shes bla na med pas so // rnam par mi rtog pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Unsurpassed means unsurpassed wisdom.🔽Nondiscriminative means free from the discriminations of subject and object.

original: dri ma med pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Stainless means free from the passions that are to be eliminated by the path of vision.

original: 'dis ni rdul dang bral ba dang / dri ma dang bral ba zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdul dang bral ba dang / dri ma dang bral ba zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the terms “free from dust” and “free from stains. ”

original: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Free from the two graspings, because it is free from the grasping of object and subject.

original: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur pa ste //
translated: That is its transformation of the basis.

original: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod //🔽'di'i de bskal pa dpag med kyis //
analyzed: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod // 'di'i de bskal pa dpag med kyis //
translated: It is considered the first stage.

original: shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur //
translated: It becomes completely pure🔽after countless eons.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this verse is self-evident.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni mnyam pa nyid //
translated: The equality of the Dharma realm

original: rab tu rtogs nas de yi tshe //🔽rtag tu sems can thams cad la //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs nas de yi tshe // rtag tu sems can thams cad la //
translated: is realized at that time.🔽Then the bodhisattva always

original: bdag dang mtshungs pa'i sems 'thob ste //
analyzed: bdag dang mtshungs pa'i sems 'thob ste //
translated: obtains the attitude of sameness toward all beings.🔽He has the same attitude toward beings

original: sems can rnams la bdag med dang // sdug bsngal dang ni don bya dang // lan mi re la 'di sems snyoms //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bdag med dang // sdug bsngal dang ni don bya dang // lan mi re la 'di sems snyoms //
translated: with regard to selflessness, suffering, benefit, and lack of expectation of reward.

original: rgyal sras gzhan dang 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: rgyal sras gzhan dang 'dra ba yin //
translated: He is like the other victorious ones’ sons.

original: chos la bdag med pas chos mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa lngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la bdag dang mtshungs pa'i sems nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pas chos mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas mtshungs pa nyid rnam pa lngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la bdag dang mtshungs pa'i sems nyid 'thob ste /
translated: Having realized the sameness of all things through the selflessness of things, one always attains the attitude of sameness toward all beings through the five kinds of sameness.

original: bdag med pa'i mtshungs pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshungs pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Through the sameness of selflessness and the sameness of suffering, one has no sense of difference between one’s own and others’ mind streams in regard to selflessness and suffering.

original: bya ba mtshungs pa nyid kyis @193a * //
analyzed: bya ba mtshungs pa nyid kyis @193a * //
translated: Through the sameness of action,

original: ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spang bar bya dgos par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni rang dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spang bar bya dgos par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one has the same need to eliminate one’s own and others’ suffering.

original: lan mi re ba mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid las bzhin du gzhan las lan mngon par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan mi re ba mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid las bzhin du gzhan las lan mngon par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Through the sameness of not expecting anything in return, one does not expect others to repay one’s kindness, just as one does not expect oneself to do so.

original: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni ;
translated: Through the sameness of being like other bodhisattvas,🔽one is the same as other bodhisattvas in having the same attitude.

original: ji ltar de dag gi mngon par rtogs pa de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gi mngon par rtogs pa de bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have realized the truth in the same way as the latter.

original: des ni khams gsum 'dus byas rnams //
analyzed: des ni khams gsum 'dus byas rnams //
translated: By that, the three realms are seen

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog par //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog par //
translated: as mere unreal imagination.

original: ye shes shin tu rnam dag pa //
analyzed: ye shes shin tu rnam dag pa //
translated: By the knowledge that is completely pure,

original: gnyis su med pa'i don gyis mthong //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don gyis mthong //
translated: they are seen as having the meaning of non-duality.

original: des ni khams gsum pa'i 'dus byas rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam du mthong ste /
analyzed: des ni khams gsum pa'i 'dus byas rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa tsam du mthong ste /
translated: By that, the conditioned things of the three realms are seen as mere unreal imagination.

original: ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge that is completely pure is supramundane.

original: gnyis su med pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i don gyis so //
translated: By the meaning of non-duality means by the meaning of no apprehended object and no apprehending subject.

original: de dag med pa'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of their non-existence

original: mthong ba'i spang bya rnams las grol //🔽de nas de tshe mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: mthong ba'i spang bya rnams las grol // de nas de tshe mthong ba'i lam //
translated: is seen as liberated from what is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽Then at that time, it is definitely said

original: thob pa zhes ni nges par brjod //
analyzed: thob pa zhes ni nges par brjod //
translated: that the path of seeing has been attained.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa de'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par grol bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa de'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par grol bar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the realm of reality, the nature of which is free from the subject-object dichotomy, as being liberated from the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.🔽The knowledge of emptiness🔽The bodhisattva is said to know emptiness

original: med pa'i stong pa nyid shes shing ;
analyzed: med pa'i stong pa nyid shes shing ;
translated: because he knows the emptiness of non-existence,

original: / de bzhin yod pa'i stong nyid dang // rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pas //🔽stong pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: / de bzhin yod pa'i stong nyid dang // rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pas // stong pa shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: the emptiness of existence, and the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum shes pa'i phyir stong pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum shes pa'i phyir stong pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is said to know emptiness because he knows the three kinds of emptiness.

original: med pa'i stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ;
analyzed: med pa'i stong pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ;
translated: The emptiness of non-existence is the imagined reality,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist by virtue of its own characteristic.

original: de bzhin du yod pa'i stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa'i stong pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The emptiness of existence is the relative reality,

original: de ni ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
translated: because it does not exist in the way it is imagined to exist,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni yod do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ni yod do //
translated: but it does exist by virtue of its own characteristic.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the perfect reality,🔽because it is the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of all dharmas.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mtshan med gzhi ni rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // mtshan med gzhi ni rnam rtog rnams //
translated: because they have emptiness for their own-being.

original: yang dag zad pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: yang dag zad pa yin zhes bya //
translated: The basis of signlessness is the complete cessation of conceptualization.

original: smon pa med par gyur pa ste //🔽yang dag ma yin kun rtog go //
analyzed: smon pa med par gyur pa ste // yang dag ma yin kun rtog go //
translated: The basis of wishlessness is the complete cessation of the notional attachment to the non-existent.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i gzhi ni rnam par rtog pa rnams yang dag par zad pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i gzhi ni rnam par rtog pa rnams yang dag par zad pa yin la /
translated: The basis of signlessness is the complete cessation of conceptualization.

original: smon pa med pa'i gzhi dmigs pa de ni @193b yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //🔽rgyal sras byang chub phyogs mthun par /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i gzhi dmigs pa de ni @193b yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o // rgyal sras byang chub phyogs mthun par /
translated: The basis of wishlessness should be known as the object of the complete cessation of the notional attachment to the non-existent.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad ni //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad ni //
translated: The various kinds of factors that contribute to enlightenment

original: rtag tu mthong ba'i lam de dang / lhan cig tu ni thob par 'dod //
analyzed: rtag tu mthong ba'i lam de dang / lhan cig tu ni thob par 'dod //
translated: are always obtained together with the path of insight.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad mthong ba'i lam de dang lhan cig 'thob bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad mthong ba'i lam de dang lhan cig 'thob bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the various kinds of factors that contribute to enlightenment, i.e. the applications of mindfulness, etc., are always obtained together with the path of insight.

original: gang zhig blo yis 'gro ba 'dus byas tsam //
analyzed: gang zhig blo yis 'gro ba 'dus byas tsam //
translated: Whoever understands that beings are merely compounded,

original: bdag med sdug bsngal rgyas pa tsam shes te //
analyzed: bdag med sdug bsngal rgyas pa tsam shes te //
translated: That they are devoid of self and are just the proliferation of suffering,

original: don med rang bzhin bdag lta rnams sbangs nas ;
analyzed: don med rang bzhin bdag lta rnams sbangs nas ;
translated: And who abandons the view of the useless self and its nature,

original: / bdag nyid che lta don chen rnyed pa gang //
analyzed: / bdag nyid che lta don chen rnyed pa gang //
translated: Will find the view of the great self and its great purpose.

original: 'di na bdag lta med par bdag tu blta //
analyzed: 'di na bdag lta med par bdag tu blta //
translated: Here, without the view of self, one sees the self;

original: sdug bsngal med par shin tu sdug bsngal gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par shin tu sdug bsngal gyur //
translated: Without suffering, one experiences intense suffering.

original: rang la phan byas bdag la ji lta bar //
analyzed: rang la phan byas bdag la ji lta bar //
translated: Just as one benefits oneself,

original: don kun byed la lan kyang re ba med //
analyzed: don kun byed la lan kyang re ba med //
translated: One acts for the sake of all, without any expectation of reward.

original: gang zhig grol ba mchog gis sems grol la /
analyzed: gang zhig grol ba mchog gis sems grol la /
translated: Whoever is liberated in mind by the highest liberation,

original: 'ching ba mi bzad yun yang ring por bcings //
analyzed: 'ching ba mi bzad yun yang ring por bcings //
translated: Though bound for a long time by unbearable fetters,

original: sdug bsngal mthar thug pa ni ma mthong yang //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthar thug pa ni ma mthong yang //
translated: Not seeing an end to suffering,

original: rab tu sbyor ba nyid dang byed pa nyid //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba nyid dang byed pa nyid //
translated: Applies himself and acts.

original: 'di na 'jig rten tshe gcig rang sdug bkur mi nus //
analyzed: 'di na 'jig rten tshe gcig rang sdug bkur mi nus //
translated: Here, worldly people cannot bear their own suffering for one lifetime,

original: 'jig rten gnas pa srid du gzhan sdug bsngal //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa srid du gzhan sdug bsngal //
translated: Let alone the suffering of others for as long as the world exists.

original: bsdoms pa smos ci dgos te bsam du med //
analyzed: bsdoms pa smos ci dgos te bsam du med //
translated: What need is there to mention the inconceivable?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa yin //
translated: Bodhisattvas are the opposite of that.

original: rgyal sras sems can rnams la dga' ba dang // byams pa gang yin sbyor dang mi skyo gang //
analyzed: rgyal sras sems can rnams la dga' ba dang // byams pa gang yin sbyor dang mi skyo gang //
translated: The bodhisattva’s love and compassion for sentient beings, his application and his indefatigability

original: de ni srid pa dag na ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: de ni srid pa dag na ngo mtshar che //
translated: are indeed wondrous in the world.

original: sems can bdag dang mtshungs phyir de lta'ang min //
analyzed: sems can bdag dang mtshungs phyir de lta'ang min //
translated: But that is not so, because sentient beings are the same as the self.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod de /
translated: These five verses describe the greatness of the bodhisattva who has attained the path of insight.

original: don med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag tu lta ba ni /
analyzed: don med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag tu lta ba ni /
translated: The view of self that is by nature useless is

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: the defiled view of the perishable composite.

original: bdag nyid chen po'i lta ba don chen po ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems rnyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po'i lta ba don chen po ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang mnyam pa'i sems rnyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The view of the great being is of great value, because he has attained the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings.

original: bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the view of self.

original: de ni don thams cad byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir don chen po yin no //
analyzed: de ni don thams cad byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir don chen po yin no //
translated: It is of great value, because it is the cause of the performance of all that is valuable.

original: don med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag tu lta ba med par bdag tu lta ba ni don chen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don med pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag tu lta ba med par bdag tu lta ba ni don chen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The view of self as having a useless nature is not the view of self as having a great purpose.

original: rang gi rgyud las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal med par yang sems @194a * //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal med par yang sems @194a * //
translated: Without the suffering that arises in one’s own continuum, there is the suffering that arises in the continua of all sentient beings.

original: can thams cad kyi rgyud las skyes pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: can thams cad kyi rgyud las skyes pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The suffering that arises in the continua of all sentient beings is much greater.

original: grol ba mchog ni theg pa bla na med pas sems can mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba rnams las grol la /
analyzed: grol ba mchog ni theg pa bla na med pas sems can mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba rnams las grol la /
translated: The supreme liberation is the liberation of the beings who see the path of seeing from the highest vehicle.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud las byung ba'i 'ching ba mi zad pa yun ring pos kyang bcings pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud las byung ba'i 'ching ba mi zad pa yun ring pos kyang bcings pa'o //
translated: They are bound by the endless bonds that arise in the continua of all sentient beings for a long time.

original: sems can gyi khams nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas pa'i phyir /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is infinite like space.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mthar thug pa ma mthong yang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir rab tu yang sbyor la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mthar thug pa ma mthong yang sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal mthar bya ba'i phyir rab tu yang sbyor la /
translated: Although the end of suffering is not seen, one applies oneself to the end of the suffering of sentient beings.

original: sems can tshad med pa'i don byed pa nyid do ;
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i don byed pa nyid do ;
translated: It is the benefit of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is the opposite of that.

original: de ni 'jig rten gnas pa ji srid par sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsdoms pa bkur bar nus so //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gnas pa ji srid par sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsdoms pa bkur bar nus so //
translated: He is able to bear the combined suffering of all sentient beings for as long as the world exists.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la dga' ba gang yin pa dang // phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / de'i don du sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / der sbyor ba la mi skyo ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'jig rten na shin tu ngo mtshar yang che la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la dga' ba gang yin pa dang // phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / de'i don du sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / der sbyor ba la mi skyo ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'jig rten na shin tu ngo mtshar yang che la /
translated: Whatever joy the bodhisattva has in sentient beings, whatever desire he has for their benefit and happiness, whatever application he has to that end, and whatever indefatigability he has in that application—all of that is most amazing in the world.

original: sems can thams cad bdag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ngo mtshar yang mi che'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ngo mtshar yang mi che'o //
translated: And it is not so amazing because sentient beings are the same as oneself.

original: de nas 'di ni lhag ma yi //
analyzed: de nas 'di ni lhag ma yi //
translated: Then, the rest of the stages

original: sa rnams sgom ba'i lam 'di la //
analyzed: sa rnams sgom ba'i lam 'di la //
translated: are the path of cultivation.

original: ye shes rnam pa gnyis po dag / bsgom phyir rab tu sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa gnyis po dag / bsgom phyir rab tu sbyor bar byed //
translated: On it, one applies oneself to the cultivation of the two kinds of intuition.

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes de //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes de //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition

original: sangs rgyas chos ni sbyong bar byed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos ni sbyong bar byed //
translated: purifies the qualities of a buddha.

original: gzhan ni ji bzhin rnam 'jog pa //
analyzed: gzhan ni ji bzhin rnam 'jog pa //
translated: The other is the establishment of things as they are.

original: sems can rnams ni yongs smin byed //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni yongs smin byed //
translated: It brings beings to full maturity.

original: grangs med gnyis ni rdzogs pa yis //🔽sgom pa yi ni tshar phyin te //
analyzed: grangs med gnyis ni rdzogs pa yis // sgom pa yi ni tshar phyin te //
translated: Having completed two incalculable eons,🔽he completes the path of cultivation.

original: sgom pa tha ma thob nas ni //
analyzed: sgom pa tha ma thob nas ni //
translated: Having attained the final stage of cultivation,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba //
translated: the bodhisattva is consecrated.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The vajra-like concentration

original: rtogs pas mi shigs thob nas ni //
analyzed: rtogs pas mi shigs thob nas ni //
translated: is attained through realization and is unshakable.

original: gnas gzhan gyur pa mthar thug pa //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyur pa mthar thug pa //
translated: The final transformation of the basis🔽is stainless with respect to all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med dang // gang la gnas nas sems can kun //🔽phan phyir rab tu sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun gyi dri med dang // gang la gnas nas sems can kun // phan phyir rab tu sgrub byed pa //
translated: Dwelling in that, he accomplishes

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yi //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yi //
translated: the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: go 'phang bla na med pa 'thob //
analyzed: go 'phang bla na med pa 'thob //
translated: He attains the unexcelled state🔽of omniscience.

original: 'di dag gis ni sgom pa'i lam bstan te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sgom pa'i lam bstan te /
translated: These verses show the path of cultivation.

original: yi shes rnam pa gnyis la rnam par mi rtog pa ni gang gis na bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi @194b chos rnam par sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yi shes rnam pa gnyis la rnam par mi rtog pa ni gang gis na bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi @194b chos rnam par sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Of the two kinds of knowledge, the nondiscriminative is that by which he purifies the qualities of the Buddha within himself.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: The subsequent state of mind that is attained after the supramundane state of mind is a mundane state of mind that is established in a manner that is similar to the supramundane state of mind.

original: gang gis na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is by means of this mundane state of mind that a bodhisattva ripens the virtue of sentient beings.🔽After attaining the final stage of the path of meditation through the two incalculable aeons, the bodhisattva who has received the consecration attains the vajra-like one-pointed concentration, because it cannot be destroyed by the latent propensities of conceptual thought.

original: grangs med pa gnyis kyis sgom pa'i tha ma mjug tu phyin pa thob nas dbang bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag la nyal gyis mi shigs pa'i don gyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: grangs med pa gnyis kyis sgom pa'i tha ma mjug tu phyin pa thob nas dbang bskur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag la nyal gyis mi shigs pa'i don gyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: Immediately after that, he attains the stage that is called “going far,” because he has gone a very great distance from the bodhisattva stages.🔽Immediately after that, he attains the stage that is called “unwavering,” because the perfection of wisdom causes his mind to become unwavering and unmoved.

original: de'i 'og tu gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / gang la gnas nas 'khor ba ji srid par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ston pa la sogs pas sems can rnams la phan pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go 'phang bla na med pa nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / gang la gnas nas 'khor ba ji srid par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par ston pa la sogs pas sems can rnams la phan pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go 'phang bla na med pa nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Immediately after that, he attains the stage that is called “excellent wisdom,” because he has attained the power of knowledge regarding the most excellent of all doctrinal formulations and he is able to explain them to others.🔽Immediately after that, he attains the stage that is called “cloud of Dharma,” because the meditative absorption, liberations, one-pointed concentrations, and states of composure are like clouds that cover over the mountain of the bodhisattva stages and because the rain of true Dharma fills the entire world.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa 'thob po //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa 'thob po //
translated: He attains the state of being uncontaminated by any of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de ltar mthong dka'i thub pa rtag mthong ba //
analyzed: de ltar mthong dka'i thub pa rtag mthong ba //
translated: Thus, always seeing the Sage, so difficult to see,

original: thos pa mnyam med las byung rab dang ba'i //
analyzed: thos pa mnyam med las byung rab dang ba'i //
translated: with faith born of incomparable learning,

original: shugs kyis rtag par shin tu sems tshim pa //
analyzed: shugs kyis rtag par shin tu sems tshim pa //
translated: his mind is always well satisfied by the force of that faith.

original: ji lta bur na don chen 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ji lta bur na don chen 'gyur ma yin //
translated: How could he not have great purpose?

original: chos kyi sgo la rnam par gnas pa la //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo la rnam par gnas pa la //
translated: Abiding in the door of Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs rtag mngon sum 'doms mdzad cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rtag mngon sum 'doms mdzad cing /
translated: the Tathagata always instructs him in person,

original: co nas 'dren bzhin nyes pa'i tshang tshing nas //
analyzed: co nas 'dren bzhin nyes pa'i tshang tshing nas //
translated: and like a boatman, he pulls him out of the dense jungle of faults

original: tshan gyis drangs te byang chub la 'god do //
analyzed: tshan gyis drangs te byang chub la 'god do //
translated: and gradually leads him to enlightenment.🔽The Buddhas always praise the right application of the Dharma for one’s own sake and condemn its wrong application.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag tu rang don yang dag sbyor la legs par bsngags pa dang // log par sbyor la smod mdzad gnas dang rnam 'byed lhur len mchog gi sems can la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag tu rang don yang dag sbyor la legs par bsngags pa dang // log par sbyor la smod mdzad gnas dang rnam 'byed lhur len mchog gi sems can la //
translated: They are the supreme benefactors of beings who strive for the state of peace and who strive for the state of discernment.

original: gang zhig spangs dang bsten pas bde gshegs bstan pa 'di la rnal 'byor yongs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang zhig spangs dang bsten pas bde gshegs bstan pa 'di la rnal 'byor yongs 'gyur ba //
translated: Those who practice this teaching of the Sugata, abandoning the one and cultivating the other,

original: bar chad mthun pa'i chos ni rnam pa thams cad rgyal rnams tshul bzhin 'di na ston //
analyzed: bar chad mthun pa'i chos ni rnam pa thams cad rgyal rnams tshul bzhin 'di na ston //
translated: The Dharma of the obstacles is taught by the Victorious Ones in all its aspects, in accordance with reality.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis ni gdams ngag gi che ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis ni gdams ngag gi che ba nyid ston te /
translated: These three verses show the greatness of the instructions.

original: gang gis chos kyi sgo'i rgyun la gdams ngag 'thob pa des ni rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis chos kyi sgo'i rgyun la gdams ngag 'thob pa des ni rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who receives instructions on the stream of the door of Dharma will always see the Buddhas.

original: des na gang gis na shin tu dang ba'i shugs kyis sems tshim par byas pa 'di sangs rgyas rnams rtag tu mthong ba de don chen por 'gyur ba mtshungs pa med pa'i chos thos so //🔽lhag ma ni don @195a * //
analyzed: des na gang gis na shin tu dang ba'i shugs kyis sems tshim par byas pa 'di sangs rgyas rnams rtag tu mthong ba de don chen por 'gyur ba mtshungs pa med pa'i chos thos so // lhag ma ni don @195a * //
translated: Therefore, one who is satisfied with the force of great faith and sees the Buddhas always hears the incomparable Dharma, which is of great benefit.

original: go bar zad do //
analyzed: go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rjes su bstan pa rnam pa bzhi ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ston te /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa rnam pa bzhi ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ston te /
translated: The four kinds of instruction are shown in one verse.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to superior morality,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi don la yang dag par sbyor ba la bsngags pa mdzad pa dang / log par sbyor ba la snod pa mdzad pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang gi don la yang dag par sbyor ba la bsngags pa mdzad pa dang / log par sbyor ba la snod pa mdzad pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas gnas pa dang /
translated: The Lord praises the Bodhisattva who is correctly applied to his own aim, and he censures the one who is wrongly applied.

analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa lhur len ba la de dag gi bar du gcod pa dang / de dag dang mthun pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches all the aspects of the Dharma that are adverse to, and conducive to, the stability and analysis that are based on superior mind and superior wisdom.

analyzed: gang zhig spangs pa dang bsten pas zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa dang mthun pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The phrase by avoiding and cultivating refers to the adverse and the conducive, respectively.

analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase the practice refers to the cultivation of serenity and insight.

analyzed: rgyal sras rnams ni lus dang ngag sems rang bzhin gyi //
translated: The victors’ spiritual heir is never discouraged by the three kinds of actions,

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni ldang ba'i thabs ston te /
translated: These two verses show the means of recovery.

analyzed: theg pa chen po la skyo ba dang / theg pa gzhan du lhung ba las slong ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are meant respectively for someone who is discouraged about the Great Vehicle and for someone who has fallen into another vehicle.

analyzed: yid 'byung ba ni skyo ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Discouragement is a synonym for discouragement.

translated: Action associated with the Individual Vehicle is similar to poison, etc., because it turns the mind away from the Universal Vehicle, because it severs the roots of virtue for the Universal Vehicle, because it does not produce the virtue that has not yet arisen and destroys the crop of virtue that has arisen,

original: sangs rgyas nyid phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir dug la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i phyir dug la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //

original: rtag tu rnam par mi rtog las can las min zhing //
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par mi rtog las can las min zhing //

original: las kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum la mi lta ste //
analyzed: las kyi bya ba rnam pa gsum la mi lta ste //
translated: and does not look at the three sectors of action.

original: des na 'dis ni de'i thabs yang dag bzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni de'i thabs yang dag bzung ba'i phyir //
