analyzed: las rnams dag pa mtha' yas de yi pha rol 'gro //
translated: he goes beyond the infinite purity of action.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa 'dis ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sgo nas las rnam par dag pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa 'dis ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sgo nas las rnam par dag pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: This fourth verse shows the method of purifying action by means of the complete purification of the three sectors.

original: byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang bya ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent, the action, and the object of the action are not perceived.

original: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa'i phyir ro //🔽thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa'i phyir ro // thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: It is infinite because it is inexhaustible.

original: // / pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu dbye ba'i bsdu ba'i sdom ni //
analyzed: // / pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu dbye ba'i bsdu ba'i sdom ni //
translated: This concludes the chapter on the activities of the bodhisattva who is skilled in liberative art.🔽The summary verses on the perfections:🔽Number, characteristics, order, definitions,🔽cultivation, qualities, divisions,

original: grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid go rims dang // nges pa'i tshig dang goms bya yon tan dang // de dag rab dbye bsdu dang mi @196a * //
analyzed: grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid go rims dang // nges pa'i tshig dang goms bya yon tan dang // de dag rab dbye bsdu dang mi @196a * //
translated: inclusion, resistances, and virtues

original: mthun phyogs // yon tan phan tshun rnam nges yin zhes bya //
analyzed: mthun phyogs // yon tan phan tshun rnam nges yin zhes bya //
translated: are determined as the aspects of the perfections.

original: grangs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /🔽re zhig / longs spyod dang lus phun sum tshogs ba dang // 'khor rtsom phun sum tshogs pa mngon mtho dang // rtag tu nyon mongs dbang nyid mi 'gro dang // bya ba rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: grangs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste / re zhig / longs spyod dang lus phun sum tshogs ba dang // 'khor rtsom phun sum tshogs pa mngon mtho dang // rtag tu nyon mongs dbang nyid mi 'gro dang // bya ba rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Six verses on the analysis of the number of perfections:🔽1. The perfections are six: giving, morality, patience, exertion, meditation,🔽and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
translated: The first verse shows the number of perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis ni mngon par mtho ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis ni mngon par mtho ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four perfections of generosity, morality, patience, and exertion are the four kinds of high status.

original: sbyin pas ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Generosity is the perfection of wealth.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Morality is the perfection of body.

original: bzod pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ste ;
analyzed: bzod pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ste ;
translated: Patience is the perfection of retinue,

original: 'di ltar de bstan pas tshe phyi ma la skye bo mang po dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bstan pas tshe phyi ma la skye bo mang po dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because by teaching it, one becomes dear to many people in other lives.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni rtsom pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni rtsom pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Exertion is the perfection of undertaking,

original: las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all activities are accomplished.

original: lnga pas ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba nyid de /
analyzed: lnga pas ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba nyid de /
translated: The fifth perfection is the non-subjection to addictions,

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because meditative concentration suppresses the addictions.

original: drug pas ni bya ba rnams la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: drug pas ni bya ba rnams la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The sixth perfection is the non-error in performance,

original: bya ba thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one understands all activities just as they are.

original: de ltar na mngon par mtho ba dang / de la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa dang / rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par mtho ba dang / de la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / bya ba la phyin ci ma log pa dang / rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the six perfections are established in terms of the higher realms, in terms of the absence of afflictions, in terms of the absence of error in action, and in terms of undertaking.

original: sems can don la rab brtson pa //
analyzed: sems can don la rab brtson pa //
translated: One should practice the benefit of sentient beings

original: gtong dang mi gnod bzod pas byed //🔽gnas dang grol ba gzhir bcas pas //
analyzed: gtong dang mi gnod bzod pas byed // gnas dang grol ba gzhir bcas pas //
translated: through giving, through nonviolence, and through patience.🔽One should practice one's own benefit in all aspects

original: rang don rnam pa thams cad spyod //
analyzed: rang don rnam pa thams cad spyod //
translated: through the basis of abiding and liberation.

original: ces bya ba ni gnyis pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don rnams la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dag gis go rims bzhin du gtong ba dang / mi gnod pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gnyis pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don rnams la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dag gis go rims bzhin du gtong ba dang / mi gnod pa dang /
translated: This is the second verse.

original: gnod pa byed pa bzod pas sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa bzod pas sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is correctly and thoroughly engaged in the benefit of sentient beings accomplishes the benefit of sentient beings through the three perfections of giving, morality, and patience, respectively, through giving, through nonviolence, and through tolerating violence.

original: gsum gyis ni sems gnas pa dang / rnam bar grol ba gzhi dang bcas pas rang gi don rnam pa thams cad spyod de /
analyzed: gsum gyis ni sems gnas pa dang / rnam bar grol ba gzhi dang bcas pas rang gi don rnam pa thams cad spyod de /
translated: The first three perfections are for one's own aim, the last three for the aim of others.🔽The first three perfections are for one's own aim, because one's mind becomes stabilized and liberated, together with its basis, through the perfections of giving, morality, and patience.

original: brtson 'grus la brten nas go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang / shes rab dag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la brten nas go rims bzhin du bsam gtan dang / shes rab dag gis sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir dang / mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The last three perfections are for the aim of others, because one's mind becomes stabilized and liberated, through the perfections of effort, meditation, and wisdom, respectively, in order to stabilize the mind of one who has not stabilized it and to liberate the mind of one who has stabilized it.

original: de @196b ltar na gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don las brtsams te pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: de @196b ltar na gzhan gyi don dang rang gi don las brtsams te pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Thus, the six perfections are undertaken for the aim of others and for one's own aim.

original: mi phongs pa dang rnam par mi 'tshe dang // rnam 'tshe bzod dang bya bas mi skyo dang // dga' byed legs par brjod pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: mi phongs pa dang rnam par mi 'tshe dang // rnam 'tshe bzod dang bya bas mi skyo dang // dga' byed legs par brjod pa de yi phyir //
translated: One is not impoverished, one does not harm, one endures harm, one is not weary of deeds, one delights, and one speaks well.

original: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don yin no //
translated: Thus, the aim of others is one's own aim.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: This is the third verse.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don mtha' dag ni sbyin pa la sogs pas go rims bzhin du gzhan dag la yo byad kyis mi phongs pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba bzod pa dang / grogs bya ba la skyo ba med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don mtha' dag ni sbyin pa la sogs pas go rims bzhin du gzhan dag la yo byad kyis mi phongs pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / rnam par 'tshe ba bzod pa dang / grogs bya ba la skyo ba med pa dang /
translated: The entire benefit for others of the bodhisattva comes from the six perfections, respectively, through generosity, one does not torment others with material needs; through morality, one does not torment others with immorality; through patience, one endures torments by others; through effort, one is not wearied by helping others;

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i mthus dga' bar byed pa dang / the tshom gcod pa'i sgo nas legs par brjod pa dag gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i mthus dga' bar byed pa dang / the tshom gcod pa'i sgo nas legs par brjod pa dag gis 'gyur ro //
translated: through meditation, one delights others through the power of miracles, etc.; and through wisdom, one delights others by means of good counsel through the removal of doubts.

original: de'i phyir na gzhan gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa' rang gi don du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gzhan gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa' rang gi don du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the benefit for others is the bodhisattva's own benefit,

original: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit for others is his own benefit, and because he attains great enlightenment.

original: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag gi skabs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi don mtha' dag gi skabs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Thus, the six perfections are the occasion for the entire benefit for oneself and others.

original: longs spyod mngon par mi dga' dang // rab gus gnyis la mi skyo dang // rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: longs spyod mngon par mi dga' dang // rab gus gnyis la mi skyo dang // rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: He is not attached to pleasures, he has great respect, he is not discouraged by the two, and he has the nonconceptual intuition of a yogi.

original: theg chen mtha' dag 'dir zad do //
analyzed: theg chen mtha' dag 'dir zad do //
translated: The entire Mahayana is contained in these four.

original: zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa ste //
translated: This is the fourth verse.

original: sbyin pas ni byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod rnams la mi lta ba'i phyir mngon par mi dga'o //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod rnams la mi lta ba'i phyir mngon par mi dga'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is not attached to pleasures because of his generosity.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa dag la shin tu gus pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa dag la shin tu gus pa nyid do //
translated: The bodhisattva has great respect for the precepts because he has taken the vow.

original: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis ni go rims bzhin du sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dge ba la rab tu sbyor ba dang gnyis la skyo ba med do //
analyzed: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyis ni go rims bzhin du sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dge ba la rab tu sbyor ba dang gnyis la skyo ba med do //
translated: He is not discouraged by the two, by sentient beings and by the non sentient world, respectively, because of his patience and his effort.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: He has the nonconceptual intuition of a yogi, which is included in serenity and insight, because of his meditation and his wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po mtha' dag ni 'di tsam du zad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mtha' dag ni 'di tsam du zad do //
translated: The entire Mahayana is contained in these four.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po kun bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po kun bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the universal vehicle, there are six perfections.

original: yul rnams la ni ma chags lam //
analyzed: yul rnams la ni ma chags lam //
translated: The path of nonattachment to objects,

original: de thob rnam g-yeng sdom pa'i lam //
analyzed: de thob rnam g-yeng sdom pa'i lam //
translated: the path of restraint from distraction in attaining that,🔽the path of nonabandonment of beings, of increase,

original: sems can mi gtong 'phel ba dang // sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gzhan //
analyzed: sems can mi gtong 'phel ba dang // sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gzhan //
translated: and of purification of obscurations.

original: zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth verse.

original: de la sbyin pa ni yul rnams la ma chags pa'i lam yin te /🔽gtong ba la goms pas de la chags @197a * //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni yul rnams la ma chags pa'i lam yin te / gtong ba la goms pas de la chags @197a * //
translated: Therein, generosity is the path of nonattachment to objects,

original: pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one becomes free from attachment to those objects through becoming accustomed to giving them away.

original: tshul khrims ni de thob pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yang dag par sdom pa rnams kyi lam yin te /🔽dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa la yul thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni de thob pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yang dag par sdom pa rnams kyi lam yin te / dge slong gi sdom pa la gnas pa la yul thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Morality is the path of restraint from distraction in attaining that,

original: las kyi mtha'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: las kyi mtha'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because all distractions of activity do not occur for one who is established in the vow of a bhikṣu in order to attain the object.

original: bzod pa ni sems can mi gtong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni sems can mi gtong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Patience is the path of nonabandonment of beings,🔽because one does not give up on beings who offend.

original: gnod pa byed pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyis yid mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyis yid mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not discouraged by the suffering of all those who are harmed.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba 'phel ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba 'phel ba'i lam ste /
translated: Exertion is the path of the increase of virtue,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la de 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa la de 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that increases for one who has undertaken exertion.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba dag gi lam yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba dag gi lam yin te /
translated: Meditation and wisdom are the paths of the purification of obscurations,

original: de gnyis kyis nyon mangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis nyon mangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two purify the afflictive and the objective obscurations.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni thabs te /
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni thabs te /
translated: The path is the means.

original: de ltar na lam gyi rnam ba thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi rnam ba thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: Thus, in terms of all the aspects of the path, there are six perfections.

original: bslab gsum dbang du mdzad nas ni ;
analyzed: bslab gsum dbang du mdzad nas ni ;
translated: In terms of the three trainings,

original: / rgyal bas pha rol phyin pa drug / yang dag bshad de dang po gsum //🔽tha ma gnyis kyis rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: / rgyal bas pha rol phyin pa drug / yang dag bshad de dang po gsum // tha ma gnyis kyis rnam pa gnyis //
translated: the Victor has declared six perfections,🔽three for the first,🔽two for the last,

original: gcig ni gsum car la yang gtogs //
analyzed: gcig ni gsum car la yang gtogs //
translated: and one for both.

original: zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth verse.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ste /
translated: The training in superior morality consists of the first three perfections.

original: tshogs dang bcas pa dang 'khor dang bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs dang bcas pa dang 'khor dang bcas pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it includes the group and the retinue.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod la mi ltan tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod la mi ltan tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
translated: One who is not concerned with wealth takes up morality.

original: yang dag par blangs pa ni bzod pas gshe ba la slar mi gshe ba la sogs pas srung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa ni bzod pas gshe ba la slar mi gshe ba la sogs pas srung ngo //
translated: Having taken it up, one protects it with patience, by not returning abuse for abuse, and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The two kinds are

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in superior mind and the training in superior wisdom.

original: de ni tha ma gnyis kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: de ni tha ma gnyis kyis bsdus te /
translated: They are included in the last two perfections,

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: in the order of concentration and wisdom.

original: gcig pu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bslab pa gsum car du yang gtogs te /
analyzed: gcig pu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bslab pa gsum car du yang gtogs te /
translated: The perfection of effort is included in all three trainings,

original: brtson 'grus ni thams cad kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni thams cad kyi grogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because effort is the companion of all.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug ste /
translated: Six verses on the analysis of the characteristics of the transcendences.

original: sbyin pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: it is endowed with nonconceptual intuition,

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
translated: it fulfills all wishes,

original: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
analyzed: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
translated: and it ripens beings in three ways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics of the bodhisattvas generosity are fourfold.🔽It is the opposite of stinginess, because it is the abandonment of stinginess.

original: ser sna @197b spangs pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / chos bdag med pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par mir tog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / gang ci 'dod pa de la de sbyin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ser sna @197b spangs pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / chos bdag med pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir / rnam par mir tog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa dang / gang ci 'dod pa de la de sbyin pa'i phyir //
translated: It is endowed with nonconceptual intuition, because it is endowed with the realization of the selflessness of things.🔽It fulfills all wishes, because it gives whatever is wished to those who request it.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sbyin pas bsdus nas theg pa gsum la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sbyin pas bsdus nas theg pa gsum la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It ripens beings in three ways, because it attracts beings by generosity and then matures them in the three vehicles according to their dispositions.🔽Morality is the opposite of immorality,

original: tshul khrims mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: it is endowed with nonconceptual intuition,🔽it fulfills all wishes,🔽and it ripens beings in three ways.

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
translated: It fulfills all wishes

original: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
analyzed: sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum //
translated: And ripens beings in three ways.

original: bzod pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
analyzed: bzod pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang // rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan //
translated: Patience is the opposite of that. It is endowed with nonconceptual wisdom

original: 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed //
